column2: Extra costs The box isn't clear when it describes what's included in a package. I didn't like their offering "add ons" while I was completing my return. I had to upgrade which cost much more than if I had purchased that set to start with. Then by the time I paid for e-filing the state return, I could have hired someone to do the taxes for me for less. I'll either use a cheaper brand next year or will hire it done. extra costs all over the place

Extra costs The box isn't clear when it describes what's included in a package. I didn't like their offering "add ons" while I was completing my return. I had to upgrade which cost much more than if I had purchased that set to start with. Then by the time I paid for e-filing the state return, I could have hired someone to do the taxes for me for less. I'll either use a cheaper brand next year or will hire it done. extra costs all over the place

Used to be good Had to go back through parts of federal (continue, continue, continue, continue, continue) and ALL of state, TWICE (continue...) to get TT 2014 to accept my return for submission. The "errors" it was looping on were "missing data" in fields that were supposed to be ZEROS. Even the online help indicated that others had the same struggle, but the "reply" from TT was useless. Errors put me in loop, but it wasn't MY error - it was TurboTax!

What a grind! Investment income. Stock sale. You do not have a catagory for long term sale of asset with no cost available. Item box x on 1099 Div says should be moved to box E. IRS says move to box E. TT says there is an error that entry MUST have a cost. Since cost not available, and if put in Box, it would be taxed as a short term gain, your programmers have made an error. Spent off and on over an hour with your tech support.

column1: Your final final review says all fixed, you can file it, but when I go to print it it says I STILL have errors!!! Too many ads.

You have removed option to opt out of upgrading by making certain forms very difficult to find. YOU MUST leave me an option to NOT UPGRADE. I used to be able to do ALL forms with the basic version. Sorry I got the homeowners deluxe version. IF I have to do have of the form in form view, why should I buy it at all?

Car page. I did NOT enter any expenses for an auto this year, but had to go thru the nonsense of filling out the form. Why not a box to check that says "No car expenses this year?" And then not have to fill in forms that will be blank.

Called phone number on website for Turbo Tax and got the voice mail of a person out on maternity leave. No other option. Had to search entire site to get ahold of cust service. I est. it took me nearly 15 minutes to locate a phone number that worked.

I have been using TT since 1990. You change the order of questions too often. Why not have a check list of the questions that you will ask so we can fill in the answers BEFORE we start the actual return..Ties up the computer and takes hours to complete a return.

Why is it a BIG DEAL to choose a nickname?? So what if there are more than one John Does? You honestly think I'm going to give you something I don't like just to satisfy your computer??? Your review just went down two more stars over the ddd nickname thing. Errors again in TT

column2: Poor service 2014 This is the first year that I would say I would not use Turbo Tax again. Why pay for automative services when you can not e-file! I has been a waste of $188.45. Lack of service

Great Federal. Disliked State Overall the Federal filing was very straight forward for filing jointly. My problem came from my wife and I working in separate states and the requirement to file separately. The process is complex to perform and the secondary tax payer cannot efile and has to mail their forms in stating security as the reason. I ultimately had to create 3 turbotax files to complete. It would seem that you should be able to be able to do it all within one file. using separate files made it very challenging when looking at which items are separated so you are not double taxed. I will probably have to have my state returns reviewed/amended by a professional. poorly done for people filing in multiple states

Too Many Bugs I itemize. In the Other Deductions & Credits category, $15k of "Other Deductions" was automatically being entered from nowhere. After paying and downloading for 2014 Premier I still had the problem. My son's Federal return has now been rejected twice for the wrong ePIN, and now the tax filing is late! Really .... really perturbed (pst) off now! Starting to lose faith in TurboTax. Quality of product seems to be waning. Incorrect data appears
Did not allow me to efile state return  This year Turbo Tax would not allow me to file my Maryland state return. Fee for state filing too much

THIS PROGRAM IS WORTHLESS I can't get the program to work. I need to send in an amended form for my federal and a printed form for my state. I follow the instructions and hit a dead end for filing the amended form. I never could print any copies other than electronic ones. This messed me up with my state form and they are now on my case to file. I have used Turbo Tax for years....NEVER AGAIN The 2015 version is a nigtmare

E-FIle I went through all of the steps to file my taxes. I aded my AGI and paid for the program and realized 15 days later that nothing was submitted. Now I have to pay penalties and late charges to the IRS because of Turbotax's failure to submit. I will never use this program again. In the end, I was charged another 1,000 on top of the 2137.00 I already owe to the IRS for a mistake that I was not at fault for. Program malfunction
I filed my returns on 4/15. came back to your site today as i hadn't received my NY STate refund and your site said there were NEVER sent ?

column1: What the heck ? Been using your service for years, but not next year. Incredibly disappointed at this snafu as i KNOW if hit the send button and actually mailed the checks to pay after printing everything out.
WHY WOULDNT YOU SEND ME SOME TYPE OF NOTICE IF I PAID, PRINTED EVERYTHING OUT AND DID EVERYTHING EXCEPT SEND THEM IN DIGITALLY ? REALLY ??????
MANY COMPLIANED ABOUT YOUR SERVICE THIS YEAR. I AM NOW ONE OF THEM. THIS WAS HORRIBLE SHAME ON YOU

column2: Continuing the DE error - your package does not permit me to change the status of non-DE municipal bond income from tax-free to taxable. Also, the pricing fiasco you pulled on us was extremely disheartening. No alert for when I thought I filed but apparently had not pressed the last button. The state form for DE has an error.

Was great ... last year I needed to fix my return. In the past, whenever this happened TurboTax took to right to the place I needed to go. This time it simply told me to open my form 8965 and fix it. I could not find any way to open this form.

column1: So I went to customer support. They said they would call me back in 60 minutes. It said to call back if no one calls in 60 minutes. The page also included a number to call. It was not clear that I was suppose to call first to get in the queue, so I wasted 90 minutes waiting for a call which was never coming.

After I called back and got in the queue, I waited for another 150% of the quoted wait time. Still no call back. I called again and got put back in the queue again. Shortly there after, I got a call back, the agent didn't know how to open the form, only how to delete it.

After finally getting everything fixed, I got another call back (from the final time I had called them). They didn't know they had already talked to me. Their new customer service system is worse that the Obama Care web page for all the problems it has. I'll give them another chance next year to see if they can get back to their old glory, otherwise, I'll be looking for new tax software. ... Only not this year

column2: Not worth the higher price this year I think it is pathetic you require the purchase of Home and Business software simply to be able to file a schedule C on an otherwise fairly simple return. I will look elsewhere next year and get an earlier start. Held captive to use ridiculously inflated program the next year

worst experience there was too many changes to the software this year. I still havent been able to complete my state tax return even though when i purchased the software it said I was supposed to get one state return free. Turbotax is a rip off too any changes
I ordered Mac version. You sent PC version. I want a refund.

Not as good as I was told. I paid newly 60 dollars to have all my returns done, two of which I has to print out and mail in anyways, AND my federal keeps getting rejected when nobody I know has used my social on their taxes for that reason. NEARLY FIVE TIMES I'VE BEEN REJECTED SO FAR WITH NO INFORMATION PAST THAT IT ISN'T GONG THROUGH EXCEPT FOR MY SOCAL POSSIBLY BEING USED ON SOMEBODY ELSE'S TAXES. THIS IS THE ONLY REASONING I'VE GOTTEN AND IT'S OVERLY AGGRAVATING BECAUSE NOBODY'S USED ME. Returns have been rejected too many times for my liking and have yet to be accepted.

Bad Changes you have changed your product for the worst. it is unclear at points within the software, and not set up the same way in its installation - ie: one cannot open the program from the short cut and reach the file in progress. there are other awkward transitions and cloudy issues and directions. I have been a Turbo Tax user for about 10 years, and this will be my last. you have taken a good product and made it bad. even your insistence on using a "nick" name on this review is stupid. Terrible overall changes

Could not enter Wis non-res tax withheld Until this year I was a delighted TurboTax user. This year, I did not like the new format and would suggest offering former users the option of sticking with the old format - at least during a transition year. The new format on Premier was not transparent - I could not go to forms when needed to check specific items.Worst of all, despite hours of effort using desktop TurboTax Premier version ($85), I Could not enter Wis non-res tax withheld. After more than 6 hours of trying on my own and then a cordial 45 min phone discussion with your TurboTax on expert, the issue still went unresolved. This caused me to have to file for an extension for all of my taxes - not ideal, to say the least. Your person said he rebatted my $85 and told me to get TurboTax Delux were I could see the forms. So I then had to buy TurboTax Delux - at least that offered the forms option - where, by myself, I figured out how to sidestep Turbotax automated system (by going directly to the forms and searching out the place for withholding - not at all evident - another 30 mins wasted) to finally get credit for my Wis non res tax withheld on my Wis tax form. Next year, if I don't switch to another brand, I will buy TurboTaxDelux I guess because of the bug in TT Premier. I don't understand this oversight by TurboTax. It cost me hours and hours of wasted, frustrating time. Not a happy camper here at all. I finally did get my taxes in. Could not enter Wis non-res tax withheld; do not like new format in general

I have used Turbo Tax for about 15+ years while completing taxes for my family and friends. This year was very frustrating. I was unable to download my free state or purchase an additional state. I was also unable to e-file any returns. I spent over three hours on the phone with your techs to download the free state, purchase the additional state and to e-file one return.

column1: Your techs were very patient, professional and knowledgeable.
However, I will not be using your product next year.
D. Walker

column2: too expensive Good expert support. He fixed the problem. I had to pay an additional $30 to get the program that included investments. This is a rip-off. I had to go to expert support to fix a problem in turbo tax
This program has gone down hill I have been a loyal user of Turbo Tax since it was a DOS based program. Well I think NO MORE!!!.

column1: It used to be Deluxe did everything.
Then I had to upgrade to Premier because I sold stocks.
Now I have to upgrade to home and business to do a very simple schedule C.
Price goes up and functionality goes down.
Now I could live with some of this. But now all the help does is take you to the user forums - no real help available.
The functionality for dealing with K-1s is broken especially when a disposition is involved.
It is harder and harder to find where data comes from and how it is populated.
I will be trying one of the other programs next year. Increase in cost, requiring higher versions for basic stuff, NO HELP worth using

column2: Error Code R0000-902-01 I received an error code. R0000-902-01 That appears as if my taxes have already been filed. I had not file them prior to doing in on your site 4/15/15 I went online to the IRS site and set up an account to check. They haven't received anything as of 4/16

column1: I am not sure if perhaps the TurboTax electronic transaction has triggered this error.
Please advise as I need to remedy this immediately or file for an extension if possible. This year i received an error. Now late although filed electronically

column2: Liars The whole time I pressed the free buttons I did NOT. Want to pay but somehow at the end you guys make it seem like its free then I owed 100$ I wouldn't recommend to anyone u guys are liars Con you into buying

Glad you came to your senses The initial release of TurboTax Deluxe did not include, as it has in all the previous years I used TurboTax, the section for figuring interest, dividends and I believe Schedule B, leaving me perplexed and frustrated with the obvious manipulation to "get more money."

column1: Fortunately, that was changed before I totally switched away from TurboTax. I felt that was very underhanded and "money driven," just trying to get us to pay more for less service.
Other than that, the program works quite well. Thank you. Sometimes does not fully explain problems when smart check shows an area to be fixed

column2: ok 2015 e file had to pay for certain stuff, asked to upgrade to many times and gotten strict with after i did not upgrade and even tho i seen my neighbor file and it did not ask her to pay 29.95 for state it was included for free and asked me for a pin when it never for my neighbor its really a bad idea to file this way upgrades, pay for services and not up to date electronicaly

I hope that there will come a time when it will only take one hour or less to file a return,not the nearly six hours I spent. in the past turbo delux covered investment reporting, . In many spots the process is very confusing.
Apparently, our return that was finished on Turbo Tax on April 13 was never actually e-filed. This is just one-more instance where we found the Turbo-Tax process to be much too complicated.

column1: Another example that I just encountered: trying to get an acceptable nickname! Too, Too compluicated

column2: Annoyed about e-File I find it annoying that some of the labeling is misleading. In the VA state return one of the deduction items lists "VA Prepaid College Tuition Plan". But you have to click into the category to find out that this is ALSO where REGULAR 529 payments are put, which have NOTHING to do with prepaid tuition plans. Irritating. This kind of thing happened a few times in the Fed return as well. Why would I want to go down the "Prepaid" path if I do not have a "prepaid" plan? Well, turns out I freakin' had to. Why not just say ALL 529 plans??? That IS what it was, after all.

column1: Next, for the IRAs, why not ask me if I want TT to solve for the max IRA I can have, then let me tweak it? Instead I have to tell it how much I theoretically put in, and then jump through all of the freakin' hoops to then find out I don't qualify for that much, or that I cannot do a Roth, or only part can go into a Roth. C'mon Intuit, you can't ask if I have a Roth and a traditional IRA, then solve for me how much I can set aside, THEN ask the amount? You cannot do that right there in the Q&A as I waltz through the program?? Hire better programmers.

Next, I am especially ticked off that I cannot e-file my state return after I have e-filed my Fed return. In VA, the state return is not due until May 1, and the day I did my Fed return I did not feel like slogging through the state as well. I did not see ANYWHERE a warning that I would not be able to e-file the state return later. This TORQUES ME OFF! In 2015 I can dump my tax returns up to your cloud, but Turbo Tax isn't smart enough to keep track of the fact that I already e-filed the Fed return???? Why??? Gimme a break, you guys! I'm a long time TT user, but this could push me to Klipinger or the like. And I pay for the Home and Business edition, which costs me a hundred bucks each year. For that I cannot at least have the option to e-file my state taxes LATER, WHEN THEY ARE ACTUALLY DUE??!!! Very annoying.

Gotta say this may have been the worst experience I have had with TT, and I have been using it for more than a decade. Too many misleading labels; cannot e-file state return if Fed return already e-filed

column2: Disapointed I have not received my return check because my SS# was used. I got a police report and mailed to IRS, they finally stated that they would send my return. I am still waiting. Not happy at all that I have had to go through so much. Not a happy camper at all. My return was done early in March and I have not received my return yet. My Social Security # was comprimised .

Good Concept This was my first time using it. When submitting and paying by Visa, it looked like it was filed and I was finished. I became concerned when I checked on why my state tax was not deducted and found out my return was NOT submitted before the April 15 deadline.

column1: Why is there not an email sent out alerting me? Now I will have to pay penalties even though I filed a week Before the deadline.
My Turbo Tax firms stayed in limbo and I had no way of knowing this!
I am Very upset about this! See my review please

column2: 70good returns I am having problems with my e-mail and have not had access to my account. I think it would be easier if I felt more comfortable with the computer. And had access to my e-mail. I hopefully will have a better experience next time. Thanks difficult to access areas difficult for someone who is not good on conputers

Frustrated I thought my tax return had been sent weeks ago, only to find out that something wasn't right and the return had not gone through....which makes my return late. The system is not clear about the final process

turbotax handling of nonresident state is horrible Did my federal + NJ with no issues, then got a K-1 from an estate and had to do a non-resident form for NY, and that was a disaster from the start. It did not correctly transfer in simple stuff like the taxpayer info and the tax year from the federal form into the NY taxpayer info form.

column1: So then it was asking questions like "did blank have any income in tax year blank"; was especially bad if you had to pick who something belonged to and both choices for names were blank.
So I switch to forms, and it says there are errors with the NY taxpayer info form so I fill it in manually; that gets rid of the error, but really doesn't seem to fix the issues.
But I make it thru everything, all the error checking and audits, and go to file, pay for filing and get to the absolute last step of clicking on the button to transmit the returns
AND THEN it complains you can't fill in the info in the NY taxpayer info form, it has to be imported.
SO WHY DOES IT WAIT UNTIL THEN TO CHECK THAT???
So I go back and remove the info I filled in,
and then it complains that it is missing again.
So I go back to federal and walk thru everything again,
go back to NJ and walk thru everything again,
go back to NY and walk thru everything again;
Luckily going thru everything a second time seems to have
made it import the Federal taxpayer info into NY,
and now I can file.
I'm seriously going to look at other tax programs next year.
Especially after having to pay $39.95 for a second state!
That's crazy. nonresident state was a disaster

column2: turbo tax is confused I have used turbo tax for years, but wont again. the software got stuck and could not provide me solutions for its questions. the software also indicated that my taxes had been files, I have a printed copy of the statement but the taxes were not filed so now we are paying penalties and interest. the dang software gets stuck and provide no help on how to solve issues

My refund was never filed....??? Now - my taxes are late - how did this happen? I got a clear indication that they were filed. I cannot believe that these were never sent. This years taxes never got filed although I did get charged on my credit card for the state

Thought I was done!!! Was not!!! I thought my taxes were done even mailed in my payment. Turns out they were not done and now I'm a month late! I just happened to check back because I had a bad feeling that they were not done even though I recieved a congratulations on completing the process!!! I'm very disappointed and angry about this situation. I thought I filed in time and turns out my return was not complete. They were not complete, now I'm late!!!

turbo tax Support is the worst. advertises being able to contact customer service, but even with the software they make it almost impossible to find a phone number and will always redirect to web page with input only from customers (and not usually applicable to your situation). software has not transfered from previous years (for the past 5 years) as they advertise (and of course you can't get customer service). they are always trying to upsell more services to maximize their $ and delete parts of the software to force you to buy more expensive versions. have been using turbo tax for 15 years and almost every year finish with a bad taste about it. since it doesn't transfer anyway and with no customer service, next year for sure i will try a different software. It's just how they treat loyal customers. does not transfere from past years(5), will always try to upsell.
Turbo Tax review  brings data in from other sites

Turbo Tax Chaos The software is great - Your trying to sneak in a price increase by charging for a schedule C without notifying purchaser was smarmy at best - I've lost trust in TurboTax and will look elsewhere next year for my tax prep software - I have used TurboTax since at least 2009, and maybe before. I have a funny feeling next year will be rough for TurboTax $50 and no Schedule C? Credit for Schedule C if you fill out this form? Later purchasers get Schedule C for free?

Put the screws to us I will never use this again. I have used this for the last several years and last year I bought the program and ended up paying twice as much. This year we are screwed because I printed the return witch has always been the last step, but this year when I printed the return the site closed and charged me more than last year now I find out it didn't send. this is wrong didn't file

Slow support Departments do not coordinate information if you need help. I spent a total of 150 minutes and on hold while transferred 5 times before I got someone who could answer my question. Non-existent customer service
Disappointed for the first time! For the first time -- after using TT for more than a decade -- I had significant concerns with the product.

column1: 1) I was almost done with everything (using TT Deluxe as always) when I tried to enter my K-1 information and was forced to pay $24.99 to upgrade to Premier. As a regular, long-term customer, you should have had some way to lest me know about this product change other than a last-minute surprise.

2) On top of that, I am still unable to e-file my state return because of a software bug that was reported online more than 2 months ago and still has not been fixed. I spent 1 hour on the phone yesterday, both on hold and speaking with some. Yet, have not yet solved the problem. I'm about to try again.
Still think its the best of its kind, but hate to see TT go downhill like this. Surprise charges and software bugs

column2: Overseas residents The online service works well until, as an American living abroad, one has to enter overseas addresses. The forms are incapable of dealing with an address that does not have a US State and Zip Code. Also does not accept 1099R with a overseas address. Finally it is impossible to pay for the service with a US credit card that has an overseas billing address.

column1: Not very 21st, century!!!! Overseas addresses and credit cards

column2: Please, I just want answers. I already filed my return 3/30/15, i have a COPY in my records from Turbo Tax, I was wondering why i had yet to receive my return; I called the IRS, they could not give me information & suggested i contact you, i went ahead and signed on my turbo tax account after finding no number to call/contact, IT SAID MY RETURN WAS STILL IN PROGRESS?? I don't believe this is an inappropriate attitude. I want answers, why did turbo tax state i was complete/done, then stated i was not complete/done? Now my return has been sent extremely late. Now I'm not in compliance with the IRS.

column1: Also, why has TT not worked on merging 2 emails? I'm sure you can merge emails with a couple security questions--you already have security features and all of our sensitive data. Overall, turbo tax made my years tax return a nightmare, and i don't even have a complicated return! I have never filed a late return and am so embarrassed and concerned with this status.

Please fix these issues. Please don't make anyone go through this nonsense, I have a copy from Turbo Tax stating my return was e-filed 3/30/15! How is that possible i had to do this again 4/28/15? Please let me know there's an actual human being somewhere out there reading this. I just wanted to talk to a human, not to yell at them, but to genuinely answer my questions.

Im at work, but If i could, I would upload a picture of the dated document from Turbo Tax (TT) i printed with the 3/30/15 date stating i was complete and my return was e-filed. absolutely no humans to talk to, cannot merge emails, false information of tax return provided to me the user, etc.

column2: Extort Money Charge me 39.99 to down load the state then charge another 29.99 to file the state.

column1: The cost to file Indiana was more was more than the cost of the original software
Once the return is done of cause you are going to pay to file it.
I will just have to use taxact or OLT next year and make sure I tell everyone else to use them instead of turbo tax that lures you in with low price
Thank you for the high cost. hidden cost

column2: Revisiting a rejected state return The process to fix a rejected pin/AIG is too cryptic.

column1: The question regarding school expenses was too easy to miss. I did have "a student"...I had four students totally more that $850. Software should point more directly.
I probably won't use state next year.

column2: Bait and Switch Turbotax is still the good product that I have faithfully used for over ten years, but having to pay DOUBLE the price just to enter a Schedule C means I am going to be buying the H & R Block product next year. Sorry! Sayonara. Underhanded "gotcha" marketing techniques

I payed for the program then had to pay more I paid $60 plus tax for the Deductions and & Homeowners Deluxe edition then have to pay $43 for an additional state then on top of that $24.99 for each state efiled as well as $34.99. You've got to be kidding me!!! Not to mention the fact that I already paid once for an additional state: Order number: TTDW16985903662

column1: Order date: Apr 14, 2015

Total charges: $42.69 and had logged into my existing account to do so the 1st time but was unable to complete due to errors that needed to be reviewed, which took some time due to my schedule. That's ridiculous!!! Why didn't your program recognize my initial payment for the form!!!??? I expect a refund for one of the amounts of $42.69 the additional fees outside of the cost of the program

column2: Not the best TT year, but still ok Had to override too often to fix problems with multipile stock sales purchased at different times. Transfers to multiple lots worksheets Parts II, III and IV was inconsistent and sometimes just wrong.

column1: Also, tough to handle when the number of shares got too big and finally figured out that I had to divide by 1,000 and muliply the price 1,000. No room to tell IRS about that, so had to wing it. Also, could you please give an efile option to send some of the worksheets and calculations to the IRS to help explain to them?
I have used TT successfully for many years and really feel it is valuable, but when it gets a little complicated, then users must be wary and extra careful.
Thanks a lot, TT made several errors in transferring to multiple lots worksheet and on to Sch. D. Poor execution when no 1099-B's.

column2: TurboTax used to be better... this will be the last time I e-file with Turbotax.

column1: It's now just as expensive as going to a tax professional's office & having them fill out the forms.
$94 for a Federal & State 1040EZ is pretty ridiculous. H&R Block is now cheaper...
What's the point of E-filing if you're going to get gouged? It's now just as expensive as going to a tax professionals office & having them fill out the forms.

column2: horrible no help line horrible they have no customer service charged my cc twice
disappointed with service I authorize and trusted Turbo tax to pay my taxes, i gave my info, but on payment was made.

column1: I call 5 days after I paid because no money came out of my checking, was told to wait 10 more days.
As of today still not paid.
Call twice, after the second call, was told know they didn't pay them I needed to pay them today.
Don't trust Turbo Tax, I should have gone to the IRS site.
Never again!!1 I will never use Turbo Tax to pay my taxes!!!!

column2: It works, but they use sneaky tactics for your $. Turbo tax works well. The system they use is pretty much flawless, BUT... there are frequent interruptions where they suggest that you upgrade to their "PLUS" package. I'd go as far as saying that they trick you into buying their services. I used the FREE edition package, and more than twice they suggested that I use the PLUS edition, all times I declined the offer. I'm not a business owner, I get no special tax-deductions; I have the most basic tax returns on the planet... comparatively.

column1: By the time I was checking out, I owed nearly $60.00. So much for free. It took me about 15 minutes to figure out that because I chose to pay for my $29.99 State returns with my federal refund, they tacked on an additional $29.99. Not once did they warn me of this, I had to do in depth research and site-browsing. Beware. Sneaky Upgrading Tactics, Too many interruptions

column2: Mr Also. I started with the apr14 50% off coupon and a salde price of $71,99.......the online program had forced use of BUSIN ESS when it was not needed. I was promised a $25 CREDIT, n othing has appeared on my account as of today:

Dispute/Inquire about this Charge Called for help threetimes/ got cut off 2. Third try explained I was in NY and should not have been charged for filing,

column2: Problematic Besides the obvious major problem of Deluxe not having the correct forms to do my taxes as in the past many years, it hit me with some choices in the walk through that were misleading and repetitive of earlier inputs. That threw me for a loop and the choice I made was extremely costly. The one click erases my reported incomes of certain 1099's and proved so excruciatingly impossible to correct that I just abandoned that attempt and named it "Abandoned attempt" so I wouldn't go back into it. It took me only 1 1/2 hours the second time compared to 2 1/2 hours the first time because it was difficult to figure out the first time what it was really asking for me to enter. I have a self-employed business, a rental farm, some royalties, and retirement income. Deluxe would not handle that and I had to spent the full amount to buy the small business TurboTax. Wasted my money!!! They planned it that way and no amount of apology can make up for the deceit and intentional misrepresentation that they promoted. I do not recommend TurboTax because they are a greedy company who want more money and didn't care for their repeat clientele. The others are cheaper and use TurboTax information from a previous tax return as well. Perhaps the others will increase their share by TurboTax's blatant disregard to their customers. I honestly don't know when I have been so let down and angered by a company! Had a major misdirection in it's prompting and had to start over after 3 hours of working on it

Poor Company I had to call the IRS about something and they asked my if I filed my 2014 taxes. I said yes, and I used Turbo Tax. They said no you didn't. filed late i filed my taxes on 4/14/15, or so i thought. when i checked the irs to see when i should expect my refund they said no match. i had printed everything out and find out 2 weeks later that i wasn't done filing. i received several annoying e mails to tell me how many days left down to 2 days left. so why not send me one on the last day if it hadn't gone through yet. i am quite upset about this and will probably use a didn't means of filing for 2015 taxes. no email telling me my taxes were not sent yet.

Double charged! I really do like using Turbo Tax. However, the software package that I bought provided me with one FREE State e-filing. When I got to the end and ready to submit it charged me. Then when I became so frustrated and just succumbed to the fact I was going to have to pay or risk losing what I did (I was just personally afraid of that) I chose the option to charge my debit and it wouldn't even begin to link me to that option and instead charged an additional amount because i had to choose the option to hold from tax refund. So there goes 50$ dollars and I already paid 50$ plus for the CD. Not happy. Only complaint I have EVER had with Turbo Tax! Some not good "improvements" It is good software for getting return completed, but for some reason there were many instances where I was not certain it transferred data from my 2013 return. This made it confusing at times. Then the whole debacle of moving simple Schedule C activity to another higher priced software was annoying, as is the high cost of additional state software ($49.99 same as basic Deluxe package with 1 state, and the high price for filing state returns ($24.99 ea). Might as well hire someone to do it all for me. May not use in future. Data transfer from 2013; Sch.C debacle; high cost of additional state and cost of state filing (2 x $24.99)

Great with Feds, but issues with state Using TurboTax Premier for a number of years and have to admit that entering updated data was the easiest and fastest ever. The problem came when e-filing. We've done this for a number of years as well, but this year it was screwy from the start. Paid for the Iowa state return to be e-filed, as we have done in previous years, hit the button to e-file... The Feds acknowledge receiving, but Iowa says it has not been transmitted, yet. Problem with going back and retransmitting Iowa is you can't. Both Fed and State have to be filed together. So, in the e-file section it says my state return hasn't been transmitted, but in the printing section it says it has and not to send a paper return. The customer service section was a labyrinth of frustration/futility. While I've been a satisfied customer for years, my calm is being tested.

column1: So, now as state filing deadlines approach I'm having to contact the state department of revenue as to whether they received the e-filed tax forms or not, send paper forms, or file an extension. State taxes - not so smooth with e-filing

column2: Good overall; Iowa and Foreign Income, not so much I have income from outside the USA. TT makes it incredibly clunky and confusing to enter this information, expenses, deductions, taxes paid, etc. The step-by-step breaks down and the prompts for what to enter (or not!) are woefully incomplete. For example, I had carry-over Foreign Tax Paid from previous years that TT clearly recognized...but I had to re-enter anyway! That involved digging out old forms, etc. I should not have to do that! I also had to twice-enter other info about my foreign income, deductions, etc. I remain very uncertain as to whether this was all done appropriately. Not good, TT -- and it is fix-able, if you care enough to do so. You need to clean this up, please.

column1: ALSO: I file a return in two states. Michigan state stuff seemed okay; Iowa, on the other hand, had a few deficient areas (especially regarding my having to exit the program to look stuff up!) I know Iowa is a relatively small state, etc. -- but an upgrade is in order, TT. Please care enough to do so.

Finally: It is good that you claim that you are fixing the "You file Schedule C so now you have to buy a more expensive TT product" debacle in future years; okay. But SHAME on you for being so arrogant, dismissive of your clientele, and flat-out nakedly greedy in the first place. The only reason you're un-doing it is because you were massively called on it -- this is another log on that substantial woodpile. Shame on you for being so greedy.

Bottom-line: Due to the aforementioned deficiencies, deferred maintenance of your software, and stunning greed and arrogance -- after lots of years of using TurboTaz I WILL BE CONSIDERING USING OTHER TAX PREP SOFTWARE NEXT YEAR with a serious eye toward adoption and change. Foreign Income! (And Iowa state....)

column1: For example:
1. I had a small home business--I had to upgrade (wasn't so last year;
2. I had a small amount of royalty income--I had to upgrade (I don't recall having to do that last year);
3. I had to file in a second state--had to pay more for the second state;

4. Filing--I had to pay to e-file each state at a rate of $24.99/state; It's a steep price to have to purchase the program/forms for preparing the state and then having to pay again, for each state, to file those same forms;
5. Paying with a credit card required an additional fee of 2.49%; and
6. It seems I must be forgetting something, as the additional fees seemed to go on, and on, and on.
I'll review my options for next year. Too many additional fees--program is inexpensive, additional fees makes it expensive

Sketchy if you need advice I like turbotax because if you have a simple return, it would be stupid to file any other way. But last year, I got married to a foreign woman, and they had no idea how to deal with this. The forum gave me wrong advice, and I ended up spending two hours at an IRS office, just for them to tell me that I didn't need to be there, I needed to talk to the social security administration. So, easy filing, go with this, but if you have problems, don't expect any real help. Wasted time with their bad advice

Why I will not be using TurboTax again I was made aware, via an email from Intuit, that this year's Deluxe edition of TurboTax would no longer carry Schedule E, which I use for a couple of rental properties I own. Accordingly, I bought the "Investments and Rental Property" edition (at a considerable price increase — $25 more) to do my 2014 return. (The email told me I could get a $25 rebate on the edition I bought after filing, with no mention of a deadline). Imagine my surprise when I discovered, in the midst of filing, that the edition I bought did not include Schedule C, which I routinely use to record small business expenses/receipts. No matter, TurboTax graciously allowed me to upgrade a second time to the NEXT level of service at no charge (I have no idea what that edition — "Professional," I believe — costs, but I'm sure it's a significant increase once again). I finished my tax return and filed on April 24, only to find that the $25 rebate I was expecting is no longer being offered. So, folks, it's H&R Block for me next year (and I've used TurboTax for the past dozen years). Deceptive pricing

column2: 'SHORT OPTIONS MISSING DATA' I REALLY hope that the 'SHORT OPTIONS MISSING DATA' problem gets fixed for next year. I spent 16 hours manually entering the missing data on about 200 records. This expenditure of time caused me to miss the 15 April deadline.

Bait and switch TurboTax has been crippled to force you to pay extra for more expensive versions. I bought the same version I have used for years, and they deliberately made it so I couldn't file schedule C without paying to upgrade. forced me to pay more

shame on Turbo Tax I can't believe the questions you ask. Meaningless IRS stuff that I blew by knowing what I wanted to show on the form. But that is not the issue. Have done Dad's Taxes using Turbo Tax for year's. Having last year info in the system is a big help to making this process easier. Dad passed away at the end of the tax year. and I found out in the last minute that his largest retirement (from the US Govt) had not sent the 1099 R. ...Yes I waited to the last week due to personal health issues....I contact the appropriate agency and they acknowledged that they had not sent it out. The folks who processed his death had put it in the wrong pile. They offered to send a replacement and promised I would receive it within 7 weeks. I considered filing for an extension but knew that I could complete the form using an unofficial year end summary that contained everything I needed. I also knew that sending Dad's taxes electronically was first of all easy and fast, and secondly that it did not require the paper copy of the 1099-R. Problem solved. I waited a few more days to complete my forms (much more complicated) and finally was ready to "push the button" on April 14th.

column1: This is when Turbo Tax decided to turn my life upside down. When walking through the final steps the screen came up regarding an electronic signature. Turbo Tax automatically filled it in. I did not even question it. I saw that it was there and went forward and submitted it. Next day I got two text messages. Mine was accepted and Dad's was rejected. (I had looked up my electronic signature on the IRS website since I had special concerns) The email cheerily explained not to worry that Turbo Tax was there to help me and that the IRS would allow me until April 20th to get this resolved. Since I was having surgery on the 17th I pushed forward to resolve it immediately. Once I realized that the information that turbo tax entered automatically was gibberish, I went to the IRS website to get new electronic signature for Dad. That site said it could not process the request. Therefore, went back in the current year of turbo tax to the section that give last year/this year comparisons and fun the AGI. Ran it through turbo tax and the following day got another rejection. I was unable to follow up further do to my surgery. Once released from the hospital, I tackled the task again on April 20. This time I was extra careful to identify the last year AGI directly from his printed forms. Checked and double checked then "hit the button" again. Another rejection. It had to be me! Blaming Turbo Tax never crossed my mind. Time to call Turbo Tax and have them walk me through it so there would be no further mistakes.

I found the number (which is very hard to do since it is well hidden several layers deep) and a woman answered. I told her the situation and she told me that I called the wrong number. I explained that it was the only one that I could find and she finally agreed to get me to the department that handles this. She asked for more information then put me on hold. When she got back she said that she would be able to help me. (Why would I want to listen to someone who wanted to shove me off on another department? I should have hung up but was desperate for information.) One of the first things that she said was that she noticed I did not submit the return on time and waited to the 20th. I let her know that I also submitted on the 14th, and the 15th. She was not impressed. Her tone made me think she didn't believe me. Too bad Turbo Tax did not provide her with that information. To bad that she mad a big deal about it in the first place. That was not my question. She then started to walk be through the process of finding last year's AGI. I informed her I knew how to do that. The problem was that the accurate AGI did not work. I told her that I was feeling that perhaps the IRS automatically rejected ALL electronic transmissions from dead people--but surely if that was the case Turbo Tax would have known an explained that it wasn't an option rather than offering to help me get it done. You can still print it out and send it in through the mail. I asked her how to handle the fact that Turbo Tax had now caused me to file late due to their inability to properly process the electronic submission. Should I attach a hand written note saying it was Turbo Tax fault? She informed me it was not Turbo Taxes fault and I shouldn't do that. I asked her then to provide me with a way to send it electronically. Her response became a broken record....you can always print it out and send it in. Hmm maybe Turbo tax should change their rejection message. Sorry we have no idea as to what happened but if you want to listen to one of our representative who doesn't know what she is talking about please call our number....if you can find it. Bottom line, I got the US govt to expedite the 1099-R thanks to your assistance. They were appalled at what you did to me and put it in the mail the same day. I will now be able to mail Dad's return. I will attach this review to his forms, hoping that the IRS is as appalled as the nice people who expedited his paperwork. My only request: please send me a reason to ever use Turbo Tax again. But, if it isn't compelling, please don't waste your time. hard to understand at times - hung me out to dry with IRS

column2: Turbo Tax all about the upsell I've used Turbo Tax for 5 years to do my taxes. They are simple and straighforward (no home, car, investments, etc.) This year, I filled out my form and was told that I had to upgrade to Turbo Tax Deluxe (59.99 plus 39.99 for state) because my taxes required a 1040 form versus 1040EZ or 1040A. This is a lie. I called Turbo Tax support and was informed it was inaccurate that I needed a 1040 form and didn't need to upgrade. I declined the upgrade and was subsequently asked/nearly strong armed online to upgrading 2-4 more times during my filing process. Shame on you Turbo Tax for trying to do this and misrepresent why. As a loyal filer with your service, you should know better. Got asked 4-5 times to upgrade and misrepresented why

CA Nonresidential Income Tax for a Trust Very little of my trust's income was from CA, yet the tax bill according to TurboTax was enormous. I knew something was wrong but couldn't figure it out for several hours. You need to go into a particular form and separate CA income from other income. This was totally unclear and in my view, would cause many people doing the same thing to overpay their taxes to CA. The questionnaire needs to simply ask that if the trust is not located in CA, then how the income is to be aloocated. There is no way to split income up between CA and non-CA from answering the questions

Quick, Easy, and Thorough Please make the details on what each program is best for you (listed on back of package). About half way through, I was informed I needed to purchase the Home and Business to complete filing, which I did for an additional $10 and it blended in very well. Didn't make any of the complicated stuff easy Not so great this year. All of the complicated, messy stuff that you really want this kind of software to help make easy is exactly the stuff it handled poorly:

column1: - The input section for HUD-1 closing/escrow fees *for a rental property* was confusing and ambiguous, and guidance was non-existent. It doesn't simply provide box number inputs from the form and categorize them appropriately. Even now I'm not 100% sure what it intends for one to put in certain boxes.

- The mechanism for inputting amortized mortgage expenses on a rental property was buried and obscurely labeled. This is an obvious deduction for rental properties and ought to be right in the main supposed "step-by-step" workflow. Similarly for certain types of fees/improvements that should be capitalized as added cost basis.

- It simply did not handle a return-of-capital portion of a stock dividend reported on a 1099-DIV. Didn't notice it and didn't flag it for any special action at all. (One is supposed to adjust the cost basis of the shares on which a dividend with a ROC is paid). It appears that this error would cause an *under-reporting* of income, which could cause underpayment and penalties!

- It provided no mechanism for entering a return of capital (from dividends) adjustment on RSU shares -- basically there was no mechanism for reporting an incorrect 1099-B cost basis on these types of shares at all. Had to enter them as a normal stock sale instead. Even more bizarre when one considers that it *was* possible to report the correct adjusted cost basis on ESPP shares.

- Nonetheless, its workflow for inputting ESPP sales was horribly obfuscated compared to prior versions of the product. Previously when entering investment sales, it would simply ask in the step-by-step workflow whether they were ESPP (or RSU, options, etc.) sales and then take you through the appropriate steps accordingly. Now you have to enter them generically, then click a little checkbox stuck in the middle of the ledger, then a button, and then select from a slew of options.

- The handling of K-1s was clear as mud. Again the input flow didn't simply map a substantial majority of the numbered boxes on the K-1 documents to entries in TurboTax, making it tedious to figure out what is supposed to go where. It did a very poor job of handling the process for entering ordinary income versus other types of income, etc.

- The handling of publicly traded partnership units resulting in K-1 reporting (e.g. MLP) was just plain broken. It tried to report the sale twice: once from when it imported the 1099-B from my broker and again from the data I had entered in the K-1 workflow. I only caught that it was going to cause me to pay tax twice on the transaction when I reviewed the final tax forms generated at the end for printout and filing. The workaround was very poorly documented and rather bizarre (though apparently in accordance with IRS guidance).

Overall, it didn't make dealing with any of the complex parts of my tax situation easier, other than knowing what forms need to be filled out and providing for the data entry. A pretty high price for a glorified form generator -- I'm paying for this to help make things easier. Disappointing compared to past years. Didn't simplify things, and made mistakes

Good bye Turbo Tax. It was fun while these past 20 years, but you're not the only game in town and your questionable services are no longer needed.
The only other step I can think of is a class action suite.... Your program now SUCKS. Your customer service SUCKS. My experience with Intuit's TurboTax is OVER.

column2: Sick of the problems Last year, TurboTax had a technical glitch that prevented me from e-filing. I had a ridiculously hard time getting anyone to pay attention to my issue, and when they finally did, they told me it was my problem, and that they weren't going to be able to fix it. This year, I tried to e-file, and my return was rejected. Again. TurboTax will let you efile over and over, and get rejected over and over, and their solution is to print and mail. I think for the money that your company makes on your software, it should work, and when it doesn't, you should make it easy to get help. I am going to seriously consider going another route next year after 10 years with you. Can't efile
Trouble/not able to file electronically Very disappointed in this years turbo tax. Keeps getting rejected for something with PIN. Got a new PIN and it is still rejecting for PIN.

Employer ID issues My federal return was rejected, because the employee ID was incorrect. When I entered it exactly as it appeared on my W-2 it would not accept it. There were not enough spaces, (one too short). I tried to go back and remove a dash that was in the number and when I'd move the curser away, the software would automatically enter a dash, which made it so I couldn't enter the final digit. This seems very clunky for 2015. Eventually I removed the whole employee number and reentered it, which made it finally work. I did not see any instructions addressing this issue, or even stating to leave the dash out. I even put in a service request over a week ago for questions I had while I was in the process of working up my taxes with the software, and I never heard back from anybody. very touchy for simple issue
Filing Tax Forms  cost was a lot higher than prior years

good up to a point Turbotax told me that my return was properly prepared and ready to transmit. Then, the IRS refused my return. Turbotax left me with sketchy indications which did not work. I tried to call in the form 8844 which did not seem to exist in Turbotax. So, next year, I will consider my options. unable to file electronically

2014 Tax Review I ran into problems putting individual 1099 Misc forms for Royalty income using H&R Block the last years. Switched to Turbo Tax in hopes for better function. The input of most data into Turbo Tax is generally good, better than H&R Block. However, I ran into a similar problem with IRS Sched. E. Turbo Tax takes LLC Form K-1 very well, but also fails on individual 1099 Misc for Royalty income. It is completely opaque on correctly accepting that data. It appears Sched. E is the correct place for Royalty income, but there is no apparent access. The input of individual 1099 for Royalties into IRS Schedule E is also a big problem.
overcharged me I had to purchase my TurboTax Federal and State software AGAIN in order to efile my return. In effect you charged me twice and I will dispute it with my credit card company!!

column1: We are retired folks - living mostly on Social Security and can't afford this kind of thing!!
I originally paid through American Express and in order to efile and purchase your software AGAIN, I had to use Mastercard! Please help!! Overcharged me

column2: SO FRUSTRATED Turbo Tax bounced one of my state returns.No problem, I fixed it and all was great.

column1: However when I corrected it on Turbo Tax on April 1st, the amount DUE on my HOME state's return CHANGED AUTOMATICALLY from owing $479 to getting a refund of $128. Yay!! HOWEVER , even though those changes are on the return per Turbo Tax, they never changed its report to the State!!
I was charged $479 by my home state on April 15th instead of getting the $128 refund.
It took me over an hour searching and completing forms on Turbo Tax just to tell them.
Now I have to mail the Amended Return that THEY calculated 3 weeks ago and did NOT submit to the state. changing it is another story

column2: Limited Ability The limited ability of Turbotax premier to handle large 1099Bs is a major disadvantage, and unnacceptable. You should have a warning on the box outlining this lack of capability. with computer driven investments in stock buy/sells, this will become more and more an issue and stop people being able to use Turbotax in a concenient manner Cannot handle large 1099s

401k, IRA, ROTH code Please re-examine roll over parts as well. It assumes if you roll over that it is to a ROTH and that is not always the case. The software was not flexible enough when dealing with 1099 on a variety of accounts.

painfully slow to load, problems e filing it used to be quick and easy - this years program took minutes to load - minutes waiting after questions and had many issues with e-filing as well as paying for the state transmission fee multiple program reloads ?? - no support assistance

Some questions are ambiguous, TurboTax is greedy When filling out state return, I found some questions ambiguous. Luckily I was able to find answers on the internet, although not on the Turbotax site.

column1: I was also annoyed at how many times I was asked to log in to my TurboTax account.
And I was annoyed at how many times I was asked to purchase something extra. Some questions, especially for state return, are ambiguous.

column2: Never Again - Unreliable product After 10 yrs with TurboTax, I will not purchase it again. I paid $79 for the "Personal & Small Business" software which includes State return. However, the State Return would not load. Error message would be "Your State Software is up-to-date", but the State Return would not start. I then had to spend $39.99 additional on the download of MD State Returns to complete my tax return. After then paying $24.99 to E-file my State Return, Turbo Tax continued with error messages and would not file the return. I had to change to "mail return" option and print out my State Return. unreliable software--State Return forms would not load
Missing Features  Can not transmit 1099 to Irs

Spannhake 2014 Turbo Tax Experience Totally bungled the Ohio School District filing. We elected to pay the School District tax by paper, but e-file the return. Instead of printing the payment voucher, SD-100 was printed and Turbo Tax set up the payment as an ACH Debit (we had elected direct debit of State of Ohio tax payment). Had we actually wanted direct debit for the School District tax, Turbo Tax would not have printed any forms. Instead, we manually printed the Payment Voucher, sent in a check as we elected, only to find that the direct debit was processed and we double paid a large amount. Epic Fail on Ohio School District Tax

Blind leading Blind Questions put by Turbo Tax are not always clear cut - straight forward. Employing Turbo Tax for me was about eliminating the possibility of confusion within IRS tax forms, provide direction, and safe guard users against simple errors. This was not my experience ad I see no hope of being reimbursed for time and money given to fail nearly miserably with Turbo Taxes product.

column1: Cant wait to plainly do my taxes next year at no more expense than the cost of a pencil and a bic pen. impact of your answers to Turbo Tax are not available end of process.

column2: Turbo Tax  sometimes do not know how to answer the questions even with the walk thru

Hate Turbo Tax Have used TT for numerous years but when I found out my online submission had been rejected and they gave me a link, it never told me how to fix it. Will never use them again. Everything

Hidden expense Turbo is too expensive with hidden fees at the end of the process, not enough explanation when a questionable entry is presented. However, due to illness I didn't research other filing options this year. Hidden expense

Could not remove Plus option even though I declined it several times. No customer service. Turbotax stole $30 from me. Have used this service for many years, but I'll never use it again. Good job losing a customer.
Last Minute Fleecing We went through the whole program and then got socked with fees! Not just filing fees, Turbo takes another $35 just because!

column1: Very disappointed after a generally painless experience. FEES!

column2: State/Province address change - difficult process the foreign address used did not have a preferred format but It took me four times to go throught the whole process before I could come up with a way to change it.

column1: Your intuitive program knew the problem....it should have gone directly to the box that was incorrectly filled out, and alllowed to change immediately.....for a much easier fix..

I am really not sure if my return will not be rejected for the 4th time....if so....I will be calling you to find out what I can do . Turbo Tax did not offer a direct way to correct my mailing address for state return

column2: Disappointed in Intuit and TurboTax this year I have been using TurboTax for decades, and MacIntax before that. I was very disappointed at the start and end of the process this year. It took me 45 minutes and a call to tech support to install the software and then (free) upgrade to the home business version needed to get a Schedule C. It required the tech support person taking over control of my computer (very creepy) by me entering "share screen" in a secret location on the TurboTax site.

column1: Once installed and upgraded, the software worked mostly fine until the very end when I went to e-file. When it tried to ask for my credit card info., it hung, and gave a customer support number to call. I called the number, only to find out they are only open 9-5 weekdays. Pretty useless for those of us who work (like everyone doing their taxes!).

So I googled the problem and found a FAQ section on the turbotax website where dozens of other users had the same issue. Thankfully they offered the solution - enabling an obsolete and insecure internet options setting (TLS 1.0) that allowed Turbotax to continue and charge my credit card.
The only other minor glitch was that the program kept asking me for farm income, even though I never told it that I owned a farm (I don't own one).

It is amazing how Intuit is killing off loyal customers, first with how they ruined Quicken (long story - just google it), and now TurboTax. And their customer support has gone way down hill. Next year I will consider alternative options. Broken e-file/credit card, Unbundled Schedules C & D

column2: Good but still a challenge I have used TurbTax for years and believe it does a good job, but I can't help but feel I am missing some very important deductions like my quartlery broker fees to manage my investments. I have never figured out where that goes. I don't pay commissions, but a quarterly fee. I don't have much but I pay them $4,200. a year. Hard to locate where to place misc items like broker fees

Wasted my time with offering me unwanted options Too much marketing of other products. I Don't like being forced to accept or reject purchasing a product before I can move forward with my return. I am purchasing TurboTax. If I wished to purchase an amazon service, I would go to amazon. I do my taxes and my sister's federal and state taxes using turbo tax and have recommended it to literally dozens and dozens of people. However, I will not utilize it again if I keep being forced to accept or reject the option to purchase other products. I didn't come to this site to purchase, I came to this site to quickly do my taxes. I find it insulting that turbotax is wasting my time and forcing me to accept or reject amazon products. Amazon is not paying my turbotax bill. Intensely disliked having to choose yes or no to ads

Additional fees galore Awesome to get screwed at the end of preparing the taxes by additional fees for efiling. I already bought the fing program. Just include it with the purchase. Nice way to do business. The additional charge to efile the state return. I feel like I already paid .

Unsatisfactory Review Alabama state return e-file was rejected 3 times. Although TurboTax identified what was wrong, they offered, but did not provide, any help fixing the problems. I was left on my own. Could not get a number to call for help. I had to mail my return in late as originally filed and hope for the best.

column1: I could not print out the reason the e-file was rejected. I had to write it down longhand to remember. Was a long explanation.
I'm not sure if TurboTax will be reimbursing my credit card for the failed e-files. Nowhere was it mentioned, nor could I find a route to find out.
Been a loyal TurboTax user for a long time. This is the first time TurboTax let me down. State support was bad

column2: Charged twice for federal return I was charged twice for the federal return. While I was completing the federal return, I was asked if I wanted to purchase TurboTax. I said yes, and then paid for it. When I returned to finish my taxes, I was asked to pay for the federal return again, along with the state return. I don't know how to get a refund on the package I purchased first. I did not like the extra advertisement for Amazon.

TurboTax 2014 Turbo Tax Deluxe used to work even for in home businesses. Many of the features of the older versions of Deluxe have been removed and added to more expensive versions. The price of the Deluxe version has been raised by $20 while reducing functionality. My father has always used H&R Block. I expect in the future, I will also. Way overpriced and too many versions

No GA Efile I have been using the product for many years. I've moved to a new state last year. This years version called for me to pay 30 more bucks for something I used last year. I HATE there is no GA EFILE. Had I know this, I would have not purchase the software. What other states are not supported? I had to rush out and snail mail my return. Not cool. Had to pay extra to get forms I got free last year, NO GA EFILE. Not mentioned anywhere

Needs updating! I've used Turbo Tax for many years and for the most part it has helped me to file my taxes and find all the deductions that even I might have forgotten. This year unfortunately I had a few problems and Turbo Tax seems to have complicated those problems even further. I was unable to file my returns early this year like I prefer, and due to a problem with my new wife's information I had to file an extension. Normally this is not a problem, but she has not filed for several years because she has not had an income and we were both unaware that she had a pin with the IRS from years ago. My extension was rejected because of this pin and I was given the option to re-file my extension by April 20th. Please keep in mind that my extension was filed on April 15th. Today is April 19th, and I was trying to file my extension along with my estimated amount that I owe the IRS. This is where Turbo Tax is lacking on their side. I cannot send my extension because where I pay the amount that I owe has to be set to pay before April 15th, but it also has to be set to pay no early than today. "?????" How can I send in a form on the 19th when it can only be done if the date is listed before the 15th? Well Turbo Tax you dropped the ball on that one. Next year I'll hopefully be able to file early, before you guys have a chance to forget to update your forms. Very unprofessional.... Lack of updating after the 15th.
Turbo Tax SW is lacking Online Version Couldn't calculate RSU section accurately. It is hardly giving an impression that it is doing it correclty Pathetic Support

TurboTax has gotten worse In the last two years, and this year especially, the software has gotten worse - more difficult to navigate and enter information if you're specifically looking for something. When you go back to 're-do' a part of the questions, it doesn't remember everything you put in before, giving you the option to change it. Instead, a lot of your prior responses are simply gone from the options of the screen, so you have to re-read the questions and respond another time. There needs to be a very easy and simple way to navigate through the questions quickly, saving all of your previous responses, allowing you to quickly find the screens with queries that you want to change your answers to. There used to be a simple option to either go through the prompted questions, or to navigate quickly between steps, allowing you to select specifically what you want to view or change. That appears to be gone now.

column1: I would also like an option to start the whole process by entering all of the information from the tax documents that I've received in the mail - ie 1099, 1098, W-2, interest and dividend statements, etc. If you enter all of this info first, you know you can set all of those documents aside. TurboTax could then save the information from those documents and prompt them to review and 'label' them as necessary, assigning them to an individual, etc, as you go through the remainder of the questions for the tax stuff. Difficult navigation, expensive

column2: What A Nightmare Q&A is not support may be good tool but is not support most of us diy do our tax prep on weekends and live support, be it by phone or chat is big fat zero. Well now that my return is late and head is bald from hair yanking all I can say is WOW REALLY? Oh and lets not forget you can deduct the cost of turbo tax on your return but not really. The hamster seems to be the only thing willing to help but I dont speak hamster. in short thanks for nothing and enjoy my prep fees. chrg was double than told,many problems with software and unable to contact support,help on weekend obsolete unprofessio

Surprise Have been using the Deluxe version since 2007 and really liked it. Would rate 2007-2013 as 5 stars. But what a surprise in 2014. You fixed the Schedule D problem witha free upgrade, but still disappointed with no state return included. You should have highlighted those changes better. No schedule D wirth Deluxe, no state return with Federal
extension you need to fix the protocol for printing the filing extension form.

column1: It is very frustrating.
I wanted to print the form to file and extension.
It is horrible.
Someone has to fix this.

column2: Astonished I’d like to hear how the TurboTax online system allowed someone to create an account and file using the same SSN as me, a long time and current customer of record. Secondly, please contact me so you can provide a detailed written record of all access history to my stored information. It was also easy for the criminal that filed via TurboTax using my SSN

Not too good I really hate this software. I did my step daughters on it this year but switched mine to TAXACT. On turbo tax, I had problems with getting the program to function. It kept freezing up. Would not start the sections when I clicked on them. Many section ask a bunch of stupid questions and waste a lot of time only to later advise that you can't claim a deduction. Also, it never shows you the marginal tax rates or where you stand relative to them, which is important for tax planning. Overall, not that great and too expensive. too much black box function and deceptive about costs.
Doing the taxes nwas a breeze but filing was very confusing. I discovered they were not filed even when I received confirmation that they were.

Turbo Tax sucks You took my money I couldnt e file and now my taxes are late. You guys suck. Will NEVER use your software again and I will make sure everyone I know never uses it. I got this error "amount on Line 60b, 'FirstTimeHmByrRepaymentAmt' of Form 1040 and attach Form 5405 if required.now never uses this software. Which is a known error on your website since feb with no resolution. I dont care if you blame IRS you sell the software to efile. I cant efile yet you still took my $60. Total fraud!

column1: On top of it when the erro came back your software said it fixed it. and i did not! Fraud!!!! Total rip off

column2: Sad news I had used Turbo Tax to figure my taxes and right when I went to transfer returns, Turbo Tax went online to save returns and the program froze. There were two additional aggravating circumstances, the program did not save locally first so I did not have a back up, There was noway around the error, no clicking on reload or cancel. I took pictures of the screen the next morning at that time and would be happy to send them to you. I thought if I let the computer sit until the next day the program would unfreeze, but alas it did not. I had to restart the computer and start all over with my taxes again and file them late. Sadly, it does not matter how well a program assist you with your taxes, it is moot when you cannot file them due to technical issues. program froze up on April 15th can could not file

too expensive. This is the last time I'll use turbo tax. I had been a customer for the last couple of years, but you have gotten too greedy. You even charged me for the first free state tax return! So, it's good-bye from the Bakers, and I'll be passing this along to all my friends. You have gotten too greedy!
two pins for joint return. did not see second one

column1: 1099Rs combined when some are taxable and others are not. I could not figyre out how to handle this.

column2: AWEFUL!!! Terrible online tax service and very expensive...I will not ever use Turbo Tax again and would not recommend it to anyone.
ripofff  Choose NOT to ay $29.99 for the extra. yet was cahrged at end despite it said it wasn't. We couldn't get it off there!

get a clue someone must be desperate for quick revenues... he or she has wrecked a decent product with constant and misleading upselling for turbo plus etc. end result = strong impression that your company has no pride. spam-style upmarketing must end
I filed with turbo tax and printed out my return and it looked good so I e-filed it and the business losses were obmited and my return is wrong. how do I fix it.

it was ok got stuck on my NC state tax. I had to keep going to a form about taxable wages in NC which oi had 0 ,.but i couldnt put 0 so finalluy i put $1.00 just to get filed . THATS NOT RIGHT NO help

Turbo Tax Review I have been using Turbo Tax for more than 15 years....I actually think I began in 1998 or 1999. This year may be my last. I am unhappy with you that you "dumbed down" the software, the you charged me more for it, and as far as I am concerned at the end of the day you gave me less. We don't have the assets or deductions to itemize, but I was required to buy the most expensive version of your software just to prepare a schedule c. Not a good investment on my part, and not a good strategy on yours. Unless things change drastically, I won't spend the money on Turbo Tax down the road. I purchased Quicken to keep up with personal finance, but don't like it very much (It thinks I am stupid so tries to recommend WAY too much). I likely would be better off going back to the spreadsheet method of tracking, and filling out the tax forms by hand. You have a long way to go to re-earn my loyalty!!!! Short on features for the price
Tax filing rejected Why I keep getting rejected by irs. After filing. Why am I responsible for late penalty after paid you for services? Keep get rejected
Helpful US Citizens abroad demand purchase access. Miserable support for those living abroad. A lot of US Citizens live abroad, and we want to purchase this easily.

Reject IL State Return: Frustrating + Recurring My recommendation of TurboTax has gone from 5 stars to 1 star, losing one star for every 2 times (Scoring from 9 to 2 on how likely I am to recommend TurboTax to a friend). The 1 star is for ease of use.

column1: In 2013 my 2012 state taxes were rejected once. In 2014 my 2013 state taxes were rejected 3 times. In 2015 my 2014 taxes are on track again at 2 rejections. It is rejected for the same reason every time - a problem with my signature.
1. I don't have a PIN, so following the advice listed on the "we're Here to Help" pages: I include my drivers license number.
2. I submit it each time, and 24 hours later, another email in my inbox tells my it's been rejected.
Even if Turbotax has nothing to do with it, it needs to be communicated clearly PRIOR to PAYING for using the software.
For as much as I paid to use the software, I could hire a CPA. Why bother dealing with this again next year? I would appreciate a response, but if I don't receive one, I'll simply move on.
Disappointed and frustrated, a soon to be former TurboTax user.
Patrick Rejected State Returns Haven't Improved

column2: Estimated tax?? I just realized, 3 days after filing electronically, that there was nothing about filing the voucher for Estimated Tax! No reminder to send payment in! Just the cheerful message that the filing was "Done". Bad if it did not tell me to transfer money for Est. Tax!

Adequite This software locked up three times in the course of doing my taxes and the only remedy was a hard reboot. Thank goodness no entered information was lost. I had to backtrack too many times to find all the areas I needed.
More Info I had two fundamental choices

column1: 1. claim my daughter on my filings
2, file her individual returns and not claim her on my filings
I wish turbo tax would help me evaluate that choice. No info re selecting dependents vs individual filings

column2: Got spoofed My TIN was stolen. Not sure how but it could have been from Intuit / TurboTax. Next year I am using somebody else.

column1: It's a shame because I have used TurboTax at 8 years.
Don't know if I'll get my tax refund. Arghhh.
Somebody stole my TIN and filed my return and supposedly stole my federal and state tax refunds. Don't know what will happen from here.
Dave E. My TIN was stolen

column2: NJ military income glitch This product is still unable to correctly process NJ non-resident returns for military personnel. For the amount of money I paid for this product it is very very disappointing. unable to process state return

made it easy first it claims its free, then it says its 29.99, then at the end it is all of a sudden an additional 29.99 for turbo plus??? couldnt find the option to opt out of the stupid "plus"!! could have made that easier.san

column1: maybe I checked an additional box, but I dont think so!
filing taxes is already stressful, only to get to the end of what you thought was easy process, only to see that I am being charged 60 bucks!!!!!!!!! not cool. Ill never file with turbo tax again.
Dont advertise its free and its not!!! terrible. total cost

column2: Broke Down at the End I like TurboTax's ethic of close guidance. However, this year it found some issues with my return at the final review and when I hit the "Fix the Problem" button it presented a picture of the box on the actual form for which I needed to supply information, but it did not give any sort of explanation for what was required. When I tried to enter the data I thought it wanted, it simply returned me to the screen telling me there were problems. With no other guidance, I kept guessing answers until it said the issues were resolved. Additionally, it allowed me to pay twice for my TurboTax program. After I entered my payment information but before I filed I returned to an earlier part of the process to make a correction. When I returned to the last step, it told me to enter my payment info again. I figured it had lost it when I went back and that it hadn't payed yet, but I just received my second confirmation of payment email. I imagine it would be easy enough to prevent someone from paying twice. Guidance broke down at the end

The TurboTax product proved to be easy to use as it has been for the my personal use for over 8 years. The confusion about which product we needed to buy this season caused some stress and grief. I actually completed my return online and transferred the file to a store purchased product to save money. I hope you will be clear next season and offer the same quality product that we have come to expect. I actually purchased two different TurboTax products while waiting for the decisions to be made over which one I would actually need to use this year. One was successfully returned to the store where it was purchased. Tough start to the year for TurboTax! Way too much confusion over product choices.
