column1: When it came to the state section would like to be able to pick an option to print to file manually easier. When I did print it out, the form was a mess and am hoping the state doesn't refuse it for the family's returns.
Would like to have a screen that would show if I or my children were to set up an IRA how much less would the taxes have been.

Seems as though some more effort can be put into to be more intuitive and import information from Quicken easier. Would like it to suggest what changes in withholding to make to avoid a tax bill the next tax year. going back towards end jumps back to start of filing vs 1 screen, state filing option should be easier

column2: okay but hard to review information It seemed thorough but there were a few cons. It was difficult to review what you have input in each section. You had to go into each section and ask all the questions you already did if you want to get to something to check to make sure it is correct. Also in the error checking it should double check when last names do not match when married filing jointly. As it would be the case that most returns filed when married filing jointly would have the same name it would be a simple and good fix to check this and ask you to verify when it doesn't match. Yes it was user error but I had a typo in one of our last names and this caused our file to be rejected. Also it was confusing in the home office section to understand how to input information when we moved during the year and had another separate office for part of the year as well. it was confusing and difficult to understand and took a lot of searching questions and answers (the questions and answers from turbotax was good to have). error checking and difficult to review mid-process

Trouble with CD Turbo Tax Premier would not load state file until I loaded it 5 times, finally worked when I loaded it under deluxe name. I was a day late. Help desk was useless on April 15, 2015. Found a random answer on line on how to fix the problem State Tax file would not load
State Fee SUX Lack of a free option to transmit a state tax return is all that is preventing this from being an excellent rating instead of average.

column1: State governments prefer the electronic file. People prefer it. Get on board and quit trying to squeeze an extra buck out of the process. Charges a fee to file a state return electronically

column2: OK. This beats the effort of actually filling out all of these forms. It says something that filing your taxes is so difficult that you have to pay someone to do it or use software.

column1: 1) Filing your state tax should be free for every state. If you pay for a product such as turbotax deluxe, part of the deluxe should be that you then also don't have to pay to file electronically for a state. Intuit could think of this as a national service.
2) This doesn't integrate with all of the companies that I have mutual funds with, so I have to manually enter these. case in point Oakmark funds.
3) Some of the error messages are not helpful. For example, when you install the software one message actually says "< one minute left." Error messages should use words, not symbols.
4) I can never figure out New York State taxes, especially for part year income. Anything that you can do to make that easier will greatly help.
5) This year the charitable deductions don't record when cash donations were made. So if you made multiple donations, you have to add all of these together first. Still could make taxes easier

column2: whatever? Pretty sure my return isn't correct But I'm hitting the deadline so I have to go through with this. It's not as cheap as it leads on. Usually I spend about $40 more to have everything including my payment taken care if with no worry. DONE. This time I spend $60 with Turbo Tax to do everything myself including mail my payment and print and mail my taxes to IRS. I'll never use it again. I prefer my taxes be done right by a professional and not leave a bunch of loose ends. Basically, you pay $60 for a form to fill out. I could have done this for free. well this review area isn't user friendly either. glitchy like the app

2014 TurboTax my return printed where you have to hold it to a mirror to read as the original is all backward. I also can't find the stored copy on the cloud and or my computer. Lots of trouble this year and I have used your system for many years this is my first bad experience.
SUCKED beyond expectations This was the worst experience I have EVER had in ANYTHING!

column1: Unable to access forms online...or find the way to change method of entry... answering questions that are not applicable just to get to the next step and figure out HOW to fix what was asked from a general perspective.
My experience will probably cost me thousands of dollars, and I trusted it to have the flexibility I needed as it is so widespread. modifications TERRIBLE

column2: Refund I have been doing it for years with Turbo but I was disappointed this year it cost me over a hundred dollars. It is what it is. The fee's

Time waster It's easier on paper and I would have got back 130 bucks more. Will not use again. Tedious drawn out and forces to you to answer questions that are not applicable. Lame Hidden fees don't show up until you've spent 40 minutes inputting your personal info

IP PIN If it had been clear that I needed an IP PIN BEFORE I received an email informing me my return had been rejected, I would have gotten one prior to starting and been able to avoid the late fee! You need a better explanation of the IP PIN!

Turborunaround If a company has a national service, have a call center open for national times. How stupid to only have it pacific time. When filing and getting rejected for birthday dates, have it set up so this doesn't happen. There is a robot on another planet, so TurboTax should be able to figure out how to correspond with entities that have info filed, without getting rejected. Going back to paperless and the cost of a stamp, since this company has a problem with it's system. call times

what a surprise!?!? used TT for over 20 years but this may be the last time. All the negative reviews from the bait-and-switch were removed from your site. Totally inexcusable and a violation of the public trust. Cannot wait to see what you do next year to make your program "consistent across all platforms". Review would have been a 5 based on the product and a 1 based on customer relations. irritation from removing features, ridiculous cost of a second State program, repeated attempts to sell addons

Poor customer support I attempted for an hour to find a phone number to address an issue with my rejected tax file. Instead, I was given several questions to fill out on-line. The a page loaded with a "call" button option. I clicked on it, but a phone number did not appear. I tried other methods to find a phone number, but none seemed to load... I have to wonder why a phone number is hidden... very poor customer support
failed to file on time. i had to do it again long time user..no phone to call when return was NOT filed! too many ads..confusing at the end

ravens4life I use one particular email address. I use the same password. Turbo tax kept saying it was wrong, I had it written down so I know it was not. I decided to change it. When I went through your recovery process it only gave me 30 seconds to recover and then it would expire. By the time I got someone on the phone it would lock me out. We waited the 15 minutes wait time and then it would keep adding an additional 15 minutes. As of this morning it was still showing I had 15 minutes to wait. I created a new email address. My husband was in a serious accident and taxes was the last thing on my mind. With the password issues I ran over into the 16th and now my taxes are late password kept locking out and not easy to recover causing my refund to file late

I will never use Turbotax again! This is my second year filing with Turbotax, the previous 5 years I filed with freetaxusa. Turbotax will not give me copies from my 2013 return to get information needed to finish my 2014 taxes. When I log into my freetaxusa account they have my 5 years of tax returns filed with them for me to view and print if needed. I will not be using Turbotax again to do taxes. Do not give you last years return

What a Waste I spent the entire evening going over mounds of paperwork in preparation for my usual last minute tax filing. I got through it - with more than a few problems with this software and a headache the size of Mars - but when I got to the end is where it got interesting...it wouldn't let me E File my returns...it still won't as I write this some nine hours past the deadline.

column1: I have used TT for Years, and though there have been a few problems, I never experienced the Anger and Frustration that I am experiencing now. After I calm down, I will be posting about my experience over the last 16 hours on EVERY 'Social Media' network and website I can find related to such issues and BLAST TurboTax with both barrels...I am FURIOUS over this, and the worst part is this: THEY DO NOT CARE - There is Nobody available to talk to until long after I have to go to work...
This will indeed be my LAST use of this product...it's simply junk. The program did NOT allow me to E File...now my returns are late.

column2: After all these years... I make the assumption when I put down my hard-earned money to use TurboTax to file my taxes, that there isn't going to be some bonehead problem with a filing #. As far as I know, I have no control over what # TurboTax uses to electronically file my taxes and now my taxes ended up getting filed late as there was a duplicate # used!

column1: May second-think using TurboTax next year. Fouled up on some # needed for filing

column2: not happy State was rejected, told me we would fix this together, but never showed me where to fix the problem. I could see the issue, but everytime I tried to correct - I could not get to the problem. Embedded in something, pulled from Federal - I could not tell. You market your product for the unintelligent, but when the intelligent try to use it, you have us set up for failure. Not very happy with turbotax.

column1: Also, I corrected items on Federal, final printout does not reflect corrections. Now it is accepted - thanks for nothing. You may not see me next year! rejected by state, you did not fix

column2: Meh When I got to end of my taxes TurboTax was so busy pushing an Amazon gift card on me that I made a mistake and didn't actually submit my taxes. I realized this error in the nick of time, but then, because of my own error, my taxes were rejected. Now, it's the morning of the 16th and for the first time in my life I have been late on my taxes. Thanks, TurboTax. I feel like it was over $100 well spent (sarcasm). I will be finding another method next year. easy to miss actually filing
Free = $50 Doing a 1040 is extremely easy and can be done by anyone with an eighth grade math and reading level. That said, this service added nothing to a basic life skill in America.

column1: You see the words free several times as you go through the process. "We will prepare them for free." But in order to get a copy to send to the government you have to give them $29. Here is an even funner catch, they automatically upgrade you for another $19 and you can't opt out of that payment either. Turbo tax is ran by a bunch of crooks, and I will never use them again.
However, if you are the kind of person that uses cash advances, and find most things difficult. This is the perfect service for you. It is not free

column2: Nothing is for free! thought this was a free svc. wasn't till the very end on the 15th of April that I was asked to pay prior to filling. I had to otherwise I would have been late. As it turns out after review of what I submitted it was late anyway. didn't realize I needed to put a 0 for AGI. Not using this again everything

Disappointing The "step-by-step" interview process could be condensed onto fewer screens without making it any harder to use. In fact, it would easier to understand some of the questions if they provided more context. As with the actual IRS forms (but for different reasons), many of the questions are ambiguous, and being able to see how and where my answers are going to be used would make it easier to understand what is really being asked.

column1: Also, the MA state health form in particular is really poor. It asks if I was covered for the whole year, and if my provider also "offered" coverage for my spouse -- but this is not asking whether my plan *included* my spouse! In other words, there's no checkbox to say "My spouse was covered by the exact same plan that I was, and with the same ID information". No -- you actually have to enter all of the information for you and your spouse twice. That's absurd. Too verbose, too little information

column2: The positives are that it's user friendly and it remembers last years information, so that's nice. It also picks up where you left off and allows you to be guided through the process or choose what to work on. Those are some of the positives.

column1: There are also a few things I don't like:

1) Seems like it tries to up-sell you to a more expensive version that you don't need. And when my wife selected the wrong version and attempted to move down to a less expensive version, it didn't allow her to do so easily.

2) It doesn't allow you to enter childcare expenses prior to entering your income (claims that you don't have enough income to claim them). It is usually the case that one knows their childcare expenses long before they receive their W2s.

3) No reminder that taxes haven't been submitted. I thought I had submitted my taxes and set up the money transfer etc. and April 15th came and went and there was no withdrawal from my account (I owed money). I can only guess that I failed to hit enough "Submit" and "Continue" buttons. It would be nice if TurboTax would have emailed me a reminder on April 15th that my return had not been submitted.
4) The turbo tax estimate for what I owe in state tax is far higher than what I end up paying by using the (free) state tax website.

column2: what happened?! I filed my taxes 2/12/15 and told Turbo Tax to deduct Fed owed on 4/14/15. As of today, 4/16/15 it still wasn't deducted so I SENT IT AGAIN! I hope I'm not fined for late payment by the IRS. Turbo Tax was paid by my credit card on 2/12/15, I have proof. missed deadline?!

Tax Prep SUCK You let people know exactly the payment process. I did not know that filing Federal AND states would eventually cost me. It was when deleted my state taxes then I could print and file my taxes. You guys suck, I would not recommend you to my dog!! was confusingin the end

Delux instead of Premier I have used TurboTax quite a few times in the past and I usually use the Premier version because I have Investments. This year I did not have any investments to enter but I needed to carryover Capital Gain Loses from last year (which is just entering two numbers), but I still needed to upgrade to Premier adding another $25.00. I was also charged for my State (more than last year) and possibly e-filing. Finally TurboTax did not try to import my records from last year even though it asks me if I used it, which I did. Had to upgrade to Premier to carryover losses from last year
Needs work If the software KNOWS that you must put a 0 in a field for e-filing purposes, then it should prompt you or do it. Things it KNOWS need to be fixed are not looked at before transmitting

Terrible Tax Program After purchasing turbo tax from Costco I wrongly assumed that I wouldn’t need to pay more later on, to file state and federal taxes. Following this, I entered all my information into the program for it to charge me two times, once for each of the two states that I was submitting a return for. Next, after clicking the “submit” button, I received the message that my returns had been rejected by the IRS due to “the IRS already having accepted a tax return with my same SSN.” When I spent the next two days investigating the identity theft that Turbo Tax convinced me I had been a victim of, the IRS informs me that they have no record of a return on file for my SSN. Furthermore, the IRS has no record of any attempted tax return submissions. In other words, the tax software that I’ve overpaid for is lying to me and will not even attempt to file my taxes. Worst tax experience ever, I need a FULL REFUND! Overpriced failure

Big aggravation you over charged me when I ask for the 30 dollar version and was charged 60 dollars also I had to go through all your sales pitches about Amazon an so on. This is the third time I'm redoing this process.

Frustrated... ive used Turbo Tax for 4 yrs now, the price seems to go up every year, its starts out advertizing its free, tho i know it cost to file,i dont mind paying for the service,i just felt i had no other option than to pay. i remember federal use to be about 30 and state around 30 too, now federal is 59.00 and state was 39.00 and then at the end i am told theres another fee to use the direct deposit! i dont remember that. ill be asking around for other options next time. i dont make that much,i feel i could have waked in a place and saved money. did i do something wrong/ i just feel there really wasnt any other option. feel there are fees that werent there before,like to direct deposit to my bank...

Without Warning Everything was going along pretty well until it was time to finalize and make payments. I was not pleased with the extra charges for using a credit/debit card to pay federal taxes owed. The biggest disappointment was the inability to use a credit/debit card to make state payments. I had made arrangements to make both state and federal payments on a prepaid debit card. As a result of these arrangements, there was not enough money in my checking account to pay state taxes owed after discovering this option was not available. It was too late to travel 20 minutes to the bank and make other arrangements at that point. As a result of this, turbotax has caused me to file state taxes late, incurring late payment penalties and possibly interest.

column1: In all, I am not likely to use your services ever again. Insufficient warning of payment options

column2: felt i had no option to pay as much as i had too! I dont remember having to pay for direct deposit. and i feel i had no other options to pay what was 9chosen) for me. the whole reason i di it online is to keep more of my money, I dont mind paying for a service. but i remember paying 30 somthing for tate and about the same for federal, my total was 119.00$ i feel i can go to a tax service and get a better deal than that and thell do all the work. and when it gets to where it can go into my bank account,i never remeber that costing. i honestly am not sure ill use Turbo tax again.... left feeling frustrated with no other option. the payment system implies from the beginning its free, tho ive filed 4 years now, its gotten more expensive it seems.
all went well until all went well until i e-filed and received error:

column1: we could not e-file your return for the following reason:
duplicate social security number: a tax return with the same social security number has already been submitted in - other words. 1099/w2 employees link was insanely obscure

column2: filing date It shows that I filed my taxes on 4/16/15 at 4:55 am vice 10:55 pm on 4/15/15. You would think that for something as important as when you file your taxes they could use your actual time zone. used EDT for filing date vice HST

Undecided First year filing after retirement and was confused. More help in finding out what is and isn't taxable when receiving an annuity and educational deductions would have been nice. expensive. not every box looking for information had a help option.did't know how much of my annuity was taxable.
No Mo' 2014 TurboTax has improvements especially ease of use; more further info on tax subjects; free Fed e-file and ability to e-file both returns.

column1: Intuit keep striving to improve TurboTax. Little confusion where to input info on unreimbursed work expenses

column2: no value add turbotax did not help me maximize returns, will take business to tax accountant next year. did not add value

OK.. The software is amazing! It beats H&R block and anyone can do it. I am no tax pro but I had all paper work. The only thing that was not cool was that the software made you pay before you could determine if your errors on any of your forms would force you to send by mail. I was lucky, you may not be. I really disliked this and felt cheated. important things left to the very end..
Great Haven't worked this hard in years, but, the end result was very satisfactory. Mindboggling

Take my $ but won't file So here I am in Hawaii finishing my taxes around 9.30pm. I am forced to pay by credit card because you won't direct debit my account until the 16th; meaning I'm out another 14$.

column1: ISSUE: Nowhere does it state you must file by 12pm EDT. By law, I have until 12pm my local time to file. You happily accepted my money to pay my taxes but would not allow me to enter the 15th as the date I efiled.

This now looks like I filed late as the home screen showed an EDT time. I want this to be updated with the correct date so I am not fined. I will also contact the IRS letting them know of what happened. I am certain you will correct the error of your software and make a clear note if you wish to continue this protocol for next year as I'm sure I'm not the only one caught in such a situation. read below

column2: Turbo Tax is clunky this year I've used TT for years, and this version was just annoying to use. There is no way to easily flip between the data entry screens and the actual form view as there has been in previous years. When I got stuck and asked a question, the answer feature would be so much more helpful if it would just link me to where I need to go and enter the info rather than a long list of screens I need to navigate. It would also be nice to be able to return to a previously saved version. It seems that in trying to simplify the process, they removed some of the features I had been used to using in the past. I usually don't love this task, but this year I actually walked away in frustration several times because the program was so annoying. Far less user friendly than previous years
So Confused I SEE THAT I OWE THE IRS BUT I DO NOT KNOW WHY ANS WILL NOT EVER KNOW SINCE IT DO NOT TELL ME WHY Reason why behind every move

Fee Frustration - Bait & Switch for State Return! I purchased TurboTax Deluxe and the box specifically states on the back that I can file a state return for $19.99; however, when I e-filed my return tonight I was forced to pay $24.99. A classic Bait-and-Switch. Not only is this fee high at $19.99 but unless I am refunded this $5 this will be the last year I use TurboTax.

column1: Plus, I had one item in my return that required me to upgrade while completing the return from Deluxe to Premier and I was charged $30 to do so. Had I purchased Premier at the store I don't believe the price difference was that significant. I feel that once I had purchased Deluxe version I was taken advantage of when required to upgrade to Premier to handle 1 specific item.
I have been a loyal TurboTax user for over a decade but I'm getting frustrated with your pricing and how customers are handled once committed to your product.

column2: we will see, if the 48 hrs sitting with turbo tax, everyone life is different and so is their means of income. going along answering questions (that may be right) or (maybe rong) dont know to u get to the end and have to go back and try to delete and/or change . it seemed so eazy till i wanted to fix things then it took days..... n now for the first time in my life 40 some years, my return was LATE but it dont leave room for choices

Go with the other guy Turbo tax is the worst piece of junk software ever. I paid for the deluxe version since it says "state" on the front thinking state was included. No. It wasn't. Still cost me an additional 25$. Then as I'm at the end of everything, ready to submit, it says I can't submit because my version isn't updated. So I do what it says and attempt to update. Then It tells me I'm up to date. Still won't let me file. Keep in mind I'm already annoyed I had to pay for state on a software I already paid for. So I call customer service who gives me a download and sends me on my way to deal with it myself when I've already finished everything in the copy I already have installed.

column1: Don't buy turbotax. File for free and just do your state refund on the state website for free. It's garbage.

Hours later, a disk reinstall, several reboots, a customer service call, an uninstall, a download, and another install later, I finally was able to file. It was around 11:50 when I was at the very final submit screen with my error. I managed to get this all resolved by 3:30am.

Is it my fault for waiting? Yes. I'm busy and a procrastinator. But had the product worked, I wouldnt have had a problem. Everything. State wasnt included as implied. 25$ for state. Extra 35$ if you want that deducted from your refind.

column2: Fairly Satisfied Overall, I am satisfied with TurboTax. I wouldn't use it every year if I wasn't. However, every year, I'm extremely dissatisfied with the expensive fees for filing with Turbo Tax. It always starts out free, and I would be ok with a $40-$60 fee for all the work you put in; however, the nearly $40 fee to have the payment taken out of my taxes is ridiculous. And, of course, that fee is not highlighted when given that option to pay. So by the time I saw the fee, I just wanted to finish filing. I find that very sneaky and unacceptable. Expensive with hidden fees that get you in the end - that in my opinion are not worth it.

TT2014 version It is difficult to contact a live person, Q&A section does not give you the correct answers. TT upgrades you in a sneaky manner. I ended up paying regular fee to file PLUS Turbo tax Plus... I only pd because I had to file today but I never willingly upgraded. I have used TT for about 5 yrs and help about 5 other family members to use it, I will really look into other options for next year if TT does nothing about this and also needs to become more accessible to its clients even if we are able to chat with a live person would help.. Not as user friendly as it used to be

Ill-Equipped for Those Living Abroad Living abroad, questions were sometimes asked as if one were living in the US, even after I'd indicated I was living abroad. I then triggered an error on their website trying to indicate where I lived (for sales tax credit attempt) resulting in the webpage noting I lived in state '0' (for having not selected a United State). It then tried to make me enter a state at the review process, and I had to recall where in their several-step process that question was and tediously navigate back to delete that entry. Then they tried to force me to pay then $55 to file the 1040 even though it appeared I would be getting $0 refund from less than $1000 federal income tax. questions lacked recognition of living abroad; no easy menu system

Review of Turbotax It should be offered to the consumer all thru the program choice of paying the higher amount or the lower amount. Either to itemize or not itemize. When realizing that in spite of credits and deductions amount owed or refunded would not matter either way. locks you in to the higher package. Only given choice in beginning without knowledge of later status.
Never again In addition to continuous reminders about what a good deal TurboTax Deluxe is, I kept encountering conditions that were not covered in the free federal.

column1: When I logged in, they automatically started my taxes with the business version at a cost of over $100. When I discovered the cost and inquired about the free Federal version, it took me more than an hour to navigate their screens to finally get to the free version, and they required me to start re-entering my data from scratch -- some kind of punishment as another way to sell their other versions. They won't see me again at Turbotax Continuously encountering exceptions that require upgrades

column2: bad Last year I filed with Turbo Tax and when there was something that came back "not okay" I was not helped or defended. They did not do anything but waste my time on the phone in traffic. As if I was not stressed enough, the advice I as given from someone that worked out of their house was...... less than professional. I will not be using TURBO TAX ever again. I will also let other people know that I was left with 22$ (which I was charged extra for putting into my account!!!!!!!!) I spent more money on turbo tax fees than I should of. I did not agree to an upgrade and somehow I was still charged.

I personally think that charging your customers for the state download then again for filing said state returns is double dipping and shady. I will find another way to do my taxes from here on out. extreamly dissatisfied. unexpected hidden fees

last minute filer .... overall, I love turbo tax, I got a late start on it this year waiting for a 1098-T that my school said I wouldn't get until 2015. (still going to fight it# paid in 2014. anyway. Had almost everything finished went to make a few adjustments and its deductible imported my itemized deductions TWICE... it double and I had to manually removed half of the items! The other CON is at the very end finding out I have to pay to file my state taxes and make an ACCOUNT to do this. I don't appreciate all the EXTRA fees to PAY my federal taxes! Extra charge for using a credit card or an extra charge for taking it from your state refund. I finally pushed the button to file, with my blood pressure up, at 11:57pm 4/15/2015. #would have been a wider margin had I not had to CREATE AN ACCOUNT TO PAY ! GEEZ! just take the money! INTUIT shouldn't require an account! OMG, pulling my hair out!~ Don't make me join your club as the last thing I have to do before filing. THIS upset me. It's deductible imported twice- manually removed half of itemized deductions

Didn't explain PINS... IP versus E-file PIN Turbo tax is great at walking you "through things," but it failed to prompt me that my wife's IP PIN is different than the E-File PIN. I don't have a lot of experience, so that was very necessary for me to be notified of this difference in order to file ON TIME. For a software that prides itself in being user-friendly, I think it failed in this arena completely. I walked through every part of this software re-checking things, yet it took a google search to explain to me that I needed to "search the turbotax bar" in order to find the section that allowed me to punch in the 6 digit IP PIN, as opposed to the 5 digit e-file PIN. Live and learn. May not speak to your specific situation

Hidden Fees The over all experience was god. Turbo tax walked me through the process, I didn't have to worry about missing anything. It saved me time by pulling information into their application, instead of me having to manually input all the information.

column1: I didn't like the fact that Turbo Tax charged me an extra $39, just to have the option of having my fees taken out of my refund. It seems excessive, and it turned me off. HIdden Fees

column2: Efile PIN My wife and I have been issued 6-digit PINS by the IRS because of an identity theft issue. Your stupid program won't accept PINS of more than FIVE digits. This has caused my Federal and State returns to be rejected. PIN Rejected

Could not eFILE I spent 30 minutes trying to delete a schedule K1 which kept preventing me from efiling my federal return. Finally, I entered random numbers for trust number and "Void" on the name of the trust for the blank Schedule K1 that TT would not let me efile and it accepted it. What a waste of my time TT. I ended up submitting my return at 12:05 a.m. on 4/16/2015. If I end up with a late penalty for TT I am going to ask for my money back. It won't let you delete a Schedule K1
My filing was three minutes late because your representatives take 10 minutes to take credit card information.

Due to a glitch in their California return "Smart Check," it wouldn't let me e-file and of course I waited until the last minute. I would do the "Fix It" screen, fix the error (that a field should be blank), and it would take me right back to the "Would you like to fix the error page?" in an endless loop and then wouldn't let me e-file. Glitchy state return

Taken by surprise by not being able to file a 1040 I don't like surprises and I don't think they advertised their changes to the basic program well, I'll be looking around for better alternatives next year. Surprise requirement to pay for premium when basic used to work fine in past

Frustrated by the time waste I cannot believe I had to delete all of my information and re-input EVERYTHING all over again when I decided to switch from home and business to premier. That was AWFUL. wanted to swith from home and business to premier

Turbo Tax Plus sale without notice I did not like how you tried to sell turbo tax plus by asking if i like to deduct my turbo tax payment from my federal and bill me for turbo tax plus without explicitly indicating i will be charged an extra $29.99 and i had to jump hoops to find where I might have agreed to pay without knowing because thats what happened. At the end it almost looks like a point of no return and forced to pay. Really Disliked this. Last year same thing happened and not knowing why and how I paid it to get my taxes filed on time. This year same thing happened and I was annoyed as I was careful in not agreeing to any more payments than $29.99 to file for state. This should be stated clearly that if u want to deduct your turbo tax fee from your Federal we will charge you an extra $29.99 for Turbo Tax plus. Trying to sell turbo tax plus other services when u say file for free

State Taxes Filing I had to pay $39.99 the first time, I had to save my work and then go collect some money in order to pay for the amount due on my State filing. When I came back to finish filing it, I had to PAY again, this time $24.99. This is a rip-off! I HAD TO PAY TWICE!! $39.99 the first time and then $24.99 the second time

Problems and Failings of Turbo Tax 2014 I've been a Turbo Tax user for 11 years, and until this year, it's been great. This year (2014) was was a deep disapointment. The primary difficultly was that the importation of the previous year's return. Although the import seemed to occur correctly, and did bring in some of the textual information correctly, it brought in completely wrong numeric information. For example, the previous year's state tax refund was off by a factor of 100. My Roth Basis tracking has disappeared, previous year's donation carryover's dissapeared. Etc. I pointed TurboTax to all the previous years returns, locted in the TurboTax directory, and imported them, but all to no avail. Failed to Import 2013 Data Correctly, Less Clear Guidance Questions

poor,poor,poor. I only made 48 dollars on my federal return and instead of taking my entire federal return and having me pay the difference from my bank account, you had me pay 60 dollars and i only made 48 in federal, I wanted the free edition im never using turbo tax again

Disappointed I love using Turbo Tax but i hate feeling like they are trying to grab money out of my pocket at every turn, If i say NO to the Turbo Tax PLUS once that should be the end of it. Once i reach the end of the Forms its too late to back out... Shoved into getting Turbo Tax Plus

Extra Fees I have used Turbotax online edition for the past 10 years with ease. This year was by far the worst experience I've had with them. In the past the site walked me through quickly and it was quite easy to get my federal taxes filed with e-file for free. When I first started to enter in my information it wouldn't allow me to choose the head of household filing status. Finally they fixed this bug and I could finish where I left off 2 months later. Then, they "required" me to upgrade to the deluxe version because I got a 1099-MISC for a one time coaching stipend I received for measly $1,000. This deluxe upgrade cost me $55 AND didn't even include my state! At least the deluxe version software you can purchase in the stores include the state e-filing! This way would have cost me about $100. Instead I went to the CalFile and e-filed for free. I'm very disappointed in Turbotax online this year. I don't know if I will continue to use them next year. The convenience isn't worth the extra fees to me. Extra fees and required "upgrades"

State Return questions I live in Tennessee and do not have to file a state return. Turbo tax should recognize that residents of the Great State of Tennessee do not have to file a state tax return 99.999999% of the time and therefore Turbo tax should not ask me if i'm sure that i don't want to efile my state return. The state return check box should not be selected by default when efiling for Tennessee residents. by default Turbo Tax should recognize that 99.9999% of Tennessee residents DO NOT have to file a state return. State return not needed

column2: Non plused This version is certainly a significant step back from the turbo tax I have been used to. I doubt I will use this again next year. The application stalled and was slow proceeding from one tax block to another. It did not have the nice logical flow and prompts I'm used to and that made it easier to fill in. It's not intuitive and the window helps would often cause the application to minimize and I'd have to pull it up again. It was not me it kept happening over and over. Going back to re-check completed blocks or edit was difficult, not easy navigating back like before. Had to redo stuff several times. column1: Thank you Turbo Tax! There weren't really any cons... Could be a little easier to correct errors.

column2: 2014 TurboTax has very calculatedly and underhandedly nickel & dimed me this year so that I am paying considerably more for the same services. This is surprisingly deceitful on the part of Intuit, and I will find other tax assistance for 2015. Incremental costs relative to last year are a deal breaker

Got a refund, some software glitches I am a longtime user of TurboTax for around 10 years. This year was a difficult experience filing. The software would tell me that if I wanted to go back and explore certain options on my own, to go to that section and click on explore on my own, except when I would do that, that option did not appear. I had to prepare my return twice because of this.

column1: Also, at the start of tax season, there were some very confusing messages from TurboTax about certain unforeseen difficulties the company had with this year's returns, stating that people could get a refund for the purchase of TurboTax. The messages were multiple and confusing. I ultimately did not seek said refund.

Also, while preparing my return, TurboTax said that the form for itemized deductions was not available, but I could continue to file anyway without the form. Seriously?! In the end, I guess it showed up, because on the second return I prepared, that alert did not come up.

TurboTax was always my "go-to" for my tax preparation. After this year, I am not so sure. A friend of mine used H&R Block's software and said it was easy, free too. I may just have to try that next year. Too many in-house ads and some difficulties w/software

column2: So So Refund Tricky on the free tax preparation cost me $120 Too many codes on the form and expensive to prepare!

There was a small window in the middle of the page to try to see what it was asking for on the form. The questions that it was asking for for form inputs were not clear and understandable. It was very frustrating. I may end up using a tax service next year. Gets real confusing quickly.
Easy to use Easy to use. Didn't get a refund, but oh well. At least my info is on

column1: file if I need to revisit info.

column2: Worked, but left something to be desired Overall, this program seemed to work well and had a lot of nice features.

column1: I"m feeling disappointed in a few things though.

1) I am using the Premier version as i have to file 3 states for various rental properties in addition to my personal taxes. I appreciate TurboTax asking a lot of questions, but eventually you answer them all and are trying to just submit your taxes and you realize they continue to find errors, or think of new things to ask you, and suddenly the submission process took an additional hour or more. I'm sure it is a fine line between asking too many questions and not enough, but i definitely felt like they asked too many and made this too complex.

2) I was shocked to find that the price per state return (after the 1 "free" included one) is $39.99. This seems ridiculous, but i was considering paying it just to be done, even though my state returns are extremely simple compared to my federal. I thought I'd do a quick google search and found 100's of people that were complaining about shady practices for TurboTax. It seems that in addition to paying for the state, you have to pay additional money to efile for the state. That was another $25. So, each state (beyond your 1 "free" one), will cost you about $65. Ridiculous.

3) I personally used the feature where you can sign into your stock/brockerage/whatever accounts and have the forms autmatically pulled/populated for you. This seemed clunkly at first, but acceptable. Later on, however, i found that the forms that were pulled didn't have the data pulled in entirety, and i ended up with around 60 "corrections" that had to be made before submitting my taxes. This was unexpected and resulted in more than an hour of cleanup work just for something simple that TT had imported itself. I eventually deleted all that had been imported and manually typed it in.

My normal tax professional historically charges me $460 for 2 federal, and 3 state returns, and she does the work in an hour. I"ve spent somewhere in the neighborhood of 6-10 hours, and it has cost me (if i had done all the state filing and efiling) about $215. Also, as thorough as the software seems, I had a few issues with things like the child credit that i do not believe it filled out properly and i believe i left some money on the table (in the governments pockets?) .

In conclusion, if you are doing really simple taxes like 1040-ez, this is likely good for you. If you are doing something more complex, find yourself a good tax professional and consider using them for your own sanity. Auto-populate only partially worked, misleading cost of state filing, took forever

column2: i've used your product for 7 years, never had any problems untill this year. spent 4 hours getting to the point where i find that i don't get my state return free,"as advertized", seems that offer is only good to feb 15. then why does your deluxe edition adversize one free state return? and it does not say that offer ends at any time!!!! cost me $54.95, and i fill that you owe me that back because i would have never choose the deluxe if i'ld known i had to pay for fed and state. iwould of got thr free fed, and payed for the state. now because i waited thinking turbo tax was great and i'ld get done in plenty of time,i'm late on my state return and will have to pay a late fee and a pentilty. never use again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Maybe time for a change? After 9 years, it's time for a change. Each year the price goes up and the number of features goes down forcing you into the more expensive version. Withother products on the market why not try them? Error correction mode could be more user friendly

Sucked Big Time This was painful. Couldn't get TurboTax to do what it was supposed to. Couldn't override it. Left a lot of money on the table for the IRS when I couldn't find a way to get TurboTax to input data correctly. Couldn't handle routine tax situation. Workaround wiped out previous work

I'm a low income full time student. TurboTax advertises itself as a free option to file taxes so I thought why not.. The whole process was user-friendly, but I ended up having to pay $$ or else I would lose my state tax info and would not file. Terrible! I wish they'd been upfront well ahead of time about the potential costs so that I save some time (and money!). unexpected costs!

Save your money; Do it with pencil and paper The interview/Q&A process for the federal return is fairly straight-forward, although it takes much longer than doing it by hand with pencil and paper on the IRS forms.

column1: However the state interview/Q&A process is absolutely worthless, at least for the three states I've tried (CA, AZ, and KS). The help and information provided throughout the state process are either nonexistent or worthless (the comments and "help" if there is any, basically just restates what's already on the screen in the prompt.) There's no explanation, nor even the help info and instructions provided on the state forms and instructions themselves. They should at least provide those in PDF format for easy reference. Fed is ok; State interviews are terrible

column2: Last year I'm using this product I've been using this product since the 90s an I can honestly say that while the price keeps going up, these past three years the quality has been going down. This year I wasn't even prompted for last year's estimated tax payments so guess what - I missed it. Now I'll have to take extra notes and remember to apply my 2014 overpayment to my 2015 taxes. The "wizard" is no longer present in this software. This is officially the final year I'll be using it. Glosses over VERY important steps like applying your last year's estimated payments. Watch out! You'll miss it.
Got 'er done! I pretty much know what I'm doing, but for some reason feel the need to click thru every step in case I miss something that is new this year. The click thru is slow and annoying.

column1: Plus...I understand that you are making the program more and more easy so everyone can use it, but the "dumbing" down is getting rather annoying. Perhaps that's my fault due to forcing myself to click thru everything.
All in all, thanks for making this program. I've used it for who knows how long 15 years or so, I guess. :-) The constant click thru

Jesus - one simple line item 19 bucks extra You bait and switch lajdaki- 20 bucks extra to file an alimony line- never again. I'll paper file Stupidly expensive for an EZ form never again

column1: All these fees are not advertised and are presented *after* you painstakingly work through their mediocre software, thus committing yourself to using their service and paying their fees.
I WILL NOT USE THIS SERVICE AGAIN!!! Fees

The actual process of getting the upgrade to premier was not straightforward. Very frustrating. Hope Intuit gets smarter on this stuff. The process of upgrading to premier from deluxe in order to do what we used to do in deluxe is a huge blunder
Turbo help I would of paid for the upgrade but my tax return was so low.. when married you have all the stuff to fill which can be confusing
charged for product I didn't order when someone saysdo not add product don't add it when you say don't add product you shouldn't be charged

Easy... unless On the whole, Intuit provides a well rounded and easy to use product. I have used Intuit's software for the better part of a decade and find it to have consistent quality and have noticed some minor improvements through the years.

column1: That said, there are a few areas that cause me to give an overall poor score.

1) The software and interview questions are well thought out and easy to follow but if you have trouble finding a specific topic or question, finding it and navigating to it can be challenging (for example, unreimbursed mileage is not easily accessible and is overly cumbersome).

2) Intuit's changes to the pricing model were confusing to say the least. As consumers, we would expect a product to maintain or improve its quality and prices should remain the same or decrease. Intuit has chosen to alienate its current customers to maximize its short-term profits due to product differentiation and lock-in and is not rewarding loyalty.

3) Probably the single biggest factor causing me to rate an otherwise good product with a poor score is Intuit's blatant dishonesty in pricing. When you select a product and are required to upgrade to get additional functionality, according to Intuit's website, you need to pay the difference between the prices for the upgrade. However, when you try to make the upgrade, Intuit charges an amount greater than the difference between the prices. Specifically, based on the prices posted on Intuit's website, there is a $25 difference between the Deluxe and Premier product, but an upgrade costs $30 plus tax. There is no easy or direct way to address this, so you simply must pay the additional amount despite Intuit saying it should not be that amount. Taking the time to find someone to charge you the right amount costs more than the difference in the prices. That is simply wrong and if it is not an honest error is actual an act of fraud. Considering we are expected to entrust Intuit with hour tax filing and trusting them to carefully check our returns for accuracy and to navigate the complicated tax laws, a simple oversight in how they charge for an upgrade seems unlikely and makes me wonder if they can be trusted to gather our information and report it correctly in the tax filing process. If we are to trust Intuit to be accurate in the details, then perhaps this was not an honest mistake at all and was an intentionally misleading and fraudulent decision. Complicated to find specific interview sections that should be easier to access

column2: Not As Easy As The CD! Most difficult when attempting to pay Federal and State taxes; timed out when paying taxes and had to begin the process again. That is when I had to contact Technical Support and Customer Service to walk me through the process to complete filing. It is more difficult filing online than when I did with the CD.

updates were not working I waited until the last minute, of course, to file my return. When I tried to download Turbotax to my PC, it stalled on "Preparing to install" for 5 or so minutes before failing. My more modern Mac allowed me to install, but wanted to update. Every time I tried the update, I ran into an error and Turbotax wouldn't open. I tried all the workarounds suggested on help forums, but to no avail.

column1: On the bright side, after waiting on hold for a long time, I did get through to a customer service rep at Turbotax, and he pushed me a version of Turbotax that worked. I was able to get my taxes done with one hour to spare. couldn't download Turbotax to PC or mac without help

column2: tired took too long and I paid for it twice but was too tired to go back took too long
Probably won't use Turbo Tax again! State taxes are very hard to get done. Oil and gas royaltys and rental income are a mess!!!
bad experience this time around but felt good i understood what why i was making certain selections. Very insightful app. Information are saved at time and cannot be undone

Got the job done I went to pay for my state taxes to be filed with my refund and once I scrolled down, I saw that I was being charged almost $60 rather than the $29 fee. I clicked back and saw that they elected me to pay "plus" against my consent. I understand that they make money off of adding additional incentives but this took it beyond what was comfortable. I've used TurboTax for the past 5 years but this may be my last. Felt a little scammy this year.

Hidden Fee I understand paying $50.00 to have your taxes done as thoroughly as they do, but I don't understand having to pay an additional $39.95 for them to use a bank to disperse your funds into your account with no mention of this at the beginning, middle or even near the end of the process. They wait until the very end, which sucked. Otherwise you have the option to disagree with this fee and print it out instead and mail it in to the IRS yourself. Well, that's fine if you have a printer...but ...would if you don't? I also find it interesting that when you use the free filing option on Turbo Tax you don't have that fee of $39.95...hmmm. I know this because I filed my son's return for free with Turbo Tax at no charge and had it deposited straight into the same account as I did ours, Now that is awesome for him. Not so much for us...just doesn't make sense. We are the ones paying for the service and then have to pay even more to get our money. Even if you pay for the service by Credit Card you have to pay that fee of $39.95. Wow, Well, I think they need to disclose the extra fee right up front along side of the cost to use Turbo Tax. I found this deceitful as well as discouraging. Not sure I will go this process again next year. It is common knowledge that we all like to know costs up front. I considered this to be a hidden cost. So be aware! As you would and will not know this until you are finished and ready to pay for the cost of the service he very end. Hidden Cost

-Deceptive I came here due to your advertisements of "free e-filing, Federal and state" goodluck getting That from TurboTax, its just a lie told to get more customers coming. Youll still pay 30-60$.. Just tell people that no one likes scandalous businesses... Hope to see some improvement next year or I wont be using this software. A company that advertises one thing and gives you something else.

Disappointing this year Since they pulled that stunt of removing schedule C and jacking up the price to get it back ... then only relenting when there was an outcry ... just makes me very wary of using Intuit products. (I already stopped using Quicken when they insisted on frequent upgrades.) They also make it very hard to fill in the bank routing info on the state return if you want to mail it and avoid the e-file fee. This is all symptomatic of a company that has moved away from valuing its customers toward an attitude of arrogance instead. took out schedule C and fixed it too late

Bait'n'Switch The advertising indicated Fed and 3 state e-returns if I get the Deluxe Edition. Any extra states $19.99. When done with Fed and 1st State, Program wanted to charge $39.99 for a 2nd e-file state. Called Customer Service and was told I could not do an e-file 2nd state without paying, but reduced it to $19.99. I was irritated, but wanted to file all online. When I finally finished the returns the program wanted to charge me an additional $24..99 per state to actually e-file my returns. How do you get away with this? It should be criminal. I filed all returns by mail. Say one thing and once paid, keep charging to finish.
This app is ridiculously inept - No clear indication of where inputs map to filing forms.

column1: - Erratic results that are perceived as complete yet change on subsequent visit.
- Summary screens are inconsistently filled with data.
- Interview process causes erratic results when deemed complete, yet visiting certain pages causes other questions to be spontaneously asked which then alter the inputs.
- Drill downs of results filled from interview questions direct you to make changes directly in the forms/schedules. Pathetically inconsistent and lacking transparency

column2: Very poor service On 4/15/2015 acct log in to intuit broke down and couldn't be reset. The anxiety created was unbearable especially when I discovered that my Fed. Return wasn't filed till 4/16/2015@1:00a

column1: I've never seen such a failure of communications like this in my life.
Turbo Tax is a great product, but this is your Super Bowl 4/15
Undependable when you need them most!!! You better hope someone else doesn't offer your exact service. I've been a customer over 10 yrs, and I was more than Very Disappointed.
A very courteous C/S agent helped me in the end. His name was Kelly. I can't believe the anguish he must have taken tonight, but he was very empathetic and calm.
Anything can happen especially in the electronic world. But not having someone available to speak with is inexcusable.
RL 3 hrs later @1:00a I finally got a callback 4/16.NOT GOOD

column2: Continuity Turbo Tax is fairly easy to use, but when your personal income is derived from an S Corporation, it becomes much more complex.

column1: I purchased the TurboTax Business, to file my S Corp. taxes, then I had to go out again and purchase another TT program from my 1040 Personal filing. It took at least a half an hour on hold to TT, before a very nice, knowledgeable, and helpful lady answered (understandable because it was April 14th). After going over all my info, it was determined that the only thing I really needed from my biz filing was my K-1 form. Thus she recommended I use TT Deluxe, which included this ability.
When I went back to my account, and selected Deluxe ($59.99), it ran me through everything I needed to do my taxes, but I had to manually enter my K-1 info, because it was unable to retrieve it.
When I was finally done and ready to file, I discovered that TT was actually charging me $104.00 for TT Home and Biz, rather than TT Deluxe like I had selected. They did this without explanation.
I was in a hurry so I paid what they asked, but I will be calling them after filing season and bringing this to their attention. It will be interesting to see how they respond.

I know that S corp filings are a bit complex, but when TT sees that there is only one shareholder listed, it would be great if they offered seamless continuity...or even if there is more than one share holder. The idea is to store and track biz filing...especially Form K-1...and/or allow storage of K-1 at a site TT can recognize and access, then make it easy for the filer to do his/her personal returns by recommending the precise package for it, and offer a discounted payment option right then and there, that would allow them to go straight to their 1040 filing, would import all pertinent K-1 data automatically, and then walk them through the entire process. Charged me for wrong package. Needs continuity between biz and personal

column2: Overcharged and unsaved data I filed my taxes on turbotax at the end of March and I hit the SAVE button before logging out. This was after I entered all my information, up to the Healthcare section -- I had to stop there to call my insurance company the next day to see when my insurance started. After getting this information, I logged onto my turbotax account, and everything that I did was no longer there. Just gone. I spend at least an hour or more sitting in front of my computer and filling out all the forms the previous night. At this initial time, the turbotax prep fee was $27.99, but when I went back this past week it hiked up to a whopping $50 something... WHAT!? Thanks to the sudden hike in your charge, I ended up paying over $90 just for the prep fee. The only reason why I had to REDO it later is because turbotax failed to save my data despite the fact that I clicked the save button multiple times....

column1: I want a refund. This is absolutely ridiculous.I have used TurboTax for mutiple years now,but this time around I feel cheated and taken advantage of. Will not be returning to Turbotax next year if this is how they treat their customers. Time for me to switch to H&R block. didn't save my tax return. sudden overcharge and hike up in their cost.

column2: The good and the bad I had so much trouble finding a telephone # to even get any support. I did not appreciate filing an incident report JUST to get a stupid telephone support number. It sure felt like Turbo Tax does not want to take telephone calls. Then when you get one you have to wait an hour to get a call back. And heaven forbid if you don't get that call back answered on their first try because they won't call you back. You get to call back and start over. But by the time you get the call back, you're no longer in front of your computer and are in a car so you really don't get any answers then because you don't have information in front of you anymore. Even in my business, I attempt to call a customer 3 times before I just leave a message.

column1: Second, I did not checkmark giving to the Presidential election fund but at the very end when I am done to print out a review, lo and behold, it is checked off that I want to give. So I search the online help, and find where to uncheck it. But...if you do that, it says it will have to amend your tax papers and you can't e-file if you do that. Even though I didn't submit the e-file yet, it said that. So then I was too paranoid to correct it for fear of missing the deadline. So we wound up giving $6 away that I didn't want to give.

The price. I had to pay $55 more dollars than last year because I am self-employed. I definitely did not feel that I got that much increase in the product to justify that huge increase in price. After this year's experience (we've used this for years), I am seriously thinking I'm either hiring someone else to do it, or trying another software.
The good was that I was familiar with the product so it didn't feel as daunting since I could bring stuff over from last year for comparisons, addresses, etc.
The e-filing is nice.
Ok that's all folks... Difficult to get # & phone support. Online help so-so. Having to give to pres fund. Huge price increase for same prod.

column2: Well, darn it I owe ALOT!! I owe a lot this year due to an accounting error. I need to split my payment up some from bank account and some from credit card. Cant do that with this program, soo its a problem. Turbo Tax should allow multiple ways of paying with electronic cards. Would have been nice to put multiple accounts in to add up to the total amount due. I could have had everything done and paid for electronically in just a few minutes. Oh well.... haven't snail mailed anything in over a year... I wonder if I have any stamps. I needed to use more than one credit card to pay this year. Cant do that with turbo tax.
Form 3800 Could not get to form 3800 to enter a zero! You suck.

column1: I want a refund.
wsont take my image you such

column2: You get what you pay for Glad I used it because I waited 'til the last minute and I had no problems with it. Paid out the nose, though. I would have paid close to the same price having gone to an accountant. Expensive

It's gotten worse every year-- klunkier, more expensive, more features reserved for extra-cost versions, less help, sigh, and more.

That would be a great time to have a real person on the other end who you can talk with and they can direct you to the area you need to go or at least tell you it isn't possible to do it. Hard to get an answer to a simple question, hard to figure out what words to use to get a clear answer

Does not save info when you downgrade Ok for simple stuff, but when you are a independent contractor/self employed the delete your info when you want to transfer subscriptions and it takes forever;.....

column1: I will not be using this TurboTax because they intentionally waste your time to force you to maintain they higher priced versions by deleting all you stuff. I've used them for years but will no longer after this ordeal..... ever.... again. BullSh#t when you try to downgrade and transfer ino

column2: Mobile App - ehhh, not so much. I've been a Turbotax user for years. Tax season meant a trip to OfficeMax to buy the boxed software. A few years ago I switched to the online version, which worked very well for me. This year, yet another change - I tried the mobile app. No complaints whatsoever about entering my financial info - it worked quite well and was easy and intuitive.

column1: So, I'm ready to submit... paying with my iTunes account??? Are you serious??? I don't trust those Apple clowns with my credit card!!! So, there must be an easy way to switch my payment preference to a credit card, right? Sure, just select the Print Center from the My Account drop down in the upper left. Conveniently, this works in a browser but despite clicking every possible option in the Mobile App... nothing. Sigh. Alas, I had to revert to the browser version to complete my filing process.

Now, one more gripe. Why is the credit card option buried under Print Center? I don't actually want to destroy a forest and print the ream of paper worth of my return (hence the mobile app and e-filing?). Why would Print Center be the obvious place to look for credit card options???

Intuit, I'd rate your Mobile App 5 stars, except for the payment issue, which brings it down to a 3 star. I spent more time searching for the credit card option than I did generating my entire return. It's 2015. Time to improve your mobile app. Unable to pay TurboTax fee with credit card from iPad- had to login from good old fashioned computer/browser :(

column2: What customer service??? Although convenient, I was charged $39.99 for extra services without anyway to determine what it was for with time running out I attempted to contact the customer service # listed and number didn't include a 1 before number given. when this was determined after much time the number then said to call back when open. NOT open on April 15 Really! with no other option I agreed to the charges as time was at hand. I had already had to upgrade my service twice then was charged more that was unclear. I will continue to attempt to contact turbotax tomorrow and expect to find some satisfaction or I will devote my life to spreading the word of what a questionable operation I have experience you to be. charged $39.99 without explaination
price You advertise like this was totally free and it wasn't. False advertisement. I might do a real free service next time. They e file. wasn't free.To many questions
I Miss The Old TurboTax There is a lot to like in TurboTax Home & Business 2014.

column1: It automatically detects last year's TurboTax file on my computer and imports my name, spouse's name, our SSNs, our address, occupations, W2, and 1099 information from last year. This helps a lot as it (a) saves typing and (b) increases accuracy.

After I complete entries for this year, TurboTax offers a detailed, side-by-side comparison of my return from last year and my return from this year. Additionally, it provides a side-by-side, 5-year tax history that highlights 24 major entries on returns for the current year and the past 4 years. Though not as detailed as the 2-year comparison mentioned earlier, there is sufficient detail that I can spot trends when they are present.

Save to PDF is a wonderful feature. Though I will probably never need them, I have PDFs for the current year and the past 12 years. The PDFs are of everything: tax returns, all worksheets, eFile electronic postmark, W-2s, and more. All of those files, along with their corresponding TurboTax files and supporting PDFs from banks, employers, and others occupy only 32 MB of space on my computer and I saved copies of all of these in 2 or 3 safe places in case my hard drive fails.

Despite using TurboTax for many years, I am frustrated by its cost, which seems to rise every year. I am, also, frustrated by the number of versions, how similar all of the packages look, and how poorly the packages (and the website) describe the pros and cons of each version. Both the packages and the website contain ambiguous, color-coded checkboxes that are arranged in columns next to generic, nebuous terms stripped of all meaning. Most years, I wait for the reviews to figure which version to buy.

Once I make a decision and go to the store to buy TurboTax, store personnel (who must go into a back room to get the software because only empty boxes are kept on store shelves) bring me the wrong box then argue with me about what I am buying. I have learned to walk into the store with the SKU code for the product that I need so that I get the correct item. Some years, it seems like I spend more time reading the reviews and obtaining the SKU code than I do using the software after I purchase it.

In summary, there is a lot to like about the TurboTax product and a lot to hate about the way that TurboTax (actually, Intuit, the makers of TurboTax) treats me. If the other major vendor of tax software were to assure me that they could import all of my past TurboTax files with their software, I would switch to the competitor in a minute. I won't mention the name of the competitor as I don't want my review to be deleted for having mentioned another brand name. Suffice it to say that there is competition out there that I think merits consideration. Until the competition can import my TurboTax files from years past, I will keep paying too much money for, and working too hard to purchase, TurboTax. Becomes More Expensive Every Year

column2: Major Non-Resident State Issues I have used TacAct the last 3 years. I used to use Turbotax, but it was getting too expensive, so I switched. This year I switched back to Turbotax because my broker imports all my stock trades and other info automatically, so I decided to pay the premium turbotax fees.

column1: Federal was Ok. I would still like to see a simpler walk through. It seemed on many screens it was clear if I needed to click on a topic or if turbo tax was going to take me there anyway. Not impressed with many dumb questions and info that should have been self populated or calculated from other info.
I would recommend creating an app to take pictures of all your forms and it would capture all the info and input it autimatically.

Filing the state taxes things got worse. I sometimes didn't know what was being asked. Or the same info was asked to be input on 2 consecutive pages, where a different layout of question would have been much clearer faster and simpler. It seemed like people who had no knowledge of the individual states created layout and flow of questions.

I live in one state and work in another. Filing one state as nonresident and then getting a credit in my resident state. Wow what a nightmare. At one point Turbotax asked me what portion of my AGI was from my nonresident state. Shouldn't Turbotax know the answer to this. Why do I have to pay $39.95 per state if I have to figure out what is being asked. I had to go to the internet and do research. And even then I wasn't sure it was correct. Taxes are complicated, but that is why I pay Turbotax to make it easy.
I will be using TaxAct next year again. Granted their layout and questions aren't much better, but if I am going to file my taxes possibly incorrect, I can do it their for a 1/3 of the price.
Certainly with all the money being collected, a few people could be hired to review nonresident tax issues and some writers to word questions simple and in layman's terms.
Very frustrated and a little nervous about the accuracy of my state returns. Not sure what was being asked on state. State does not always calculate answers automatically from data given.

column2: Not as good as previoussly The guided steps were easy to follow. However, when specific items came up (e.g. hobby income), it took a long time to get information.

column1: I like the way it used to be set up where you could either go through the guided or fill in the forms individually. I often need to look at the 1040 for specific details, but was not able to do this on the online version this year. finding exact answers and forms, a problem

column2: Fairly smooth sailing Program was easy to use for most part. The "deductions" area could have been a little less confusing though, specifically the education expense area, and the State: homeowner credit area.

column1: Also, the real estate and investments section was removed from the Deluxe version, forcing me to pay extra for the "Premium" version, thereby nullifying my company discount. I will take a serious look at the competition next time! bumped up to higher (expensive) version unsuspectingly!

column2: Brain Dead Stupidity...... I have been filing taxes now since 1967. And, I have been using Turbo Tax for at least 15 years now. Listen because I have something to say here....never, I mean never has my personal taxes been as difficult to do as they are this year. I wanted to take a sludge hammer to both your Turbo tax and my computer. I mean questions, things I have never heard of before, silly questions and repeating the same things over and just dealing with BS that is enough to wanna move to a foreign country is what I think of this tax filing season. You used to be easy. Now, you're not easy, you're actually hard to the point that i wanna just beat my computer to death over...... Terrible, that's all i can think of here.....

column1: I had trouble with the free upgrade to business. I only make a few hundred on the side.

I had trouble with a free upgrade to premium or something. Neither worked because i needed access to my "account". Even though i typed in the correct password and question answer I was rejected. I gave up. Until today. then it seems to have corrected itself. Thank you. Couldn't find the software I'm use to.

column2: Good help if you know nothing about taxes. I have been using Turbo Tax since I filed my first return in the mid nineties. It was always a good program if you had a simple return, fast, cheap, and effective. Now that my returns are getting more complicated, I am lost on some of the questions, they go off tangent and have nothing to do with the input I gave. What should be simple gets confusing. Not only that the cost has skyrocketed in the last couple years. I paid almost $100.00 for the version I needed to use this year. I know tax preparers that cost about that much and understand the tax code in a way that I don't that I'm sure can get me better results. I am considering not using again for that reason. Bottom line if you don't have anything more than a 1040ez Turbo is for you, if not prob good to get a tax preparer for the same money. Confusing at times, cost is way to high.

Unexpected additional fees I didn't appreciate that I was charged and additional $45 for combining my state and federal returns. I had to pay a total of $95. Last year I only paid $40. The "deluxe" didn't even provide me any additional benefits. I ended up paying additional money for no good reason. By the time I got to the end, I wasn't willing to start over BUT I learned that I WON'T be using TurboTax again! For $95 I'd rather pay a real person to do my taxes so I know I'm getting the most out of my return. Overpriced and shady business practices. I'm incredibly disappointed in TurboTax. hidden fees
too many hidden fees & too hard to get a hold rep i bought turbo tax for ~$50

No Way No Refund I need a class from Turbo tax to learn more on doing our own taxes. Its like your trying to trip us up to make mistakes so we have to get audit or pay more into IRs to much changes on wording and switching things around

full of lies lies and full of bull its not free when it says it is

additional charge Turbotax claims to file your taxes for free, so i went through the entire process of entering all of my information from 2014.
