column2: Not as good as last year. Still a vast improvement over doing everything by hand. User friendly. Has good feel.

column1: It took me ten or twelve tries to get e-file to work. This is the SSL bug.
The $40 price for business software, the $40 for an extra state, and the $25 for e-filing state pushes the cost to where hiring an accountant becomes a reasonable alternative.
The review fails to specify what the corrections are for. It is opaque, frustrating, and only marginally useful. Transmission bug. High cost of add ons. The review feature is terrible.

column2: Only the thinigs I did not like 1. The program did not prompt or instruct me how to save my work to restart it later -- continue entering information, to or to change something I had entered, or add something I was not sure of during the entry process.

column1: 2. There was not option or instruction to re-enter the program and choose to file electronically, after I said I do not want to file electronically on the first prompt (because I have some items I need to edit before filing).

3. When I answered "No" to the question about child care expenses, the program responded "Great, you will save because of your child care expenses." It incorrectly prepared form 2441 with an odd amount of $9.
4. Did not give me the option to apply any of my tax refund forward to tax year 2015. Missing prompts, and apparent errors

column2: Versions dumbed down and must purchase Premier now Let's see if Intuit deems my review to include "inappropriate attitude"! Seriously, you're only allowed to have your review posted if you pass some editorial standard that remains veiled in secrecy! Hope it's not the F*x News crew doing the editing...

column1: I've been using TurboTax since 1993. That's right, for more than 20 years.
First of all, I'm pretty p*ssed off about having to purchase the Premier version this year #around $100 MSRP# just so I could fill out a Schedule C for small business income.

I've been able to do this for years using the Deluxe edition, usually paying no more than around $60 for it, and this year, "Tough luck, partner. You know you need the Schedule C so you'll pay the extra money for Premier, you'll smile about it, and you'll please now shut up and quit whining. In fact, we at Intuit had many meetings about this very topic and it works out best for our bonus plan if we make this change! Like I said, tough luck, ch*mp!"

And it's only because I read about the change in the press that I didn't buy the Deluxe version only to have to stand in line trying to return it after I had opened the CD, installed it the software, and found out at the last minute that I couldn't complete my tax return!
Seriously, you think a clerk at Walmart is going to believe that "No, I really didn't use it even though I opened it, see, because it wouldn't allow me to do this thing called a Schedule C..."
Classy, Intuit. Notice how I refrained from prof*nity here..

Further, with each passing year, the amount of helpful information available to a tax filer from within the program is diminishing, and this year, every time I clicked on "Learn More", it was like "D*ng it, you ask too many questions. If you don't understand our very high level explanation, it OBVIOUSLY doesn't apply to you!"
Does this sound vaguely familiar?:
The first thing you need to know is that this deduction is extremely hard to qualify for, because your qualified expenses must exceed 2% of your Adjusted Gross Income #AGI...

Personally, I'd have opted to put this dire warning into the medical expenses "Learn More" verbiage, where my expenses must exceed NOT a measly 2%, but a whopping 10%, yes 10% of my #AGI. Just sayin'.
Soooooo much less helpful than it used to be.

I can imagine calling customer service with this remark and hearing, "What, you want us to keep including in the product the I.R.S. forms you might need to consult? Whaddaya think the I.R.S. web site is for? Well?!!!"
No offense, but it would undoubtedly be delivered in an offsh*re accent, too. Maybe I should say, "No offence".
At any rate, gone are the days when I had immense confidence in the "interview process", or what they now call "walk me through it".
I must have answered maybe six questions beyond importing last year's return before I had to resort to "You have got to be kidding me, it would be faster to just do it myself" mode.
You know, where you give up on the interview because you're being asked an irrelevant question which you don't know how to answer, and yet the "wizard' simply won't let you past this page.
Which software should I use next year, peeps? I am truly open to your responses...
BTdubs, this "Submit a Review of TurboTax" page does not load properly in Firefox, and only works in Internet Explorer. Just sat there at "Loading..." in Firefox. HTML5? Anyone? Bueller? Bueller?

BT Double Dubs, Though it might not seem it, I'm the kind of guy who will seek out the manager at an IHOP when I get something just a little North of mediocre, half-hearted service, to COMPLIMENT my server to the manager in the hopes that maybe, just maybe, my remark might make a difference... Drives my wife nuts, of course, but hey, even she would agree that I'm not a sour puss. I have been charitable in my criticism. Feel free to contact me for a software as a service product development and management consulting gig. I can give you over 500 IQ points worth of service in just three people. Can't see if/when it updated to most recent regulations

column2: Forced Into Paying Extra After having file rejected for something simple, I then had to spend the next half hour trying to convince the site that i didn't want to pay for PLUS service.

column1: Because of just now finding out they were rejected, I didn't have any more time and just went with the PLUS service because no other option would present itself.
Feel like i've been cheated. If you have to go back and refile, you will be tossed around for a while

column2: another tax year I have used turbo tax for years. Loyalty should count for service and price pricey

Had some major issues this year with product Had issues this year with product. Not 100% happy. The Turbotax Online version was not designed to allow changes in all forms which ruined my State Tax filings

Review This is the last year I will be using TurboTax. I can go to other sites and get actual FREE e-filing done that includes my 401K and IRA/Roth information. $60 to do my taxes this year and it's the same information as last year. Thanks, but no thanks. I imagine you won't be offering free filing next year. I can take my taxes to your competitors and talk to a live person and ask questions for about as much as you wanted from me AND they file my state taxes for free. Ridiculous. I know you need to make money, but I think I am done here. Thanks for all the really good previous years. God help you if you have a 401K or an IRA/Roth. You want to charge me $60 for that.

WTF This will be the last time i use TurboTax, i am disappointed with the hidden fees. i don't remember this from last year. Plus now i am filling married filling separate and i was hoping for a easier process. lots of hidden fees.

2x data entry, fields don't respond, FRUSTRATING!! My penultimate frustration was TT's reference to the wrong number or field in several cases, combined with deductions in Schedule E being ADDED rather than subtracted!! This wasn't unique. And the HELP pop-ups were worthless! often having nothing to do with the query.

column1: But the ultimate frustration, what took most of the 15th to try, regrettably unsuccessfully, to file MFS in PA for my wife while I live in VA and we filed MFJ fed. TT's solution is to build dummy returns (time consuming and... come on, you can't programme this????) I tried another work-around, which also failed so I'll be mailing the PA return a day late, and definitely a dollar short. I mean, they took my money for the PA return, THEN informed me that it still won't work!
And, uh, WHY? Why can't a state return be filed electronically after the fed has been filed, since I had to dummy-up the state in a separate file?
I had a similar problem last year; I just thought, hoped, they'd have made some improvements, but the little incompatibilities seemed worse also.
It could definitely be more user friendly.
Definitely looking for a better programme for next year. have to re-enter data; wrong data transfers; adds vs subtracts,...on & on...

column2: Slow process The process was long, drawn out, and difficult to follow. I am disappointed. I started this process very early but ended up submitting it at 12:20 a.m. because of a technical error. Nearly impossible to find the where to uncheck Audit Protection!

Wrong Time Zone This product placed me in an earlier time zone than I am stating that I filed my taxes an hour later than I did in reality. 1145pm is NOT the same as 1245am in any time zone. TExas in NOT New York! put me in an earlier time zone
ok Some of the verbage was confusing. Took longer than expected. Confusing

Disappointed with product I'm disappointed in this product's pricing policies. Paid to download our state program (even though other states are "free") because of my student's income from two states, only to be hijacked into paying again to file both states' returns. I thought your product included filing once it was purchased. Am I missing something?? I will be contacting customer service and the BBB as I feel this is a deceptive practice. Won't be using TurboTax again. Double charged for product

2014 premier Have loved TurboTax for years- makes me feel like a professional! This year I didn't feel that the carryover information was as seamless as in years past. I felt like I had to enter information that previously would have been automatic, and that there was a lack of recognition regarding some of my assets. I am by no means an expert, just giving my 2 cents.

payment Originally was going to pay for efiling of state taxes by using federal refund, but because I didn't have easy access to my bank's routing number I had to go back and change the payment to credit card. I evidently didn't notice that the charge for an ugraded account was preselected until I printed my receipt. So now I have paid an extra $40 for an upgraded account for a student that only made $2000 last year. Instead of just the $29 state filing fee. deceiving

horrible!!!!! I was charged $89 for something that was supposed to be "FREE" I will never recommend turbotax to anyone EVER! In fact, I will strongly encourage others to take their business elsewhere.

column1: p.s. I very much appreciate my $25 refund. EVERYTHING!

column2: it's good It had all of the deductions available for you an the navigation to perpare your taxes is great. very costly

Turbo Tax Great but Expensive Turbo Tax is very easy and quick, but this might be the last year I use it due to price. My parents and siblings all use other services that they were happy with and all were cheaper. Cost continue to go up
Really angry Said I could print return after e-filing..didn't happen

column1: Don't like being forced to do this review
Actual cost of using this software was not clear
See no reason for answering the personal questions listed below. Good for telemarketers No opportunity to print return Forced to do this review

column2: so so  too many repetive questions

Last 10 years Good, this year HSA filed wrong! My HSA contributes got all assigned as taxable income on my return - I will need to file an amended return to fix this. It kind of defeats the point of an HSA if it is all taxable income!

column1: In years past, I'd rate them 5 out of 5, this year I was surprised to find that the HSA information raised my taxes - that is just wrong. In reviewing the forms everything ended up adding to my income, and there wasn't any of it that was shown as tax free. It should have all been as 100% of my HSA went for medical expenses.
The website said that as of 4 hours before the filing date they still had not fixed either the web or the desktop version.
And they raised their price this year! Yeah, fine, but write me a check for the $400 I lost by your screwing up, or refile it for me.
Waiting to hear about a fix.
-C HSA contributes filed as taxable

column2: OK looks like we could have put everything in personal income, not business, so $100 charge was more than $60 for straight personal Didn't need to file business taxes
too expensive WAY OVER-PRICED!!! could not view my returns before payment was required

plus I really liked it it was easy and did not take so long. But I am upset because I said no to turbo plus multiple times and it took out the extra 29.99 plus what I had to pay for my state. I had to let it go because today is the last day and i just made it and I didnt want to take any chances but all the different times you asked I may have said yes and not noticed because of the wording. I feel that is deceiving. and 60 dollars is a lot to me. But oh well I suppose atleast Im getting something and Im alive I said no to turbo plus multiple times

Too Expensive $105 to file federal taxes is way too high. On top of that, I thought my state return was included UNTIL I got ready to file - BOOM another $40! Was going to pay with my refund, but BOOM - another $40 fee just to pay with my return. Come on. Way too expensive and does not reveal hidden charges
The fees just a keep on coming when you use TurboT  They get you when you buy and they get when you use it!

Would not let me take proper deductions The program would not let me fill out anything for the Earned Income Credit unless I used the overide for the lines to manually imput it and then it refused to let me e-file. As I pulled up the section to fill it out using the programs guidance it told me i was quailifed, but refused to let me fill anything out and was not even given the option to.

column1: over all expirence was good until the program was under the belief that it was far more intelligent than I, and still could not follow basic tax law instructions.
I've used turbo tax for 15 years, and this will be my last year that I will use this program. poor deduction management

column2: Feeling iffy this year Turbo Tax was simple to use this year - as it has always been. However, as a family with very limited income, the basic free package has changed and the 1040 was not included. I constantly had the popup to upgrade to the $59 product. NOT AFFORDABLE for me. That was VERY disappointing. Really nothing changed for me, there was nothing special about my taxes this year, but I don't have a good comfortable feeling that it was correct. COST!

big bugs in this year's TurboTax for Mac I didn't realize until reviewing our return ready to e-file that several items did not transfer properly from our 2013 return. Assets added to the depreciation list in 2013, our loss carry-overs, and therefore all of the history for 2013 was wrong. To try to start again with a new transfer would have cost me several days work, time which I didn't have, so I had to pull up our 2013 return, review and print out many schedules and forms and correct everything on our 2014 worksheets. I really hope I got it all. I don't know if this is a continuation of Intuit not putting as much staffing to the MAC programs or what, but after using Turbo Tax for many years, I was super mad at finding these errors.

NO HELP, not right State of KY never downloaded - supposed to be free with Home and Business; purchased separately still could not do it. Repeated calls and attempts thru computer from Feb to April 14 were extremely frustrating.

column1: Last time ever to use Turbo Tax and I have been a regular custormer for over 10 years CD sent service or downloaded.
Could not find last years return and had email where you filed it no help on that either... Help by phone useless, 34 min wait or call center in Phillipines with difficult accent

column2: Took me 8:30 hours to file with Turbo Tax Last year I used Turbo Tax with no problem, was easy step by step guidance. This year Turbo Tax changed the program and it was very VERY complicated. At times it will take me back to where I started or to the previous page to then take me back again and again and again like a dead road. Then it will tell me that I need to upgrade when actually I have the easiest filing form and it can be done FREE. I have a headache and I didn't eat anything the whole day because I was against time April 15.

column1: On top of everything I finished my filing at 12:30 on the 16, which I started at 4 pm on the 15 and I couldn't do my son's filing. Since last year Turbo Tax was so easy I thought I could finish both filings in less than 2 hours, so at 4pm I had more than enough time. The website is soooooooo complicated that I was with Customer Service on the phone from around 8pm to 12:30 am. Extremely dissapointed! Worst website to fije

column2: Fees I did not even make that much money and still had to pay an outrageous fee to just submit my tax return. I did not want any extra services such as turbo tax being able to help if I was audited. I was still charge for that fee. I will not use Turbo Tax again due to this. I could delete the extra fee for filing even though it stated 29.99 I was charged 59.99.
worst product ever 2014 software sucks! Got screwed by not being able to do 1099-B. No notice. VERY ANGRY!
Used Turbo for several years I finished and submitted my return at 10:22 pm MDT on 4/15/2015. The time stamp put on my return was Eastern time at 12:22 am on 4/16/2015.

column1: I live in Denver, CO and the time stamp should be in the time zone in which I live.
If that is the best Turbo Tax can do....I will not use them again. Time stamp on return

column2: Nice - But not MAC Friendly Easy to follow, been using for years. Might be time to put down the guard and work with APPLE, MACs are here to stay. Having to TAB everything to move down the page is aweful

column1: Wow - you can use the arrow to scroll down to complete the review, but not to complete the forms. That makes no sense. hit with little fees here and there. NOT MAC FRIENDLY. NO NEED TO UPGRADE TO YOSEMITE-you know you could have made a lit

column2: Last Year I will use Turbo Tax Turbo Tax took me all day to complete and cost more than going to have someone do a simple federal and state tax return form me. I work in a reciprocal state, and the program wasn't applying taxes I paid in one state to the other state. Difficult to get help, expensive, especially with multi states

Not So Easy Going back to look at or change input is not straight forward. Should be able to look at the completed form and have an interactive entry ability to click and go back to that entry screen and to then jump back to where you left off. If that is possible, sure could not find it.

Free or not Free I was under the impression I was getting a free state efile, but when I finished my return I had to pay 29.99 - with the deadline looming I paid - but feel that I got misrepresented on what was covered in the money I already spent on the software. Misrepresented free e-File

very bad service I was on hold for about an hour, just to find out the person that take my call have some "issues" with his computer, he put me on hold again ........loooong hold, he never come back, I got disconnected because already closed, very, very bad and frustrating they put me on hold forever

Sucked to be PR for my brother! Your tax software online doesn't allow much help for someone who died in early 2015 before their 2014 return was able to be filed. It kept asking me to file a Form 1310 - which is for someone that ISN'T the court-appointed Personal Rep. Took forever to find out I had to file by mail, and I'm disappointed - won't ever use your software again for any kind of estate or representative capacity! Took TWO hours of being on hold to get answers

Hidden Charge Overall it was easy to use and free for federal but charges for state which would be fine if it was the 29.99 it said it would be but then it gives you the option to pay with a credit card or take it out of your refund which i opted to take it out of my refund. At the VERY end when you're going to file it tells you how much is being taken out for the charges, it was 60 because it charged me for turbo tax plus which i did not sign up for. I searched this and someone said you can get the charge taken off if you pay by credit card so i went back and paid by credit card and it still charged me for turbo tax plus which I do not want. can't report other income without being issued a form

Never Again One minute I'm getting back a couple hundred bucks, then I add make a minor adjustment to a deduction and I owe the IRS over $1,000,000. TurboTax used to be a pretty reliable program for me but I'll never use it again after 2014. Also, they charged me $54.99 instead of the $44.99 discounted price that they advertised and I clicked on. Thanks for nothing, TT. God Bless America. No idea whether or not calculations are done accurately

Very disappointed I purchased Intuit TurboTax (Deductions & Homeowners Deluxe) at Staples for $40. Once I complete my taxes, I am charged another $70. All of this for a simple 1040 EZ return! I have always used Turbo Tax for my taxes. This will be the last year I do. had to pay for filing taxes even though I'd already paid for it at Staples
Charged for State Tax I was charged $30 for my state tax return after being told I wouldn't be charged. Don't use this stupid lying company. Everything

Very Unhappy I have used Turbo Tax for the last few years. This year though you wouldn't let me attach to my old tax files unless I upgraded to Turbo Tax Plus! I don't need that program because I had a very basic return since I am a student. It was REALLY disappointing that I couldn't just keep it simple. I didn't accept your offers to upgrade but I am disappointed in Turbo Tax. You kept bugging me to upgrade!
never again your turbotax wil be used. hold up transmitting federal return till state fee was paid
Stop the Charge Card FEES .. WOW ! HUGE Credit Card Processing fee... needs more WARNING !

column1: Is that Turbo Tax fee or is that American Express?
Also..just need SIMPLER excel - like functionality; instead of hiding info in forms; perhaps need IRS form Changes..to simplify ! HUGE Credit Card Processing fee... needs more WARNING !

column2: disappointed Well I've used turbo tax a few years running, but this was the most disappointing. The web site kept throwing error messages that were a hassle to get through. But mostly I felt my taxes were not all that complicated this year, a couple w-2's, a basic 1099 that they charged me a extra 45 for and a few donations. Overall it cost me 85, which I do not own a business, any real estate or any investments. high price, error messages
What happened to it starting for free What happened to starting for free. And Why efile if I still have to mail something in? Dumb. Cost $100 just to file

My Turbo Xperience So, all in all, fairly good experience, but it's still cheaper to go by way of Turbo on the Internet, because this xperience cost approximately $90. When I purchased the package, I was under the impression that filing the State was also free to efile, but it wasn't

Not Impressed After thinking I was done and ready to file, there was one last check that had me digging into last years return to find answers for all the blanks that needed filled. I was at the last minute anyway (my fault), but those little items caused me to file after midnight. Why weren't these little items found earlier in the process?

column1: Also, I found this online service to be way too expensive. I've used a disc in the past and will go back to it going forward. I HATED that at the end there were bunches of blanks to fill in or I would have to mail it in. It was almost midnight!!!

column2: Teddy's World  My software had data on it for the Miller family.
Product quality significant decline After using Turbo Tax for the last 15 years, this version has left me no choice but to make a change for the future.

column1: 1) Don't be deceived by the slick interface, you are paying more for style not substance.

2) The so called change in versions to match there online version was just a smoke screen just to charge more and make it look like they improved the product. I have seen no substantial improvement in the Home & Business version in over 3 years
3) They used to clearly tell you how much they would charge to efile a return and it was reasonable. Now they are getting you both with added product cost and higher filing fees for your state return

4) When you have a complex return with lots of various personal and business deductions and you need to go back to make corrections to specific sections, be prepared for it to be more difficult to and time consuming to do because the software will forget questions you already answered and make you answer them again. This was even after saving it multiple times at multiple points in the data entry process.

5) Finally, the detailed information on what specific types of deductions can and cant be put on each has basically trimmed back so they can charge you more for information they used to normally include in the product. Poor depth of information on most topics

column2: patronized are the unneeded animations, and a back button that jumps all the way to the start of each section truly necessary? Also it's uncool to preselect the more expensive option, then not allow the tax return to be downgraded without wiping all of my data, Including prior year returns. many
I don't like the hidden costs...Signed up for $54.99 fee ended up costing $35.00 more. Too many stupid questions...I feel like TurboTax is designed for idiots.Too many hidden costs.

Refund Filed...But! Once I got all through with my refund and was ready to pay the Turbo Tax filing costs; I realized I didn't need to use the Home & Business plan/product. I didn't earn any money from the business. I only had expenses and was unable to get any common business deductions. I felt I should change my product to just the Federal Free Edition but was unable to. Unable to chane the TurboTax product

Sneaky charges Simple to use, but there are sneaky charges, and promises of benefits that aren't there. Forcing upgrades that are not beneficial, and there is no way to return. I am not happy with this years TurboTax. I'll most likely not return. My taxes should have been ultra simple, and yet I paid $100 to file. a lot of sneaky charges

I believed you until the end I don't appreciate that you claim federal is free until the very end. I rent I have no investments no deductions why did I need the deluxe . I was conned ! PLEASE LOOK INTO THAT AND EXPLAIN WHY MY BASIC FEDERAL NEEDED DELUXE... At the very end you tell me my simple return needs the deluxe. You need more detailed instructions

Sneaky I was inadvertently charged for turbo tax plus without my consent as they push it on you so hard that it makes it confusing. Where i thought i was paying for my state tax filing, i was mislead and made to purchase TT plus ALONG with my state filing, although unbeknownst to me. I didn't figure it out until it said i was charged $59.98 which I thought was VERY misleading. Be careful when paying for your state filing that you don't get charged for TT plus. They push it on you so hard and confuse you when you are paying for your state filing. overly pushy to buy the TT Plus, and VERY redundant

Sofware problems with 1116 Foreign Tax & Carryover Form 1116 Foreign tax paid doesn't work correctly in system. This included carryover. System is not picking up the amounts nor putting everything in, but gives error for missing data and will not let it go anyway. Turbo Tax doesn't work correctly with Stifle Financial Data. IT also picks up items from previous years that are not being used this year. Errors corrected in FED do always get fixed in State.

column1: wait TOO long on for phone help Tax week and previous weeks. I was cutoff the phone line and now way to reach person. I had to start over again. This took 5 more hours after the previous 3+. doesn't work correctly for carryover, Foreign tax, and loading some Financial data.

column2: didnt get them done I liked that it was easy do believe that I just had an issue in my situation but other wise maybe it will be easier next year. didnt get them done

Problems with Sched H !! There seems to be something "buggy" with the Schedule H questionnaire starting with the Taxpayer or Spouse "radio buttons" Seems that the program is setup to have the Taxpayer own the EIN when that is not our case. It was difficult to only do one Sched H it seem to force doing two of them.

column1: 2. on MA state return entering the 1099-H for family, section was not too clear especially if you switched subscriber (i.e. full year coverage but part with husband and part with wife). Took waay too much time going back and forth to figure a way through. At this price this shouldn't happen!! .

3. Electronic signature was wonky. It would not accept my name (which I know how to spell) saying there was case sensitivity??! I ended up cutting/pasting the name text below my signature block !! Again didn't need all that after everything else Sched H!! and Electronic Signature

column2: this year sucks i have used turbo tax for about 6 years but never again you cannot fix thing easily and i wanted to send my returns in this year by mail but i could not. this sucked next year hr block here i come. goodbye turbo tax.i am telling my children the same thing and letting people at work know as well. cannot fix things easily

Service was awful! I waited patiently for someone to take my call. When I finally get someone on the line the call instantly drops by no fault of my own or my carrier. So I call back and for whatever reason the system tells me it will have a rep call me back this time. This was never offered as an option the first time, and I have yet to receive a call back from a rep. Though I should not have waited until the last minute, I am still paying $90 and am not receiving ANY service! Furthermore, the system automatically directed me to the more expensive option despite my taxes being the most basic type. I am single, don't have kids, or own property. Why are you directing me to the deluxe package. I am very disappointed with the service I've received (rather lack of) and feel like TurboTax is only out to get my money. waited to speak to person, then call drops and no one calls back!
chief74 Very easy to use. I pay an accountant $250 and drop it off this cost me more then half that plus an hour of my time! very expensive for do it yourself efile

Took forever to delete Deluxe option It is harder and harder every year to escape getting extra fees added to the end bill and this year I had to delete and start all over in order to get rid of the extra $100 that somehow got tacked on to the final bill. Sneaky way of adding more charges

Sneaky Everything with my filing was going well, and then I read the final agreement, and it shows $59.98 coming out of my refund. I was expecting half that, and upon closer inspection, read that I was signed up for the Plus version, instead of the standard 'free' version. Now, I remember DISTINCTLY having declined the upgrade. Twice. Imagine my surprise when I found out that I was paying for it after all. I then started to click the 'back' button until I reached the final page that I would be able to decline the upgrade. Except you can't reach that page once you've gone past a certain point. So I was trapped, having to pay for something I didn't, and don't, need. I don't know where that decline page or button is, so you did a good job of hiding it. But maybe you shouldn't advertise as a 'free' federal return. Snuck the plus in on me

i should have went to my tax guy This was my first time on TurboTax...I like the easy set up but at the end it ask for two payments. one from State and Federal which was not stated in the beginning of starting your taxes. I was very upset! I also was upset about how it ask for a pin number and it was after 11:00pm and the IRS was closed. It also charged me for something else which was $34 dollars. I will not be coming back to TURBO TAX EVER! payments for state and federal was not explain properly
Just as difficult as last year When you get to the filing portion of the program, you guys obviously make it more difficult to print your state return to file by mail. I remember this from last year.
IT USED TO SAVE ME TIME BECAUSE YOU FOLLOWED THE PRIOR YEARS RETURN. THIS YEAR, YOUR SOFTWARWE RAN ME AROUND IN CIRCLES FOR HOURS!!!!!!!!!!!

column1: I WILL NEVER RECOMMEND YOUR PRODUCT AGAIN. YOU WASTED AN ENORMOUS AMOUNT OF MY TIME!!!!!!

column2: user unfriendly very upsetting that when you are FINALLY ready to file MORE charges are put on. very sneaky. you cannot readily see the forms you are working with. still not sure if i can get a hard copy for my records. not like original turbo tax which ive used for many years and have all stored on my computer. time to change to another product do not understand why the third charge was added at the end it was not explained!!! seeing forms going back into the return is difficult overpriced
Derailed my Income Tax Return This software has taken a turn for the worst. I use to prepare my taxes every year with this software. This year was an extraordinarily disappointment.

column1: There were an inordinate amount of glitches in the software that caused my screen to go blank on numerous occassions.

Finally, upon attempting to eFile my return the application would not submit the return. After numerous redirects to review, which I did on 7-8 occassions. It would not submit the return, though the screen indicated that it had been filed. I attempted to put my bank routing information and it would not submit. I indicated I would send via mail, it still wouldn't submit. It's broken and needs to be fixed or refunds for the product should be returned for the purchase price. filled with gitches, screen blanking out

column2: Worst Customer Service As TurboTax promised this year, I tried to run "Free Upgrade" to Premier from Deluxe. However, the screen won't take the charge off and I end up paying $30. Struggled for hours to figure out how to process, I called customer service. The lady answered the phone was very unprofessional and rude. Not only knowing how to talk to customers in correct ways, she asked me to pay to talk to the Technical Support. No help at all. I do not understand the reason this company made announcement which they can't follow. I've been using TurboTax for years but this will be the last year.
A certain price was advertised for the deluxe, but in he end Turbo Charged me more!
Not enough explanation. Many times I didn't know what you were talking about. This was my worst turbo tax ever. I will never buy it again.
Thought the federal was free was charged $60.00 + $40.00 f/state

Annoyed I chose the program that was free for the Federal return and $30 for the state. The process was very simple and well guided. I was happy with the process of filling out the information. I believed I had declined all opportunities to upgrade. As I finished up, I had an extra charge of $30. I went back through the process several times to ensure that I did not approve any upgrades. I felt that this was a complete bait and switch situation and my fee was doubled at the very end. Surprise cost at the end
Poor product It seems every part of turbotax is designed to trick you into being upsold into a more expensive product. upselling to the extreme
I thought the price for turbo tax was half the price. was shocked and unpleasantly surprised regarding the price. i would have used someone else if i had known it was going to be over $100 price

Full Pricing Shouldn't Be A Surprise I also did not like how you sprang another Fee on me when I had to report a K-1 Form which is a rare event this year. I had no indication ahead of time that this would spark a higher fee structure. The fees just keep flying at you. I really think this is particularly inexcusable with respect to filing State Taxes. Obviously most people want to do both. You should make it clear what it will cost upfront to do both instead of making the price seem lower!

column1: Finally, I was offered a $20 discount because of coming to you from Vanguard but I did not see that Deduction in price clearly reflected. I think there was some discount but I don't think it was $20. I strongly dislike how you spring new fees when it comes to filing State Taxes together with Federal. BE HONEST UPFRONT

column2: Update your system I tried to pay for the state portion, but every time I tried to pay an error message said they could not validate my credit card information and then i had 5 purchases/reversals and then 2 purchases on my bank statement. That is not alright, it could have told me my address was wrong, my phone number, etc etc etc. From beginning to finish when I actually got that part over with and then filing my taxes took over 3 hours. Seriously... need to update everything. Doesn't tell you what is wrong with certain things
I've been happier with Intuit. I have always liked Intuit and the products that you provide. My taxes are completed and you tell me that they have been filed correctly and accurately. Thank you.

column1: I have to tell you that the sales team bouncing across the screen every other page <on tax day> is extremely annoying. If I am using a free version, that would be one thing. I shouldn't have to put up with that once I'd upgraded.

Additionally, I started with the free version and that would probably have completed my taxes effectively. Having all of my data and strong-arming me on tax day for the 29.99, disregarded my years of loyalty with you, but didn't surprise me. You're right, if you don't care about customer loyalty, that was well worth my time and again, thank you.

I want someone to explain to me why you strong-armed the sale of the Deluxe package before you would complete the filing, Popping up every few screens to tell me that Deluxe was a better option, and then telling me that I had to do the upgrade to complete filing, leaves me questioning the integrity of that sale; was the $25 more important than integrity? Unless there was a reason that was never explained, I didn't see any value from it and would like to know why that was important enough to stop my filing and what benefitted me or my return. The sales team needs to take a break!!

column2: very easybut one thing everything was easy until i needed to put in the pin. it kept rejecting my information and in order to file i had to guess what i made last year. who even remember the exact amount??? its been a whole year. its going to delay my taxes but i rather have something filed. got stuck when i needed a pin.
no refund the cost is more than I expected . cost is more than planned

Convenient, but Tricky Each year Turbo Tax gets more and more creative in its attempts to trick you into either buying Turbo Tax Plus (which you don't need) or sending your refund somewhere OTHER than your own bank account (would I like my federal refund in Chucky Cheese credits? Why no, I would not).

column1: You'll have to answer like 17 riddles and click on like 14 moving buttons, but as long as you can do that you'll love the Turbo Tax Experience. Tricks, Misdirection

column2: Epic Fail Should have free state file from website without going through free alliance. as a poor student, rip off for wanting more than my state refund to file state

Very disappointed this year Very disappointed that I went through the trouble of doing my Federal return and 5 state returns to find out Premier couldn't complete my taxes because I worked in 7 states. Had to download and upgrade then after hours of transferring and rechecking, my resident state return still isn't correct. Lots of money now invested and tons of time for inaccurate return that I can't figure out how to correct it as it is not in the questions it is in the calculations. I'm taxed for income made in other states appropriately and again in my home state again. Thus it shows I owe my home state because nothing was withheld for it on out of state earnings. Been using Turbo Tax Premier since 2009 and never had this much problems or this much expense. Very disappointed. Premier only takes 5 states, upgrades and return still wrong
Good product. Make it easier to ise app on phone/tablet.

Not good for ESPP and RSUs Selling ESPP and RSUs requires changes to the cost basis else one can get double taxed. There is very little information on this from Turbotax and the software is not intelligent enough to determine potential mistakes. Very little information and help on how to deal with ESPP and RSU

I tried to get the Amazon gift card, and the program just kept sending me in circles. I was never able to submit my return. Very frustrating! I finally took off gift card, in essence giviing up a $25 bonus. May look into other options for filing next year!

A couple issues Overall, still the best tax software in my opinion, and I will cintinue to recommend to others. Don't like that we now have to key in the cost basis of investment transactions due to a change with IRS.

Lied to me I began doing my tax return thinking that it was free. No matter what I did, they were charging US$29.99 to file. Decided to pay, and got charged US$59.98 without knowing. The system said it was 29.99 and after I input my credit card number, it charges 59.98. No way to go back, no way to ask for a refund. Turbotax stole from me. Charges more than it tells you

Confusing during e-filing PIN/AGI verification Several problems with filing flow: 1) It gave 2 choices for the state, either e-file or put it off until later. What about printing to send by mail? 2) The PIN / AGI ID verification flow didn't make sense. It asked for status but didn't use the information in the following steps. Selecting married filing jointly yielded entering AGI for both spouses by name as if I selected married filing separately. There was no explanation of what to enter so I accepted what was automatically entered, the 2013 joint AGI for each of us. This resulted in the IRS rejecting the return, not good on the evening of 15 April! 3) It would be good if somewhere before the filing flow starts if you would explain that you can e-file the return early and request TurboTax to submit payment on 15 April. If I had known this I would have filed a week earlier. The flow is wrong for PIN/AGI entry for Married filing Jointly

Could have been a little better I would have given a 10 if I didn't have to correct the same info over and over again. I think there was a glitch in the California Worksheet section cause every time I would make corrections, making sure it was not directly on the form itself, I would have to make the same corrections all over again! Very frustrating considering I was already charged to file my state income tax so mailing them which was the other option, was not an option for me. Also it would have been better if you could only go to specific parts on the forms to edit something without going through the whole thing all over again. Too many glitches on certain sections and would take awhile to save information

Pay for state e-file, yet can't pay state tax It is a very simple program to use to maximize your returns, However, I would never pay to file the state forms through Turbo tax due to the fact that you still have to print off forms and submit them to the state and you can't pay state tax electronically. I felt it was pretty misleading to offer the electronic option and not be able to satisfy the state requirements. very misleading in paying for state e-file yet you still have to print off forms and can't pay electronically. WASTE!
hidden fees, unable to remove fees they are intentionally making it impossible to remove state filing fees... won't ever be using again State fee not removed

Online is not worth it I did the online version and was never told I could only do one return. I do a return for my elderly mother and had to pay an additional $120. This is bad business! Can only do one return

WI State form not correct I have used Turbo Tax for over 10 years and loved it. This year I had problems with the state return. I itemized the federal return and wanted to itemized the state but it chose a different form so I couldn't itemized. This resulted in only half the $ amount for deductions and us owing a lot more state tax. I tried to override it and complete the correction form but it wouldn't let me fill in all the blanks. I am going to have to file an amended return. Did not fill out the correct state form.
Price jump  Autofill not available on EZ, price jump from last year $20!

Deluxe wasn't worth it for me It would be more helpful to know what the benefit would be to use Deluxe to fully check out the return including the credit in question, compared to my return without using Deluxe.

column1: In the end, it was a waste of my money.
Perhaps you can offer a way to delete the deluxe selection if it doesn't actually benefit the tax payer.
Despite this, I found the interface for the rest of the program to be helpful, and even personable. I paid about $60 for Deluxe and it didn't save me anything

column2: Expensive and No Longer My Choice This will be the last year I use Turbo Tax, the value for the service no longer exists. I'm using my entire return just to process my taxes. The deceptive practice of forcing me to upgrade to an addition I don't need just to file investment income is just a slap in the face for loyal customers. Value for money is lacking and forcing to upgrade is unfair and deceptive

love the ease didn't like paying extra for 1 form I have used turbotax for many years and have always enjoyed the comfort of knowing my taxes were done correctly and very easy. This year our business took on a partner and we had to use turbo tax business to file. The cost was $250. We only needed the business download to file a k1. I understand this used to be included in previous versions of home and business. Seems like an awful lot of money for what we used the product for. I did not like having to pay an extra $250 just to be able to file a k1 this year

Too Many levels of service! In the past I was able to select the level of service from turbotax that I wanted. This year I was forced into the small business level. My spouse did a small project as independent worker for a foundation in 2013, and they made the final payment in 2014. It was about $10K, and not a small business.

column1: I could not figure out how to get the level of service, deluxe, that I have used the past many years. I got overcharged for higher level of service

column2: Hate that you nickle and dime me. Had to pay $10 for business return and $25 for state return after paying $55 for turbo tax. Why don't you just be truthful in your pricing!!!
too expensive  too expensive, stupid graphics and dumb encouragements
Not Impressed notta Free doesn't mean free i guess

2014 Tax Software I was able to get the job done...after I paid extra money out of my pocket. Been a Turbo Tax user greater than 10 years. I have never had to upgrade software, until this year. Typically, I would go to Costco, purchase the software, do my taxes, and be done. This year, I had to spend EXTRA money to accomplish something that should have...and all previous years have...been included with the original price. Next year, I will be searching for other software. The only reason I gave a "two-star" rating...intuit offered a rebate for "customer loyalty." Next time, don't mess with a good thing. I had to purchase extra software to do it???

What another fee! The hidden charges to file etc. was a great turnoff. I've used this product previous to this year and was satisfied. But this year will probably be my last using this product because the hidden pricing and fees.

Ruined my tax year Since they have upgraded their software, you can access your previous returns filed with them. You have to download the old version which is a complete pain. Took several weeks to find the right version to download. doesnt save previous years after last year

refunc Turbo tax was very helpful in walking you through step by step, but it is very expensive. The cost would stop me from using it again, my tax lady charges me about half this price. I just did not have the cash this year to get it done.

column1: Thanks Turbo Tax for the helpful and ease of doing it my self. expensive

column2: not as good i was not able to delete a unused k1 form

column1: i did not appreciate having to sign in every time I wanted to work on my taxes that were supposed to be loaded on my personal computer not as easy

column2: Used Turbo Tax for Years I have used TT for years and this year was a pain. I spent 30 minutes on the phone in order to get the investment forms downloaded on my computer. Whoever made the changes to the product, made a bad decision. If they do not include the forms next year, I will use a different company. That would be a shame because TT makes a great product. Not including Schedule D in the Deluxe Version

Disappointed ! Software would not allow download of state software and online " Fix It Tool" did not work. Also tried uninstalling and re-installing software to no avail ! When finished with Federal return, software would not allow State downloads

Longtime Turbo Tax User- No Longer After This Year We have successfully used Turbo Tax since 1993. Previously we raved about Turbo Tax and highly recommended it to family and friends. After this year, we will no longer use Turbo Tax and recommend everyone we know use another tax preparation software.

column1: We have always used Turbo Tax Deluxe for our personal and home-based business taxes. This year, Turbo tax changed and the product that used to cost us less than $30, is no longer available. We were forced to upgrade to the $94 program.

Instead of looking for tax deductions and breaks, this new version seemed to skip over everything and we wound up paying $1700 more this year than last year, according to Turbo Tax, and nothing has changed in our situation....if fact we made less. Horrible product and we will not longer support Turbo Tax in any version. Everything

column2: Tax Review  Too many steps, cost for the software,

UGH! Bugs in the software! I tried MULTIPLE times to get the .tax file which I could see, but was locked, to download. I got a new computer and didn't have the file from last year. It kept telling me I had to "upgrade" BUT the only upgrades available were the higher tiers. The other two were "grayed out" and not accessible even though the import of last year's return was featured on the description of each of those products. They weren't a radio button to choose at the bottom of the upgrade screen. I didn't need those since I don't have rental properties or more complicated tax issues. HOWEVER, when I did click, it STILL didn't import last year's file #saying it was still locked!# and I still got stuck paying the higher $79 fees for the upgrade I didn't need in the first place.

column1: SO VERY ANNOYING. I have been using this product for over a decade and have NEVER had these issues. DID NOT IMPORT LAST YEARS NUMBERS!!!

column2: Overcharge Rip Off When I purchase Turbo Tax it said State filing was included. Then when I proceed to file State it tells me I have to pay $39.99. Then to e file the State you charge me an addtional $24.99 + tax to e file. I am boiling mad...I have tried going back and I see no way around it. What a Rip Off!!!! I am a long time user of Quicken and Turbo Tax, I am second guessing and am looking into other financial software and tax prep. Quicken has the WORST support system EVER!!!

column1: Jo Clark Overcharged for filing State & Processes

column2: Terrible some numbers on worksheet did not roll up accurately; business income and expense did not work well in the two different work areas; product definition and pricing was a terrible disaster Return navigation caused numbers to change or disappear State of OHIO insurance premiums were not handled accurately; so
OVERCHARGE!!!! $50 bucks to file?! Seriously?! I have used Turbotax for many years but this is the very last year I will use it. Cost of use

Great Product - If you can get it to install! I bought the CD version, but it had an error when I tried to install it. So I called TurboTax. After waiting for an hour to talk to someone and spending another 1.5 hours on the phone, he told me I would have to download the produce. I started the download, but it took all night and then failed. I retried the download, and that worked, but it would not install. I called TurboTax again, and after an hour wait, a woman tried to help me. After about 2.5 hours on the phone, I got cut off, and she did not call back. I then called again and had to wait another hour to talk to a rep. After trying to help me install it again for about an hour, he suggested that I could use the online product. That was not what I wanted, but had to accept it. As a result of all this wasted time, I lost one day of work, and didn't get my return filed until 11:28PM on Apr 15! Could not install from disk or download. Had to use online.

Rip-off I had to pay you an extra $30 just to have you transfer my previous years tax info. This is a rip-off!! I ended up filing 1040A, very simple and should have been able to use the free Federal and pay you for my State for $30. I will not use Turbo Tax next year. too expensive
my return got rejected and I had to figure out a really detailed passive income mess and refile eek!

column2: its done set up the page so the next, continue, etc buttons are close to where you will use them. May be have them at both the top and bottom of the screen. It's a pain to have to scroll down to the bottom of the screen and click next, continue etc. page layout

Paid a lot more in 2014 for the same features We were unpleasantly surprised when we tried to take the itemized deduction using TurboTax Basic 2014. It required $40 to upgrade in order to itemize my deductions. I found that deceitful for TurboTax to use the same name but took out major features. If TurboTax were to try to provide flexibility for individuals who do not use the Schedule A form, a different package name should have been given to that new package. It is a shame for TurboTax to use such an underhanded method to earn a few more bucks. I suggest you to check your online feedback. It is not favorable at all! column1: This is so Un-Intuit to screw up this bad - and worse, they raised their prices this year.

column2: Turbotax is ridiculous and a classic bait and switch tactic. States I can file federal free and just be charged for state filings. Then I was required to upgrade to deluxe then pay the state fee on top of it making it cost nearly $100 from the anticipated $20. I will never use turbotax again. If I'm going to spend $100 to have my taxes done I will have a local accountant do it for me. Also, taking your customer support number off of your website on the last day to file is very unprofessional. Filling out a form to be called back is not a guarantee anyone will call and is poor customer service.

MISSED STATE SALES TAX DEDUCTION As noted on CONS above, this thing doesn't even prompt you to pick up deductions you're entitled to deduct! The biggest refund advertisement just sounds fraudulent, this program is difficult if you know what you're doing because it won't just let you do it... and if you don't know what you're doing... it's an outright disaster waiting to happen... missed my state sales tax deduction and i live in a no income tax state. biggest refund guaranteed? that's a lie....

No more Turbo Tax for me I have used Turbo Tax for years, and I realize I am filing on April15th, but I will never ever, ever, ever us TT again due to the excessive fees charged, especially for state filing. Next year I will be using TaxAct and I wish I had taken the advice of Forbes and used TaxAct this year. Hope you enjoy the money made off of me; it will be absolutely the last buck I ever spend on Turbo Tax. Excessive fees

took my money I didnt want turbo tax plus but it automatically added then I paid extra. The pay page does not even have a confirmation page. I'm quiet upset about that. They really took my money. conned me
taxes for dummies  little difficult with foreclosure info

shady business I think it is pretty low to try and sneak the turbo-tax deluxe or whatever the package is onto the end of the deal after filing the state and federal return. You should not try to trick people into paying double what you say, its under-handed and pathetic. I'll not be doing business with this company again.
Bring back the original version! Previous years' version was far better. It seemed smoother to load and easier to enter information.

column1: This year, it took 2 hours to download the program. Then I got gouged with the State filing fees #x 3#. We were doing the taxes for our son, who earned money in 2 states and thought that this would be a good way to get him started via Turbo Tax.

We purchased a copy of the Ohio state tax form for $42 and then got socked a $24.99 filing fee on top of this. After all that, he got a $3 refund. To add insult to injury, when filling out our Federal taxes, we discovered - too late - that he didn't even need to file if he made less than $6,000. Why didn't Turbo Tax mention that instead of gouging us $66 and putting us through lots of aggravation?
Lesson learned. Steer clear of Turbo Tax and find another program that will keep my best interest in mind. Thanks for nothing. Extra hidden fees - ouch!!!!

column2: WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT I HAVE THE NOTICE THAT SAYS SCH E TAX FILERS WHO HAVE USED DELUXE VERSIONS IN THE PAST WILL BE GIVEN A DISCOUNT SINCE WE ARE FORCED TO BUY THE PREMIUM VERSION TO CONTINUE TO HAVE SCH E DETAIL. WHEN I PURCHASED THE PREMIUM VERSION, I DID NOT SEE ANY WHERE TO INPUT A DISCOUNT CODE. TRYING TO GET HELP WAS A MAJOR BUMMER. IS IT TOO MUCH TO ASK FOR A LIVE PERSON? HOWEVER, I COULD NOT LOCATE A CUSTOMER SERVICE PHONE NUMBER. I SENT AN EMAIL BUT IT HAS BEEN WEEKS AND NO ONE HAS RESPONDED. I USED TO RECOMMEND TURBO TAX TO OTHERS, BUT I THINK I WILL HAVE TO CHANGE THAT PRACTICE. HAD TO PAY MUCH HIGHER PRICE FOR SCH E ACCESS
says its free but its not says that its free but its not. this is misleading. if there is a fee this should be made know before even starting. says that its free but its not

Had to pay 2x The process was a bit difficult and I had to go back a fix because it was unclear where to put amount earned so I wound up paying twice for the same filing ... this is a very poor system of doing business. You say FREE and then you charge people more than double.

column1: Would NOT recommend this service. wasn't easy to do and had to pay 2x

column2: Too expensive Way too expensive for a mass produced and used program...Cost to roll out and administer doesn't command this price. Pure greed. Cost

This is definitely software TurboTax is software. Like all other software, it exists to perform some function that people would otherwise have to find some way to do, or be unable to do. That's about the nicest thing anyone can say about it.

column1: I want to know why I paid $40 to file my state taxes if I have to then separately navigate my state's revenue website, designed for IE 6.0(literally, it says that), to find the e-pay option. Expected state e-filing to include e-paying, but it didn't

column2: jabbed Got jabbed on price. If you think your product is worth it, disclose fees upfront. price
I didn't get my 19% discount when I checked out didnt get my 19% discount
I was extremely disappointed to discover at the END of filing my taxes, that I would need to pay an extra $24.99 (+tax) to e-file a state return.

column1: I already paid $59.99 (+tax) for the software. Including the ability to e-file at least 1 state return would be a significant improvement on your software.

The least you could have done was make that information easily accessible early on in the filing process. You didn't and I felt like I was about to get sucker punched for over $25. Not cool from a customer service standpoint. I will definitely share that negative aspect with all of my friends. Have to pay to e-file state tax returns.

column2: Disappointed I have filed taxes myself for years, using Turbo Tax every year. Instead of purchasing the disc in a retail store this year, I filed directly through the web service. I am extremely disappointed in the difference in price and the fact it cost me over $30 more going directly through the web. I'm very disappointed! price of service
So much money for your service  I should've done this on my own. I only had a couple of things to add, but need the $79 service pack. Crazy.

new fees huh I will never use Turbo Tax again, although I have used it for years. Now there is a fee for e-file or auto deposit and there wasn't before. The price will keep going up and I will not pay you any longer. You charge a fee to e-file when e-file is from thru the IRS. Why to sneak that in.

Shady TurboTax definitely made filing easier but it was very misleading how they trap you unto purchasing their Deluxe version. I would've given them 5 stars if they weren't so shady.... Misleading to get more money out of you.
refund I would just have rather had a program on my conp then web browser baced web baced was glitchy restarted the browser many times

Refund Really appreciated the step-by-step help, but we thought we were only paying the $29.99 price and somehow were charged for the next level package and therefore had to pay $60! Just from that, would not recommend to a friend. Charged too much

Get what you pay for My father and I competed this year. We gathered our documents in advance. Then via phone gave the start flag. What took him several hours a night for 5 nights took me about an hour or so. And we both filed the same tax documents.

column1: Only problem I have was the price for the advanced versions. Seemed very expensive for a program that is all automated and no human interaction involved. I imagine as years go by, Turbotax will be forced to be more competitive in their pricing scheme. cost for advanced versions

column2: Bait and switch I understood I would have to pay the $39 for state. Whatever. That's fine. I though I was using the free federal. Nope. Actually it was $60. And to get the free one. I have to delete all my stuff and start over? F that. I had the simplest form possible yet somehow you upgraded me on your own, and charged me $60 extra. F you guys. I'll never use turbo tax again. Bait. And. Switch. Good luck using the "free" federal forms. You scammed me out of $60

GOT SCREWED BY TURBOTAX! I've been using TurboTax for many years now, and I'm highly disappointed in their deceptive trade practices - the price to file my return went up between the time I started my return and the time I filed it. This is the first year I've noticed it, probably because in the past I was almost always due a refund so I filed early. This year I owe the IRS, so I waited until the last day to file, and BAM! Adding insult to injury, now I had to pay about $15-$20 more to TurboTax. That's bull**it!! I'm putting you fools on notice - no more recommendations to friends and family!! Price to e-file went up without notice
I will not use turbo tax again simply because of the rip off for the state return Exorbitant cost to prepare and file a lousy state return
Didn't care for the fees that were added as the program progressed. Cost almost as much as the CPA we had last year and took hours to complete. Had to hunt for state sales tax deductions.

Pricey The pricing was confusing. You are exactly sure what price you are going to pay until the in. Too many gimmicks to try to get you to buy in to something else that you may not need or want. I think this will be my last year with turbotax. The pricing was confusing

Disappointed After performing an analysis of my state return, when I click "Let's finish it," I am bounced back to the beginning of the State Taxes tab and stuck in a perpetual loop. The only way to proceed is to click the 'skip it' option, so I was never stepped through the analysis of my state taxes. Fingers crossed that it got it right the first time.

column1: Separately, but remotely possibly related, it would not allow me to pay off the feds and make payment arrangements for the state. It told me I had selected to make a direct deposit payment to the state, which I don't recall being prompted to do, and never had the option to change it. I had to trick the system by checking that I would mail in a payment and then make payment arrangements with the state directly.
All excruciatingly frustrating, and why I've been (over) paying a CPA to do this up until now. I had hoped Intuit would have gotten this dialed in by now. disappointingly flawed

column2: No title Turbo Tax is okay, if you can't get out. If you can, better to file with free tax service for low income. Turbo Tax is free for federal tax, but costs for state tax. It's a bit difficult to navigate if you're not used to tax form numbers and what they're for. Sometimes you can click on something for information and you're lost - especially at the end. I hadn't finished, but I couldn't tell what was going on. It wasn't moving, didn't give me any options to move forward or back or off the information page. I had to get out and go back and sign in again. Luckily, it picked it back up where I left off. The state part costs money, so if you're getting refunds, you'd probably be better off going to a free tax filing servic
forced upgrade to premier This review relates to the online version of turbotax software.

column1: As a customer of TurboTax for several years now i have been extremely unpleasantly surprised to discovered that i had been "scammed" into upgrading to a premier service i did not need in the end (i had been using deluxe over the previous years with great satisfaction)
I thought i needed special extra needs for the investment section however it turns out i did not need to do anything special this year that was not available in the deluxe edition.
So after the upgrade i looked for a way to downgrade back from Premier to Deluxe which is the level of service appropriate to my needs.
I was trusting that turbotax was a serious company and would make this seamless but i was wrong.

While looking at the forum and other resources i realized that like many people before me, turbotax this year made it easy within seconds to transfer all your data from deluxe to premier. However, although they are *legally* obliged to give you a way to downgrade, they made the *effective* usability cost for users very high by forcing them to delete ALL their data and start over from scratch.
This is of course completely ridiculous and hypocritical because there's no more technical difficulty in switching from deluxe to premier (seconds) than from premier to deluxe.
For instance in my case, i was filing a few hours from the deadline so it was unimaginable for me to start over so soon from the midnight deadline.

So all in all, i guess some marketing representatives thought they were clever to let the online software earn an extra $30 from their gullible customers. But it is short sighted because it destroys the trust relationship with customers and now I have a very bad image of TurboTax practices as a company (even if their base service is of good quality)

That is too bad because they will probably loose my business for next year as well as the one from many other infuriated customers falsely pretend that downgrading back to deluxe requires clearing all data to start over

column2: Late Refund Just wait to be updated and get the right refund. Way to low... We cant file on time due to Turbo Tax miscalculation
Cost continues to go up every year Cost has risen to the point where I can find a comparable experience for much less. Probably going to go elsewhere next year. Fee for deducting fee from return

Terrible. Thanks for repeatedly trying to sell me on Amazon, gift cards, and all kinds of junk. Also, for tricking me into the 99$ service and making it impossible to go back without undoing all my work. Thanks for being another trashy business that clearly only cares about profits. I am never filing with you again. I'd rather pay exorbitant fees elsewhere.. but not be tricked into it. What a sham of a business. I heard you guys were getting sneakier and worse every year, and it's true.

Confusing There were a few deductions I needed to make and couldn't figure out how. My car expenses are way higher than the mileage I use for work, and I feel I could have received more. Also, the Heath Insurance section just asked if I was insured throughout the year. I got no deduction for my high monthly payments. My health insurance i not an employment benefit, I have to pay the full amount out of pocket. I should have received a deduction for that. Eforms has changed and it was difficult to navigete

Software has been getting worse every year. In an attempt to become idiot proof, Intuit has taken even the simplest of things out of the user's control. I moved from an apartment to a house and the software would not allow me to update my address; each time it reviewed my state return, it threw back an error because there was no apartment number. Seeing as the software would not allow me to transmit my returns without that information, I had to put in a placeholder. As far as I can tell there is absolutely no way to edit that manually, and updating your address in your turbotax account info will not change it either. A true rip-off at $60 for state and federal. I will never use this software again. Can't even change your address manually.
Charge Card Fail for e-file First time I've ever had this issue and it just is not working. Tech support was no help. Will not take payments for e-file and have been trying for days

Stupid no income in box 1 not happy because I can't efile my taxes at this hour, because I live in the middle of no where in Montana and to get somewhere by midnight that has a location where taxes are still being post marked is impossible. My W2 from a disability inusrance company did not have anything in box 1, so what! It had income on it on box something or other cafe. Really? I paid you well over $100.00 to file, and you can't file it...You can fix that. You did it to me last year. Next year I will not have the stupid W2, so money grubbing people that was NOT fair to be charged for E file and then not get it.

BEWARE-Rip Off State File Offer Purchased ON Apr 15th, paid EXTRA for one free state file package... and upon filing, big surprise! The free state file expired on Feb 16th. Yeah that's right before I paid for the deluxe version to get that free state file! Think they might have mentioned that at time of purchase.

column1: Next year, use a different tax software. I will be. Pay extra for deluxe with one free state file and u still get $35 charge

column2: Pretty Stupid WTF This is pretty jank

column1: DONT DO IT
I DID
WISH i DINDT made me pay $$$ and was stupid! It wouldn't let me fix stuff or give to cancer and environmental research!

column2: Terrible My experience with TurboTax was awful, I would have saved time by filing paper version of my taxes. First I tried to use the online version but could not enter the appropriate information for my tax situation so I was forced to start again using the desktop version. From there the experience was just headache after headache and the online advice from intuit was inconsistent and generally unhelpful. the online version does not allow for customization at a reasonable (necessary) level, buggy, annoying WASTE OF TIME!

Never using this product again i was "upgraded" from the federal free edition to the federal free plus edition without my consent! i got all the way through my taxes for the SECOND time because i was upgraded to the deluxe addition the first time, and it bought me out to a grand total of 60 bucks! what the heck turbo tax?! ill make sure to tell everyone i know to NEVER use this product again, unless they want to be swindled out of money. i was so fed up using this program that i just paid the 60 bucks to avoid doing my taxes for a third time.

Downgraded I have used TurboTax since 1986. It has always been my tax program of choice. Now that they have changed the schedules that you can use with each program, I am thinking about changing the program I use for 2015. The pricing of Deluxe for $50, Premier for $90 and Home and Business for $100. In order to do my tax return for 2014 I bought Deluxe but ended up using Home and Business so I could use a Schedule C to report about $350 gross income. In years before I could do this using Deluxe. The upgrade cost of $50 is more than the tax I will owe on the net income I am earning and reporting on my Schedule C which to be an honest taxpayer Turbo Tax is going to be charging me. If it is going to cost me an extra $50 to report my taxes in 2015. I will be changing to another program. I also do not have a lot of Schedule D items but need to report them also. I think TurboTax has made a big mistake in splitting up their programs like they did in 2014. Change in pricing

2013 Yes, 2014 Not So Much When I filled my tax return for 2013 I was very satisfied with Turbo Tax, this year not so much. The product itself was good and pretty easy to use. My issues lay more with customer care(service). Some life situations were pretty complicated for my family last year seeing as we are a military family. There were a few things that I needed help with. I submitted my question, got my "Incident ID #", called the number they gave and waited over an hour for someone to call me back. I ended up doing this a few times attempting to get help just once. Each time I got a call back it was from Product Support who couldn't help. A couple people transferred me to Tax Support for the help I needed. I ended up being on hold for hours at a time when transferred. Another time I was given a direct number for Tax Support. When I called I was asked for my "Incident ID #" or to press zero by an automated system. With both I got the same response... My questions weren't important because they didn't pertain to the deadline and that if I wanted them answered I could call back after the sixteenth of April, then it hung up on me. I still have yet to talk to someone in Tax Support. I finally gave up and went elsewhere for help that way our taxes could be filed before the deadline. I understand that they get swamped this time of the year, HOWEVER, it doesn't make it right for them to put a number for tax help that is really for product help or to leave people on hold just because they want to go home when they have people who have been on hold for hours before they are supposed to close and when it was an estimated wait of only sixty minutes that turned into a minimum of two hours -not including the hour or so waiting for someone to call in the first place. In all I would recommend Turbo Tax for the product itself, NOT for the help. When help was needed it was nowhere to be seen like it was claimed to be.
Gouged Extra charges for a Schedule E was a new twist for 2014. It felt like we were getting gouged for something that didn't cost extra before. Had to pay extra $30 upgrade for a Schedule E form
Turbo "Nickel and Dime me to Death" Tax Necessary evil is Turbo Tax. A lot of the requests are ambiguous and require analysis of the questions and research. Yuck!

System prevented me from using Credit Card The system prevented me from using a credit card to pay the hidden state filing fee. It kept telling me there was internet connectivity problems, when I knew there were not. very suspicious.
didn't help much with sale of second home details disappointed didnt handle deleading tax credit without manual form

Federal Free I love Turbo tax, it's simply and user friendly. That being said I think it would be beneficial to make the pricing a little more clear in the beginning. I ended up paying for the federal version when I really needed to be federal free. It all evens out in the end so I didn't stress about it but, in order to get the Federal free version as originally anticipated I would have had to start completely over. Maybe making it to where to you don't have to start from scratch would make it a better experience for the non-tax professional, like myself. Not clean with the pricing
Too Many Extra Fees for More Than Three Stars Did the job, but last minute fees for state prep and filing were more than what I paid for the product to begin with. Extra fees

Disgusted with turbotax Terrible experience. Tried to e-file on 4/15/2015. Efile kicks an error message when trying to access "store" to pay for State e-file. Tried repetitively, tried online support, tried phone support, could not get any help. Post offices closed now and state will be late. Thanks Turbotax. Have used for several years. Last few years been bad. Will NEVER use Turbotax again and you will get plenty of "free advertising" from me regarding my experience. Major functionality issues

Highway Robbery This application used to be priced reasonably...but NOT anymore. AND they actually make a cruddy experience of paying Uncle SAM even worse by charging extra ($6) to pay by credit card... COSTS TOO MUCH

not as user friendly as the past after downloading last years information about my employer, it wanted to skip to the end and have me file the information without even asking about any deductions or changes in my household. Just didn't find it as user friendly. i have used this product for many years, this year I didnt find it as user friendly

Takes advantage of people who file last minute It was easy to use, but I really don't appreciate it being double the price. I remember getting a spammy email saying "last day to get normal pricing", so it seems like they are taking advantage of people who wait till the last week to do their taxes (thats MOST people I know). Too expensive...more then twice as much as last year...

Disappointed I have faithfully used turbo tax since 2006 and i have recommended the service to many of my friends, but now I am going to seek out an alternative software. I am very disappointed that turbo tax continues to increase its prices and adds ambiguous fees. The cost of using turbo tax has increased significantly

What happened I loved Turbo tax from Day 1...a few years ago. today I had the worst experience. Hard to get around, make changes, explanations are hard to understand, maybe I am just getting too old! What happened to two the program.

Convenient, but Pricey Convenient, but pricey. I have no mortgage, children to claim, etc. I could have filed the 1040 EZ, but because I sold about 10 shares of stock I had to pay $80 on top of the $40 for the state return. I ended up losing money. Expemsive
Disappointed I haven't used TurboTax for a few years and I ordered it online this year because I had taken a partial withdrawal from my IRA.

column1: I was very confused on some of the explanations, and final had to consult a professional in order to reenter some figures in the right place.
