It was not only hard for me to understand some parts, but the tax professional I was using was not happy not being able to view the forms, as they progressed through TurboTax questions.
Maybe buying the actual program would have been a different experience, but it's too late now. Unable to view forms, not good explanations

column2: EXPENSIVE AND MISLEADING  very expensive for filing basic taxes

Repeated Debt to IRS with Turbo-Tax Everything was fine until you get to the part of community property income in Texas. Questions are a little confusing and it still does not make sense to me. I am filing as married but separated this year. Every year I try to max out the recommended tax withholding's to avoid any high tax bills but every year I end up owing close to $1000. I have never received a return with turbo tax. Not easy to understand some parts

Stop being so Positive! I owed this year, first time I have ever owed money. It wasn't much compared to some people, only $410. But it is still depressing and certainly something I don't want to do. I work VERY hard for my money all year long. The website kept everything peppy and happy AS IF I WAS going to get a refund. Come on, tell it like it really is. Cheer me up for having to owe money, make me feel better about the situation. Don't make it sound like using TurboTax is the greatest thing in the world when I have to PAY THE GOVERNMENT my money. It was such a slap in the fave every time I would hit "Continue" and the website would say "You're almost to your refund!". To darn happy!

#nickelanddimeme Errors that just take you in circles! I've been using Turbo Tax for along time, but was very disappointed this year, no free filing, charging for everything! Can only file 5 returns? Needs to be disclosed before you buy and maybe a warning when you get to number 4.! Charging for everything. No free filing, have to pay for state

free? Thought I was doing free and wasn't because of this deceiving site. I owed about the same amount on my taxes as the fee they charged. I though I was paying the amount due....nope just paid turbotax. Enjoy the free money you worthless **** never using you again and I hope your family burns a slowly while you watch said it would be free....

TurboTax The app is easy to use but I feel like I got side-swiped when I went to 'send' my forms. First, I had to change to the more expensive home & business version because my wife was contracted #not employed# by a mother's-day-out. Fine, pay the extra for 1 form #Schedule C#. I go to check-out and say pay the TurboTax Home & Business version from my refund and I'm charged an additional $35 for the benefit of paying from my refund. $85 for TT and an additional $35 fee to use my refund. Tends to repeat things too much. A fee for paying for TurboTax with my refund, really?

Rip Off They only let you take their money out of your federal return if you pay an extra $30, but when the window comes up it says something like "Your tax fees are waived bla bla if you upgrade to Turboplus and pay with your federal return"

column1: So when you actually do update, they charge you the $30 for your state, and the extra $30 bucks on top of that, but by the time you realize that you are so far into the process you just want to be done with it.
Honestly if I had my credit card on me I would have saved myself the $30 dollar convenience fee, but unfortunately my wife has my wallet in her purse, and today is the last day for tax day.
Go figure.

Bottom line is I really feel like there are no additional services provided for the $30 other then the fact that I can get online and look over my taxes during the year. (Why i would do this is a mystery to me).
I can pay $30 for a service, but at the point that I'm already DONE with all the hard stuff, paying $30 bucks to not have to enter my credit card number is complete rubbish.
AND THEN, to top it all off they make you take your refund onto a prepaid debit card if you choose this option! REALLY?! So for that extra $30 bucks you can't even give me a check?

I feel like its a rip off to be honest. Selling an upgrade on a service after the service is already pretty much completed is petty, gimmicky, phony, misleading etc. Pick your adjective. REALLY hardball you into buying their stuff.

column2: Confused and no help Options for inputting data for RRB-1099-R are not clear and leaves you searching and reviewing more than should be necessary. There are 3 options to choose for receiving the benefit (and you must pick one) on the screen for the RRB-1099-R , none of them apply to my situation. I received this as a divorce settlement - I am not retired or disabled nor am I an RR employee. Take a chance and pick something and hope it doesn't make a difference. Locating where to document the data from your tax form should be more user friendly. Can't seem to get a valid answer

Pricey! I sold a couple of stocks....I don't own a home, have children to claim etc....I could have used the 1040EZ, but because I sold about 10 shares of stock I had to pay $80 for fedreral on top of the $40 for the state return. Next year. I think I'll do my own returns! Expemsive

Misleading on completing multiple returns Turbo Tax online and the CD/Download versions are different in terms of paying once and completing multiple returns. After paying once to file my return and believing I could do up to 5 returns, I was forced to pay again to file my sons return.Very disappointed to go all the way through the effort to enter data only to find out at the end that I have to pay again because it was the online version rather than the CD/Downloaded version. Great tax software, and very upset to pay twice for something that is advertised to be used for up to 5 returns.
Easy file this year I appreciate you need to recoup your money and make a profit on the state returns, but it it not worth my money. I have printed and submitted a paper form.

column1: Also this year my discount was not applied What happened?? Price to file state taxes, Did not receive my discount

column2: Cost too much!!! I don't like that I was charged $60.00 for filing taxes and then another $40.00 charge was tacked on for some reason. You charged me $100.00 to do my own taxes and I probably won't be back next year. Cost too much!!!!
I hopefully got all my refund.  unsure of refund amount being as high as it could be.

Turbo Tax Sucks! Turbo Tax needs to get there act together. I bought the home and small business edition, which is SUPPOSED to come with the state edition yet STILL ended up having to pay $39.99 to get the state and it STILL didn't work! I spent two days and about 5 hours on the phone with customer service just to fix the state return issue. Not cool. Problems with turbo tax each year i've used it...only twice

RIPPED ME OFF AND UNABLE TO GET HELP LAST YEAR TURBO TAX CHARGED MY CREDIT CARD FOR THE STATE FILING FEE THEN SENT ME A MESSAGE SAYING I WAS INELIGIBLE TO FILE MY STATE RETURN ELECTRONICALLY. IT TOOK ME TWO HOURS TO FIND A TELEPHONE NUMBER TO CALL. THEN I WAS ON HOLD FOR 2 1/2 HOURS BEFORE THE BATTERY IN MY PHONE DIED. I KEPT GETTING EMAIL REMINDERS TO E-FILE FROM TURBO TAX, BUT REPLYS WENT UNANSWERED. ALTHOUGH I HAVE THE BALANCE OF THE UNUSED FEE PAID LAST YEAR, THEY CHARGED ME AGIAN THIS YEAR. THAT SEEMS DISHONEST TO ME. I WOULD THINK A COMPANY THAT SO MANY PEOPLE RELY ON WOULD MAKE THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICE EASIER TO REACH AND WOULD CREDIT PEOPLE BACK ANY UNEARNED FEES THAT THEY CHARGED. SURELY TURBOTAX MUST MAKE SUFFICIENT MONEY WITHOUT RIPPING OFF ITS CUSTOMERS. CHARGED ME FOR STATE E-FILE THEN SAID NOT ELIGIBLE

Disappointed Really disappointed ... I only owed 12.00 ... my deductions doing nothing for me ... your site should run it every different way for best and easiest and cheapest outcome for the customer. It should import all info if you want to try the free or downgrade to any lesser program. I waited till tonight as I only owed 12.00 ... no reason to hurry as I had to pay 30..00 to pay 12.00 ... or so I thought then/now I am paying 54.99 and 12.00 and 3.95 to pay it electronically with my CARD. Sorry so irritated. Will not use this site again. sl not importing info for free file/ and higher charge at end I only owed 12.00
Our information was used to e-file a fraudulent return through the Turbo tax server.

not really free why would you advertise at being free then charge me $30? You tell me I didn't get enough to use the return to pay but still charge me. I'm clearly picking the free option because I can't anything else but I get charged anyway. False advertising, I would rather have someone else do it where I know I'm going to pay than think I don't have to pay & end up being told that I actually do have to pay. even the free option is not free

Not Good probably my last year with you all.....sold a MLP and your software could not handle it.....took me weeks to figure out......no use spending money on something that does not work!! Could not handle sale of MLP......

Hidden Fees Bought the turbo deluxe said it was 19.99 to file state, but when filing our second state we had to pay 39.99 to review our second state, Then they charged us 24.99 per state. And then charged us 49.98 to process it. It was 49.99 to buy turbo tax, 39.99 just to see our second state then 24.99 for each state plus 34.99 to process our taxes for a grand total of 174.99 and I could have paid my tax preparer for less than 150. So iI am a dissatisfied customer due to all the extra hidden fees. I will never use turbo tax again. The lies they said about the cost to file

Getting less and less from turbotax I have used turbotax about 10 years and I am thinking about find alternative next year. The reason is that Turbotax is getting cheaper and cheaper. And sneakier too. No contact phone. Once you completed printout, you can not make change again. They only have the short version this year instead of the long and short version in previous years. bad customer service
good refund  Could have better clarified the tax summary for federal and state that shows how it matches wit the W2 with other info

Frustrated and Annoyed I paid 39.99 for my federal tax the I paid 39.99 for the Colorado State tax, on line and then I went to file I had to pay another 24.99. I tried to go on line to ask my question and you wanted another 36.00 to answer my questions. I will NEVER recommend turbo tax or ever use it again. You are a rip off.

Grade, B Paid for a premium product, partly in the belief that the state return was included. It was not. And then the disparity between being told you have all but no chance of an audit and then on the next screen there's a solicitation to be protected. It's misleading, deliberately no doubt. Plus the way Intuit now works with Amazon: how about just keeping to your core competency? And there are still problems with the program, particularly when it comes to fixing errors. Tip: always go to Forms when all else fails. And finally the community was no help.... That's the real problem; I've used this program for a few years and that's always been the case.... Community help is no help; program still has bugs and it can be difficult to track down an error and fix it

Not returning customer I have been using Turbotax for almost ten years, but with all of the pushing to upgrade, sneaking in extra fees, and overall disappointment in the system, I will not be a returning customer next tax season. I will be shopping around for a new system. I would have given the experience zero stars if I could. Everything
Even though I said I didn't want to pay the extra $29.99 they charged me anyway and there was no way to fix it. A ripoff!
Absolutely Horrible!!!! I have been using Turbo Tax and Quickbooks for over 20 years and always used the Deluxe version for my personal and small business.

column1: This year to my surprise when trying to file I found that I had to upgrade to Home and Business version to enter my schedule C. After trying the phone number given in the program to upgrade I was told to call after 4/16 which was not an option. I was then hung up on several times. I tried to find answers on the Turbo Tax website and couldn't connect with password and had to have a code no.emailed to me then had to go out of website to get email then when went back to website again couldn't enter with out code. Had to have my son get his computer to have 2 computers to enter website and found no answers or help there either.

Finally called the Intuit number and had to go through bunch of recordings to finally be told I would receive a call back. I waited hours for the call back and was given a conformation that didn't work. I went through this several times before I finally got a person the next day to stay on the line to get my upgrade.

After all this I had to buy an additional state and again wasn't able to online and had to call Intuit again same senario and wait hours for a call back to buy the additional state and get a conformation.

Then when I tried to efile it wouldn't let me online again and I was forced to pay an extra $39. to have the charges deducted from my refund because it was too late to call and wait hours again for another conformation.
This is ABSOLUTELY the worst experience I have had in over 20 years as a loyal Turbo Tax customer and I will probably change to another tax software company next year. Everything

column2: Frown Made it so difficult to not upgrade that I ended up paying the additional $29.99 because I couldn't figure out how not to Extra Fees

Paid too much I was suppose to get the one time rate of $29.99 for DELUXE- which was great! However, I started over, switched to the FREE edition then ended up switching back to DELUXE. Be careful because ONE TIME rate...really means ONE TIME. That doosy cost me $25. Oh well...you live and you learn. paid too much

suck you advertise 5 federals and one state for free. I go to file state and you get me for $25, after I paid $60 up front. Bull S**t. I'll find an alternative next year, after more than a decade of paying for and enjoying your service-no more surprise charges
Regret Using Turbo The pricing posted was false. There was no one to contact to fix the situation. Next year I will be using H&R block or a different online service.

column1: Customer service should be key and it doesnt seem to be with this site. The free advertisements are a joke. Total waste of time and money, Ill be sure to recommend everybody elsewhere. I didnt like the process. No one could be reached and the pricing was inaccurate

column2: Too many advertisements for other products This system was nice and fast. However, it constantly had buttons to upgrade to different platforms that cost money to file state returns, etc. This was so distracting and annoying -- I ended up spending an hour filling out information on my state returns when I got to the end and had to cancel them because the only option to submit them was to pay a fee. Very misleading / a waste of time. too many "buy this" or "upgrade" buttons

Scam First you select to do a free federal return, and at some point, the software is supposed to inform you if you will be switched to the pay option due to (I'm guessing here because I still don't know...the software is THAT bad) itemizing. However, that never happened. Then, when it was time to complete the return, suddenly, you have to pay. No notification before hand. You try to switch to the free return, but it you can't. The only options you have are to pay or start over. And the tool tip has text on top of text, so, of course, you can't read it. I think that's done on purpose to frustrate customers who have already spent time filling out the forms. Who wants to start over after that? Probably no one. Turbo Tax knows this, and they know that you'll just go ahead and pay. It's a scam, and it's pathetic. The acquisition of the all-mighty dollar is goal here even if you have to misdirect and fool customers into obtaining it. Sadly, Turbo Tax has sunk to the bottom of the barrel with tactics such as this, and we will no longer be using their services...ever. You should be ashamed of yourselves. Does these reviews go to a public forum? If so, I seriously doubt this one will make it there. The company doesn't want people to know how it scams customers, but at least the person who does read this and decides to prevent it from being public knowledge will know what a pathetic company he/she works for. Making money is the focus, period

Horrible! I am eligible to file for free yet could not with Turbo Tax despite spending many hours completing. Went to site for free filing, said turbo tax was an option, went to turbo tax and had to pay full price. Will not be using Turbo Tax next year. Not user friendly at all! free tax filing, NOT

Got charged for Free State e File I got a message that I had to pay to efile the State Return but there was supposed to be one free State efilling with my purchase of TurboTax. I trid to contact TurboTax support but no luck so far.... maybe I can resolve tomorrow. I went ahead and paid now so I coudl file and will ask for a refun or not to be charged tomorrow, April 16th.
Not as easy as prior years.

column1: With problems that the software had this year, felt I needed to check the calculations

Suggest offering a brief of the major statutory changes up front that people could watch or work through before beginning taxes. Then surprises of all the additional taxes, treatments, etc will be lessened. Did not make me aware of all the tax changes up front/ had to laboriously go through worksheets to ensure it was correct

column2: Internet vs cd I really like the navigation of the software, I found the online navigation to be messy.

column1: But overall I like it...

column2: So many opportunities to be upsold and hassled I get it, writing software is expensive. But the never-ending prompts to hand off more money to Intuit as I try to do an already unpleasant task is just insulting. I paid for your software. Now you want me to buy more of your software. Or upgrade the software version I already deliberately selected.

column1: All of that is tiresome enough, but to then get to the attempt to get me to get my refund in Amazon credits... when I am not getting a refund? Come on. You have a little box in the upper left with my totals. Asking me the question is insulting. Not already knowing that the question is stupid is sloppy. Endless upsell junk, sloppy coding, cruddy privacy policies

column2: Watch out for the 2.9% service charge for credit 2.9 per cent to use a credit card to pay taxes...in small print at bottom of the payment options form..

column1: Careful.. First Uncle Sam cleans your wallet and then Turbo Tax Turbo Charges You what is left of your sanity.
Prepop fields nice if used consecutive years
Need more clarification on some issues.
High charge for simple tax return--60 bucks. Really?
If only I could remember to file in advance of deadline I would look elsewhere
So the best positive is that the program is ready to run at quarter til deadline. Something to be said for that... Expensive Cost to use credit card

column2: the worst customer service ive been with turbotax since 2009 and never had this experience before. using turbotax this year was horrible . the last agent that i talked to was so rude and didn't want to help at all. she kept repeating herself just like machine over and over again . at last i just hung up on her. unexperienced customer service

Nothing new here, move along... Turbo Tax has been around awhile. There are a number of opportunities where TT could provide suggestions or answers based on responses that I've provided and prior year patterns but instead we had to decide on our own. Also, why tell me about movie making credits and other esoteric employer credits when none of these apply to me? The UX doesn't flow as intuitively as it could and feels clunkier than in years past.

column1: I found a bug - VA state version. The difference in the mileage credit rate (VA=18c/mi, Federal=14c/mi) amounted to a $7 VA credit but when continuing to the next screen where I could choose to allocate between myself and my spouse, TT auto populated $6 to me and 0 to my spouse. The expected result was a $7 pre-populated field. The observed $6+0 does not equal $7. Isn't very smart and makes me do too much of the work where TT should already have the answers

column2: So many hidden tricks this year!! Not free after all. Very disappointed. So many sales pitches Amazon, Sunrise Bank, Auditing - fees everywhere!! like pop ups without your permission.

column1: Still don't know why I had to pay $29.99 twice! But since it is April 15 and running out of time....just went with the program. The phone number provided tells you they can't take your call and disconnects!!!! What a joke.

other than that it is still very easy to use and the help/search section is very easy to understand and implement. Still will look for a really free site next year, even though I will have to start over. I hate hidden fees!! Or fees that you feel you HAVE to pay!! Expecting a free File - charged twice for $29.99!

column2: Took money out of my refund terrible site I wouldn't recommend anyone because it took 59 dollars out of my refund and I had no other option to opt out. so either way I had to pay. it took money out and i thought it was free

Not your best year Not your best year - silly to get to last pages and then have to go back and fix things on a form at the beginning - I found that exhausting. Couldn't understand how to change bank acct info, found some pages confusing

Decent, but missed a significant calculation All is great, with the exception of how my personal exemption was calculated. By using the IRS.gov form, my personal exemption deduction was $4,000 higher than what TurboTax calculated. Unfortunately, I could not figure out how to manually change the entry in my return...now Uncle Sam is walking with $4K of my money that he should not have.

column1: Net/net, I might do taxes on both TurboTax and AtHome next year as I get both for free. Missed a significant deduction

column2: Once I heard your company lobbies to keep the tax code complicated, my blood started to boil. Shame on you for sabotaging the citizens of this country.
Taxes are done but...... Easy walkthroughs , but price is getting up there with personal tax consultants. Price is getting out of hand.
Once ready to e-file process should not require answering so many questions

angry was told that the sate tax payment was 14.99 and was unexpectedly charged 44 dollars out of my account instantly. i go to college and the fact that they charged me 44 dollars is unbelievable. Thanks turbo tax really f-ed me over. state payment

Upset about the 29.99 misrespresentation I was very upset that I was misled to thinking it would only be 29.99 to send my state returns. I tried for 40mins to get out of the screen so that I wasn't paying for the turbo program too. it would now allow me to no matter what way I tried. I feel that is misrepresentation and misleading to customers. I finally paid with my credit card and only had to pay the 29.99 program. this is unfair to people who are trying to get the money out of their check. They can not get their check unless they pay the extra 29.99. money

Poor Planning or just a scam Is it poor planning on your part or just a scam with apple that I would have to pay to upgrade my system to use your 2014 program. I didn't realize this until after trying to install the program. Then I had to buy your online version, more expensive than the disk I originally purchased. I have used your program for many years, if the next years program is not compatible with my Leopard version of Mac,I will be switching to something else. it can't be hard for your programmers to make this work. Not compatible with my system anymore

Easy...but not cost efficient $50 for deluxe, then had to spend another $30 to upgrade to Premier to submit my husbands K-1 with no income reported on it. Yes, I understand the difference and yes, I should've been more careful choosing the product, but after using it so many years in a row, I went with the version I always used previously. Wouldn't it be easier for consumers to pay a smaller fee based on what they're reporting? I didnt like that I had to pay $50 and then another $30 to upgrade to submit a K-1 with no income.

Frustrated family I (and my family) have used Turbo Tax to file our taxes for years. Based on my frustrating experience this year, I will be in the market for a new method of filing my taxes next year. I began with the Deluxe Version, but had to upgrade to the Business version because I needed a Schedule C. I understood I was eligible for a rebate for the additional cost if I used Turbo Tax last year, but I was unable to determine how to apply for this rebate when I purchased the upgrade. After I installed the upgrade, the program began to freeze and I was no longer able to open any of the "help" links. My overall experience was extremely frustrating. Extremely glitchy, would not open help boxes
Great but getting more costly I've been using turbotax since 2004, I understand that cost of inflation and such, but isn't there a break for loyalty? The cost of using app is costly

Mixed Thoughts I do not think most of the recommended "upgrades" gave me any advantage. I paid almost twice as much as any tax provider that I used before. If you just use the free Federal Tax Return you can't go wrong. But you need to do your own state returns. Additional Fees kept increasing without producing any savings.

Using turbotax is like signing up to be mislead I purchased what appeared to be the correct tax software, after I had started the process of doing my taxes I was asked for $30+taxes more for the Delux version that would allow me to fill out the forms for the sale of a house. And then when I got to state taxes, I discovered that the filing wasn't included just the forms. In the past TurboTax has been a brand that I trusted. I wont make that mistake again. It cost 49 for the software, 30 to upgrade and 25 to file for state. I will use different software next year. Misleading product descriptions lead me to spend $55 over purchase price
Inept and greedy I am disgusted with the poor quality and the greed. E.g., 2.5% of my payment to use my credit card?! $152 transaction fee?!

column1: Next year I won't be using Turbo Tax, that's for sure. I had to look up codes on third party sites. TurboTax kept trying to sell extras. Charge my card $152 for use of credit.

column2: Turbo tax Premier vs Business Premier wins due to the easy import from our brokerage accounts. Plus, the State filing was key!

column1: Business version fails due to no import capability on trust accounts. We have hundreds of transactions that have to be reported and without the import turbotax wasn't worth what I paid. Also, right ....my state (TN) was not listed as one of the states available to use the automated filing. Very disappointing. I hope they correct this by next year. Business was terrible

column2: Wont use it again I have been using TT since 1996.. almost 20 years. Wont ever use it again. too many extra charges now
Costly add-ons wreck cart Had to clear and start from zero due to the unexpected and incessant pop ups pushing all the extra features at 30 bucks a piece. No handy opt out in the design.

Turbo Tax I am a working for a public state school and know for a fact I didn't get enough money back. Unlike last year this was never an option for me. When I emailed Turbo tax help they Never got back to me and ended up filing last minute and not getting the money I deserve. I will never use turbo tax again. They made it next to impossible to file

Refund Cost was a bit too high. Many tax professionals in my area will do your taxes for less than 30usd. This is a computer program, I understand that there is cost to maintain this software but there nothing better then having a person do them. The only reason why I filed this year through intuit, to save embarrassment due to the lack of income I made last year. I understand the 2.49% charge to pay the taxes. But the intuit charge was too high. Cost, a bit high. Most tax professionals have services for less

Way too expensive!!! Each year the price creeps up what used to be an amazing simple service has gotten way too expensive with tons of "upgrades" or micro-transactions. I have a simple tax return the only complication that I have is a HSA which to me should be a standard item rather than an additional expense. When turbo tax opened up I had no other option to file other than the Deluxe "flavor" I had to dig a bit to allow it the option of choosing the free file. I will be filling early and on my own next year. The program is great though if it weren't for the fact of being forced to spend so much just to do what the free 'flavor" does minus automatically importing my info from last year I would have given it the 5 stars the software deserves. way too expensive I have a very simple tax return yet I have to pay $58.00

Marketing Trickery I use to like Turbotax but now the demanding of payment to keep your last years information available while filing is not good customer service. With this said I will not use this service again and I will spread the news of the expensive refund.

column1: My son is receiving $7 dollars combined from Fed & State but it cost me $59+ dollars (Highway robbery)
But who cares--Corporate America at it's finest!! Retaining Last Years information only if you pay $

column2: Angry customer I have enough problems going on in my life. The last thing I want to see and hear is my taxes being rejected!!!! I think turbo tax purposely reject my taxes so I can pay the higher delux version to get better services. Turbo tax purposely made the free edition to automatically reject your taxes! This will be the last time i will use turbo tax!!!! Telling me that my taxes were rejected but it took turbo tax a whole day to tell me
Horrible bugs and striking incompetence  errors in filing and basic tax rules

It wouldn't let me doing much unless I paid for the deluxe edition. If paying for federal it should include state or make it free!! The point of doing my own taxes is to save money. And if the cost of everything is more than what I am getting back from federal, let me use my federal return to pay part of the cost and credit card to pay difference. Way to expensive! It used to be free!!!!! Very expensive!!!
Bad customer support  never able to conect to buy additional state, and E-file charges in addition to paying for extra state returns
I didn't like the bland look of the system this year. I think something in between the look of last year and this year would be better. Last year it was too flashy this year so blah.
Quick way to file There is one way this could be better. If you made less than a certain amount of money you shouldn't have to pay for state tax. price
Sad I've been using this product since it began as MacInTax. How in one short year could you implode? Dissapointed
Did I get all the deductions possible? Wasn't confident that I received all the deductions available. Have been considering going to an accountant for taxes.

Turbo is very good, but still a few problems Ive been using Turbo since 1996, almost a decade and it gets a little better each year. I had some problems this time where some forms that I filled out in the beginning were not carried over to later portions and I had to re-enter them multiple times. Also on the state form, there were several very tricky pages and they contained no help button, so I was forced to use Google since even the top search bar was no help in those items.

column1: Other than those 2 problems, it is very good. I had a 2 friends try out Turbo for the first time this year after I told them it was very easy to use. Both of these friends needed only the free and easy version. The first friend had never done taxes before anywhere else and after a little help from me on the first page he was able to complete his taxes in about 2 hours and was super happy that it was so easy!

The second friend I had try out Turbotax usually had somone else do her taxes each year and didnt know what to do. I tried to help her by sitting down and guiding her through it. But she wanted to have the site switch into Spanish language to help her read and understand all the questions. We were unable to locate a language switch, so she got very frustrated and didnt want me to help her out. I offered to walk her through the whole process and explain everything on each page. But after 30 minutes she gave up and went back to her old accountant.
For people like me and my first friend, Turbotax is great.

However, I do not agree with the price increase. It was $130 last year. This year the price increased to $135, but I didnt get any benefit or added features from this new price. Most people today are still hurting from this depression that started in 2008. I havent yet gotten any raise in 8 years. Why should TurboTax get a raise? If the price goes up again in 2015, I will switch to H&R Block or another company. price went up $5 from last year for no reason. state forms had some problems.

column2: Sad refund It should not have been that expensive, and why did I HAVE to pay for deluxe when I have zero income?! Outrageous! Expensive!!!! I'm a disabled military veteran, and it cost me $60 to file.... When the refund was nothing.
Giving an error message about tax data is meaningless unless you tell us how to find and fix it. Error message is difficult to respond to

Needs a little more work The military spouse relief act has caused me major problems two year in a row now using turbotax. The program doesn't seem to be fully developed to deal with the specifics of the act. Last year the form was never even included in my return, at least that's what the state of Maine told me was the issue. This year there was more confusion and issues. Also there are problems with the first time home buyers credit that was offered between 2006-2012 (I think) the program was forcing me to enter a current year date of not using residence as main home but we still owned the home and had only vacated in military orders and were renting. Anyways otherwise great program. Look forward to using next year. Thank you military benefits and deductions
Never Using Again TurboTax went the way of the ripoff.

column1: I've used this desktop and online product since the 1990s without issue until this year. For the past four years, I purchase the home and business version which costs me plenty.
Now I have to pay to get my prior year returns and the system refused to pre-populate my 2013 data. I wasted an additional two hours hand jamming my own information.
Next year, I'll pay someone to do my taxes 2013 tax return data never pre-populated

column2: OVER CHARGE Had to up grade even tho I did no want to. Then when i wanted to have my fee for upgrading because you made me you charged me AGAIN to take it out of my refund! WHAT A RIP OFF!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! cost way to much to have my taxes done,

Expensive The competitors products provided the same easy to use guides and suggestions for 1/4 the cost. I used H&R Block on a families taxes since it's what they had purchased. Identical to TurboTax. I've used TurboTax since it's what I've used for 10+ years. My error, for sure ,for not checking. It won't happen again. So, TurboTax better have competitive rates next year, or me and any TurboTax users I know will not be using it. Not competitive on price
Told me I had to upgrade my edition for an extra 44 bucks and I didn't have to!

Unreasonable Fees I will never file with turbotax for as long as I live, and I will encourage my friends and family to use alternatives, as well. The fees you are now charging are unbelievable. I can't believe you even charge $35 to deduct the cost from the refund (that was a nice trick kinda hiding that cost. I almost didn't notice it before I filed).

column1: In the digital age where there are so many cheaper and even free options, it blows my mind that you would drive your own customers away by price gouging them.

The only reason I completed filing through you this year was because I filed late due to some personal issues, and I did not have time to complete my taxes elsewhere. But I promise that this is the last time. I am done with this site, and for the rest of my life I will recommend alternatives to any friends, family, co-workers, acquaintances, or strangers that are willing to listen. Not am I no longer your customer, but for being price gouged like this, I will work hard to take other customers from you, as well. Price Gouging

column2: Good, but... It worked great until I got to the healthcare area. I use catastrophic insurance that I got through the marketplace. Catastrophic insurance does not receive a 1095-a form, but the software insisted that I needed one. I wish there was a selection for this so it wouldn't be so confusing. Other than that I had no problems filing my taxes. No options for marketplace that dont involve a 1095a.

Failure to save me money I choose to use Turbo Tax hoping to save money over using a regular tax preparation office but I am extremely disappointed on the excessive fees and how long the process takes! I would never use or recommend the service EVER AGAIN! Fees, lenght of process, offers and upselling

Menus confusing It's nearly impossible to get back to a screen you've previously been in because of the way the navigation is so vague. For example, I have a rental property and I looked for about 5 minutes going through every menu until I finally found it. Also, last year I got 10% on my Amazon gift card and this year they're only giving a paltry 5%. I used the 10% gift to pay for Turbotax last year. I tried to contact them about this and they conned me into a callback and 12 hours later..no callback. Also early in the season, they used my bank info from past year to automatically charge me for the 2015 Turbotax download. Every time I deal with Intuit, I get more and more disappointed. I'm losing my trust in them. Navigation sucks, Amazon 5% sucks
cost very expensive for both filings. Will reconsider other filing mechanisms next year. but very easy to manuever through website very expensive
State Filing Sucks If you have to file in two state go see someone, Turbo Tax has never worked well for me, NEVER. State Filings Never Work
Disappointed I have used TB Tax for years and each time I turned around I got hit with another upgrade charge this year. Not happy! Additional charges
I thought the federal return was free if i filed my state return so i didnt like getting charged 54 dollars for it I thought fed ret was free....................not 54.00 dollars

turboTax 2014 Will not buy directly from intuit again. Will buy retail. I can get it at less cost and with better packaging and specials. Trying to complete NC state tax was very difficult because you hid how to enter get the Bailey Settlement amount. Had problems completing NC return, Bailiey not clear!

I've used turbo for past 10 years, it was extremely frustrating this year, passed words I've used were not accepted. I had to use another provider for one of the tax returns. I guess it was because the program was hacked into, I HOPE THE CHANGES PROTECTED THE SYSTEM . i've used turbo past 10 years. this was very frustrating this year. was unable to identify pass words. I had to use ano

Secret added costs I had decided to file a free federal return and was going to be charged only $29.99 for the state return. After entering all of my credit card information and submitting, there was an additional charge of $29.99 added on which did not appear on the total page before I entered my credit card information. TurboTax had upgraded me to the PLUS version without my knowledge. Beware of added costs, after reading other reviews it seems like this is a very common thing with TurboTax. Secret added costs which could not be refunded

? not as happy I usually like the turbo tax system, this yr there were changes that weren't explained, when I tried to find explanations, the sites were down. Trying to file an extention and couldn't find it. and it wasn't a pop up. very frustrated with it this yr. My returned for federal, was quite a bit less, but could find no reason why. It was still better than the some of the other systems I tried when I was frustrated with this one though. Which I'm not sure is saying much less clear than prev yrs. couldnt get it to give extention, very frustrated with changes that were there and not explain

Way to add on fees First of all, I'd like to see my old returns for reference, so I select the Deluxe package for $59 bucks. After I get going they charge an additional $39 bucks just to send my MO state return with my federal return. Keep in mind if you don't pay the fee, they delete everything you've already completed for state return. You guys can suck my nads. Screw you. Thanks Obama. Charge additional fees for every step you take

"I tried to submit my PA tax return electronically but I could not because the program was looking for some schedule K-1 information that I don't have. I finally mailed my state return but they took my 24.99. How do I get it back?"

premier not worth it Please don't say you can calculate cost basis when you can't. It's the only reason I upgraded, and it did not help. I was told that upgrading to premier would help me with investment income. It did not.

Frustrating cheaters Got all the way through my return and I ACCIDENTALLY clicked that I wanted to upgrade. Tried to back up, nope you can't cancel it. Had to restart. Restarted again and it did it again!!!! Maybe user error or maybe a program made to cheat a lazy person out of money. I'm not lazy. I filled out my taxes three times. Also, don't call the 800 number its a really long long long wait and maybe no one actually works there. Why am I being told I can't have a bad attitude in a review of your product?! Don't accidentally click yes to buy it

What's happened to these guys at TT? Customer service is abysmal, absolutely zero response in the past few years from texts, emails, phone calls, etc. Then after nothing happens they send an email looking for a rating (ever see the Honeymooners when Ed wants a reference from Ralph?). The company is destined to fail over time because they literally make it impossible to speak to or reach anyone ever about anything. And this is weeks before tax day. And yes, this is the expensive version that "has all the bells and whistles" re service noted on the box. Don't believe it--you're on your own. Customer service continues to get worse every year
I would not recommend using this product. I rated this as one star but only because I could not give it zero stars.

column1: My return keeps getting rejected and I get a message that says that TurboTax will help me fix my return but there is absolutely no help and it does not tell you what the problem is so that you know where to go to fix it. I'm very frustrated and will now have to file an extension. What should have been a three hour adventure has turned into three days of frustration. I can not efile my return even though I paid for the service.

column2: TurboTax gets worse every year TurboTax gets worse every year and this year is no exception. I have been using TurboTax and MacInTax since the '80s and it used to be an incredible program. I don't know what the developer are doing, but it looks like they're trying hard to add more and more useless junk.

column1: Case in point: the interview is even more obnoxious than it used to be. Don't you realize that most people don't have everything handy instantly which means they must return to questions later? If you want to do that or make a change to something you've already done, it jumps into the middle of an interview and asks questions that are not only irrelevant but I have answered before! Do I have to answer them? Can I ignore them? If I previously finished a section and I give the wrong answer, will it wipe out what I did? It is completely unclear. Filling out forms that can't be downloaded (e.g., a 1099-B) is much more confusing in the supposedly helpful interview than as a form. Why? Every time I made a change to charitable contributions it asked, me again, if I had an ItsDeductible account. Each time I reviewed my return (making fixes) they asked me if I wanted to spend $60 for audit protection. Do they really think the answers changed in the last 15 minutes? No, it's an upsell opportunity. I already paid for the product, please stop advertising others!

And, oh yeah, this year I had to buy a much more expensive version of it in order to do my taxes. Yeah, they're going to give me $25 back, but I'll bet I'm locked into the more expensive version every year from now and they won't give me $25 back next year, when I will seriously look at switching to the competition. Worse every year

column2: Too expensive, too outdated This year Intuit released far too many versions of TurboTax, raised the price, and made few noticeable improvements, if any. In my case, my electronic returns were rejected because of possible identity theft, though the software has no way of confirming that or redirecting one to a helpful IRS or Intuit call center. The system generates the error, which is extremely vague, and then insists the user to contact Intuit. The link provided goes nowhere. On top of this, Intuit still charges you for any electronic filing fees (which are a joke to begin with) despite the incorrectable rejection. Next year I'll be doing these by hand, TurboTax is by no means any faster. Customer service is non-existent
not user friendly very tedious with charitable donations

column1: unable to input information when choices are limited unable to enter all tax credits

column2: Pretty easy but can be confusing at times! Ehen doing this year's taxes, just realized that Turbo taxes was calculating taxes on prior year tax refund of $1,505 when I only received $221. I cough it and fixed it manually, but if I was not looking in details, I would have to pay a bigger amount to NY state. Brings inacurate prior year information

Formerly GREAT Product has Become Buggy The previous versions of TurboTax did the job well and with virtually no problems. They new version, with the MicroSoft Silverlight plugin has been extremely buggy and crash-prone. WHY oh WHY did you change a good product‽‽ Frequent crashes, Buggy MicroSoft Silverlight PlugIn

Turbo Tax turbo tax is awful they snuck in an extra $50 in fees for the turbo tax pro even though i specifically specified the i would rather enter the info myself and continued to do so twice and they still charged me i am extramly upset and i really could have used that money costs me money when its supposed to be free

SERIOUSLY? YOU STILL CHARGED ME I DID NOT SIGN UP TO HAVE TURBO TAX PLUS AND YET YOU STILL CHARGED ME AN ARM AND A LEG!! SO INSTEAD OF PAYING THE OUTRAGEOUS 39.99 TO FILE MY STATE TAXES, I GOT HAGGLED INTO PAYING AN ADDITION 39.99!!! THAT IS SO CHEAP!! I CLICKED NO EVERY TIME.

column1: I WILL MOST CERTAINLY NOT BE USING THIS WEBSITE NEXT YEAR. 39.99 THAT I DIDNT SIGN UP FOR

column2: Customer-oriented but deceptively pricey I am dissatisfied with how TurboTax would not allow me to continue doing my federal taxes without upgrading to TurboTax Deluxe which cost me an additional $44.99. I did not see any way to decline the upgrade which really upset me.

column1: I would not mind a reimbursement since I did not need features of the Deluxe product. Forced me to upgrade my TurboTax product and had to pay $45 more.

column2: Going backwards I have been using TurboTax and MacinTax before that since 1991. Unfortunately, the features of the software keep disappearing, and it gets harder to use every year. Creating multiple versions that increase the cost is a mistake. Making it difficult to track back through numbers is also a mistake. The ability to go into forms, and double click on a number and find the source of the number made it a fantastic way to make sure you were doing your taxes right and understood how they were being done. Now it is just a black box that you must trust with no understanding of where the numbers are coming from. features keep disapearing

Didn't Tell Us About "Extra" Fees Turbo Tax was not clear and charged me $80 at the very end for 'audit protection' despite their own admission that my audit risk was low. Until they charge you ridiculous fees at the end
started out for "free". ended up paying over $50. Bait and switch.

column1: Also had to wade through advertising wanting to hit me for more bucks. Did not like and won't use again.

column2: Disapointed but satisfied Tax season is frustrating to begin with, continually being tricked into getting the Turbo Tax PLUS edition is even worse. I can understand asking a couple times but when I say no I mean no. I had to back track twice because when I got to the final payment page I was apparently buying it. Turbo Tax is great for doing your taxes error free. But don't select paying with your refund, its an automatic PLUS signup. Unless you want it of course.

Its just best to see a real person My boy friend thought free filing was a good idea So he got a quote ,but he didn't get the child section cause 'we didn't have baby for over 6 months) false hnrblock lady got us that credit and instead of a 540 some odd dollars he got around 4,500 back instead Turbo tax you sorry seemed buggy fortunately for me I am are the stay at home mom with no income If you did make money or had a child recently there are some deductions that just dont show up

disappointed this year The 1st disc I bought was faulty. and I refused to pay more than I originally paid for the software just to ask you about it. So, I went out an bought another copy. Your after purchase communication is terrible. the 1st disc I bought was faulty. and I refused to pay more than I originally paid for the software just to ask you abou

Annoying Upsells I went to annualize my income to reduce my underpayment penalty. The form didn't have instructions for grabbing last years total tax liability, and I had to google it in another window. Then it didn't fill all the fields in correctly on form 2210AI, and threw an error during the review time, and I had to go fix the forms manually.

column1: Kept trying to sell me state returns, even though I live in a state with no income tax.
Kept trying to sell me "Audit Defender" - No Thank You! Form 2210 Data Entry was not as good as the rest of the program

column2: Outmoded Contact Systems Could not upgrade my turbo tax because my email address was no longer accessible. You did not provide option to send me a text message. Only recourse was to call your overloaded systems the next day.

column1: Customer Service agent got me set with new use ID and password and corrected my email address in your system

Issue # 2: I go thru this EVERY year. Need to use credit card to pay to file state taxes. You go round and round and don't accept my card. After I get co-opted to go to your marketing site and after about 10 attempts you finally accept my credit card payment so I can file my state e-return and finish. 30 seconds till finish line always takes 30 minutes. No text message option when email is no longer accessible

column2: Bye Bye Turbo Tax Turbo Tax seems to be getting more confusing. We had our first IRS audit and can't get access to what we actually entered on the tax form or get to the questions to see how we answered them. I also printed a copy of the form after I submitted it and when I checked for the audit, it was different. Now they make it much more difficult to get to chat or real time help. Plus prices are going up. All good valid reasons to just take them to an accountant and spend a little more, but worry a lot less knowing they are right. This is the last year we will be using them, very disappointing... The areas where I needed additional information, there wasn't any. No preview before purchase on state return.
I did not ask for Turbotax Plus I did not ask for Turbotax Plus but the software automatically added it at the end at asked me to pay an additional $30.

2014 Tax Surprise I have used Turbo Tax for years and found it to be efficient and generally technically sound. I was surprised this year when my copy of the basic version wouldn't allow me to open investment forms to record stock sales. I felt like this was a bait and switch as I had to upgrade my version for another $30+. I will definitely look at the competition next year before I subject myself to another Intuit shakedown.

near disaster averted I have been using Turbo Tax for 13 years. Our tax situations have changed, but I've always been very pleased. This year, however, was nearly a complete disaster solely because of the state download disaster. After completing the federal return, the system would not allow access to the "free" state download I'd already requested, that it said I had. After requiring me to purchase the state, the same issue occurred. I was at a standstill. Not even the main website allowed me to download what it said I'd purchased. So while I was partially at fault for trying to download the software onto a thumb drive (bad idea), the main website had issues. When I finally spoke to a customer service representative, he re-sent me the state download, and walked me through an alternate method of installation. It was the kind, understanding, knowledgeable customer service representative that pulled through in the end. This was by far the most frustrating year, and almost turned me away from Turbo Tax for good. My state download disaster was averted, and finishing the filing was simple, after that. Looks like I will continue using Turbo Tax...on my hard drive/desktop. state download a nightmare
Processing my taxes I will not do this next year I tried to do the e-file and used my card to pay. I kept getting a msg about a problem that was fixed; wouldnt process!

Crooks If you choose to have them take the state fee out of your refund they make you pay for pro with is an additional 30.00. Find another software to use. They cheat you out of money by making you sign up for pro

Zilch on CS! Bad program Beware, changing numerical values while filling out items in your refund will not always show up in the summerization of your filing. double check, faulty program. Bad customer service, cannot get a real person on the phone! Turbo Tax, or intuit should hire more personnel, especially on the 15th if they expect return customers next year! Probably the single most profitable day of the whole tax preparation season for them. When going back to correct choices, will not show changes in end results
Walking in the dark (1) Please show which form I am currently working on!

column1: (2) Many questions are so blunt and not thought out so I could not find what to do. Had to do 2 days ore trial and erros to figure out what each buttons would lead me to.
(3) Please show some example cases to help understand what the interview questions are really for. Interview questions sounded like from nowhere questions. crude help

column2: Not very freindly for constuction industry & seemed to use areas I never used before, I reverted back to old method

BEING PUSHY WITH COLLEGE STUDENT have used turbo tax for years for all family members taxes. when doing my college students taxes today I was asked to upgrade to turbo tax plus. when ideclined this service it said I would have to start from beginning and enter info again, even though the address info was already there from previous years. was asked a second time later on.

column1: the total income was 1010.00 and the refund was going to be 121.00.
Trying to get an extra 30.00 out of us is shameful of you! and they making us put in info that you already had just makes me angrier!
shame on you turbo tax....... PUSHING TURBOTAX PLUS

column2: too expensive. when i realized i didnt need the upgrade, it was too late to get my money back.

Online Products and Pricing I started my taxes by selecting a simple, single online product and got whacked additional charges at the end. When I selected start over it and went through process again I got the same product charges I originally did not want. Going back to accountant next year, not worth hassle and frustration. My simple taxes through Turbo Tax cost me 179.00 - what a joke. Impossible to go back and select lower $ products

Removing Ex-Husband's Email frm Acct = Impossible While there is a lot to be said for the easy interface and 1,2,3 done of TurboTax, I have to say I have officially fallen OUT of love after having my ex-husband receive password re-set prompts from the system even after TWO calls to customer service asking them to REMOVE his email/username from my account.

column1: Likewise, when my ex tried to do his own return, I received an email that a password reset was attempted.
I mean REALLY, TurboTax? This is just awful.
Next year I will hire an accountant instead of going through this again.
Extremely disappointed,
privacylost Calling customer service twice didn't help

column2: Deluxe = Deception Trust is critical to financial decisions and intuit has demonstrated, with the 2014 'Deluxe' product, that they cannot be trusted. Too many other competing products to accept this deceptive behavior. intuit's constant upsell stategy now includes deception

Right forms -Wrong Price I was charged $144.98 for 'Home and Business' even though I clicked through from an online price of $84.99. When I entered these points into a search bar on the TurboTax's site, they said they were "aware of the problem and to contact them after April 16". I fully expect to get a refund of $59.99. ASAP. Advertised price of filing offered was not honored. No way to make adjustment at check out.
Lots and Lots of Fees I had a hard time figuring out how to handle my back door conversion to my Roth. Google helped me figure out how to do it through Turbo Tax.

column1: Immensely frustrated at all of the hidden fees. We bought the software for $50 or $60, had to pay extra for some more complex tax scenarios, had to pay extra to file my state return, and had to pay an outrageous "convenience" fee to pay my taxes with a credit card. Absolutely ridiculous in this day and age. I paid it all this year, but probably won't do it again. I could've dropped everything off with the tax man for what I paid to do it myself. Low cost at first, until you want to do somethng complex, pay your taxes or file a state return

column2: A TOTAL RIP OFF!!!! I file e-filed my Federal return in March, but waited to file my state until 4/15/15 (My fault). However, when I was paying to file my state return, they required me to pay $95, instead of $40. They had me, and I had to pay because I had to get it filed...TOTAL RIP OFF!!! They are thieves, DO NOT USE, unless it's too late, like my situation! They charged me for an upgrade AFTER I filed my return.

Upselling I had a schedule K to submit. It told me I had to upgrade to Premier for an extra charge. After charging me, It then asked me 1 question (is it a retirement plan), and then said that I didn't need to submit the schedule K. Frustrating. 1 question for $30 dollars. Upselling unnecessary fees

disappointed I was sent an email stating that i could file this year for state for $0 charge, i use turbo tax every year. so after being offered the state for free i went through with the filing. by the time i get to the end of of the whole process it tells me its going to be 29.99 plus tax. You shouldnt send false advertisements and not honor them free of charge not honored

NOT GOOD IN 2014 DREADFUL EXPERIENCE THIS YEAR. JUST AS I FINISHED AT 7:00 PM, I WAS LOOKING AT FORMS AND TT ASKED IF I WANTED TO SAVE THEM (I THOUGH) AND I DO NOT SO I SAID NO. I EXITED AND THERE WAS NOTHING THERE!!! THIS HAS NEVER HAPPENED BEFORE. TT ALWAYS SAVED EVERYTHING.

column1: I HAD TO START ALL OVER AND IT HAS BEEN REALLY, REALLY HARD.

column2: I am switching next year I have used TurboTax for at least a decade or more.

column1: My returns have been fairly easy. The sales of complicated stocks used to be the hardest item to enter.
Then we started an S Corp.
I used to remember clicking on Help from any section of the step by step or forms menu and being taken to information relating to that issue.
Now, I have to enter the information in myself and wonder if I have done so correctly
I am currently using a CPA firm to do my business taxes and am taking their returns and entering it into TurboTax for my personal returns.
This is the last year!
It was way too complicated, and I needed more help and support than I could find for my situation on TurboTax or through the TurboTax community.
I will be paying a CPA to do both next year.
Thanks for all the good years! Didn't find the support I needed this year

column2: Slow Response corrupted files on opening

column1: FORM 1116 does not work correctly
K-1 entries are not all enterable
not all fields from 1099-DIV can be entered too long of a delay before any noticeable action after pressing continue

column2: Updater buggy I've been using TT for many years. This is the first year I've had some trouble with it. I couldn't get the updater software to work properly, even after uninstalling and reinstalling TT twice. Finally discovered the manual update page on TT website, which lets you download the latest updates manually.

column1: Once I got the updates installed, I was able to complete my return.
Finally, several times the software took me back over pages that I had already filled out. This is a drawback I've seen in previous's year's TT. Updater module wouldn't work at all

column2: The Community Properties instructions suck. I used Turbo Tax for years but this year version just sucked. I first tried it on Windows 8 and it didn't do the updates. So I did the updates online and I could get access to the screen to enter my 403b for credit and Community Properties. I went back to my old laptop that uses Windows 7 and I was able to install the updates just find. Again when I went to Community Properties problems. I had to flag Community Properties to be able to go back to it. The Community Properties was confusing because my husband had a few 1099R and SSA 1099. I called the IRS, Turbo Tax and went to see Two different Tax ladies and everyone was confused about the Community Properties. My husband owed and paid and after I added his income my positive became a negative. So technical if your partner pays his dues so will you with the Community Properties stuff. Here's the thing if you pay a Tax lady that don't fill anything out in the Community Properties so that's crazy. I hope Turbo Tax work out the bugs for next year. Not enough information on the Community Properties If your partner owes it may be cheaper to get it done from a Tax men
pathetic It took me forever to file the tax return and find a way to pay the extra surprise fees. bad taste filing is very troublesome

Frustrated I started my return over, had someone else start it and it still charged me for plus even after we answered 2 questions no we did not want it. So frustrated i am forced to pay an extra $29.99. We even signed out, signed back in and it said order total was $29.99 but when we got to the final check out page it reverted to the $59.98. I want my money back forces you to upgrade to plus and ads on $30

Too Expensive TurboTax continues to charge more and more. I will probably try a different software next year to save money. It was way too expensive this year. Why does it keep going up?? Keeps getting more and more expensive
Very annoyed very costly for the service Won't let me continue without submitting a review

Great, except payment experience I was infuriated by this year's experience in paying for using TurboTax. I used my credit card, which I knew to have a zero balance, and was denied use of that card, the stated reason being that my credit balance was exceeded. I knew that was not true, but I tried several more times over a period of three days, during which my balance was maintained at zero, but I was still unable to get approval from Intuit. My father also tried to use his credit cards, but was also denied, even though there's no question that his cards are in good standing, and, since he always maintains a zero balance, it was not possible for him to have approached his credit limit. I was forced to use the take-it-from-my-refund option, and that needlessly cost me $35.00. I have thoroughly appreciated the TurboTax option for doing my taxes, but, because I feel as though I've been compelled to pay Intuit an extra $35, needlessly, I will have to rethink my approach during next year's tax season. I really am disappointed! extreme payment difficulties!

Had to pay 2 times for 1 state have used turbotax for a number of years,but this will be the last,paid 80.00 for personal and small business,when come time to enter the Oklahoma state tax,it popped up, i needed to pay 40.00 for Oklahoma,so long story short,it cost me 120.00 instead of 80.00,I was not happy or amused. State was supposed to be included,but had to pay another 40.00 to get one state

Easier this year than before - but felt cheated! I thought I was paying only $59 - but that was for the federal only version, not the state, and was arm-twisted into the audit defense option since otherwise I'd have to pay $40 for credit card OR deduct from federal return option; at least with the audit defense it was $5 more AND the deduction and e-filing were free. I didn't go back and deduct the EXTRA COSTS for tax preparation - it was $89 more than I thought it would be! Felt CHEATED by TURBO TAX and its approach was shady. Did NOT tell me the cost of the different options until the very end - I felt like I'd been had !!!
overcharge have used for years but charges have just gotten ridiculous.you try to act like fed is free until later in the return. overpriced,you want t charge for anything and everything.

Turbo Tax 2014 I have been using Turbo Tax for many years and I have always loved the product. This year was an exception. It was by far the worst that I have seen... crashes, non-intuitive sections, being told that there was an error and unable to fix, etc.

column1: Frankly you are giving your possible competition an edge. As an avid Intuit user I was surprised. Crashed often

column2: The option for extra items should set automatically. I unchecked the extra $29.99 charge for online access. In going back and changing something else it re-selected it without my knowledge and charged me for a service I did not want. I would think twice before using Turbo tax again. I had to unselect it several times going back.
Poor Customer Service Customers shouldn't be waiting on the phone for hrs Very difficult to get in contact with technical support.
first they charge you, then if you can, finish it first they charge you, then if you can, finish the process...not good!!! take you money

Deeply disappointed this year! I've used Turbo Tax for 10 years now and this year was the first time I was disappointed with the program. I couldn't access the updates and couldn't proceed with with filing because of this. Shame on me for waiting til the last minute to file, but I never expected any problems from what has been an extremely pleasant program to use. I'll have to decide if next year is the time to try another company's product couldn't upload updates. Required help from Geek squad to do. Then had to re-enter all data info.

Rip off!!!! I am a college student and first time filer. I earned $1,500 and Turbo Tax charged me $45 to do my taxes. I feel like I have been robbed. Turbo Tax took more of my money than the Federal Government. Forced to buy the Turbo Tax product for $45 just because I got a 1099-MISC
very costly for what they offered won't let me continue without doing this review
Sharks This will be my last time using Turbotax.

column1: I have used this service for years and didn't realize I could get basic filing for FREE until a dear friend of mine told me.
As an American tax payer, we have the right for free, basic tax filings. I am single, college educated women with zero kids attempting to fill the boot straps that was handed to me back in 1986.
Your layout makes that utterly impossible.

You have to be a secret agent to be able to make sure your filing stays free. I understand TurboTax is business but the hidden fees and sneaky attacks to get you to spend more, this company should be ashamed.

We all know tax season is stressful and anxiety filled- your company even acknowledges that- you also take full advantage of such. Its disgusting, I understood the 29.99 state filing fee then out of no where towards the end, there was an added turbotaxPlus fee. I dont even understand how I got there. And clearly that is the TurboxTax purpose. Surely $30 isnt a big deal but it is to a minimum wage worker in NYC. $30 is one week Metrocard pass. Shame on this company. Stop the tricks.
You won't be getting a single cent from me next year.
-- The constant push for upgrades

column2: a lengthy process to an expensive end.....REally! If the tax prep was REALLY FREE- as advertised- it would have been a great site. It was easy to use, but I FELT USED as it kept adding new charges and it should have gotten to the SEND about 35 pages sooner than it did.....but wait! just one more reason to charge you something more. And MORE!

column1: I felt it was a rip off. But I am so overwhelmed at doing my taxes at the last minute, I Just wanted them DONE.
When they have you by the balls, your hearts and mind will follow. Felt like a bait and switch as everything I entered came up with higher charges!

column2: Got suckered into paying almost 200 I paid more for doing my taxes through Turbo Tax then I did my accountant in years past. I thought this was a money saving option but ended up getting railroaded into having to buy the premium package. There also no mention of the 40 to file the state and then the additional 40 to file them at the same time. Really disappointed in Turbo Tax. Railroaded into paying for something I don't think I needed. Scummy way of doing it.

Turbo Tax I've used Turbo Tax for years, but this year there were glitches that were frustraing when it came to selling a car used for business and buying a car used for business. Errors at the end with no real help without digging through google.

Disappointed I have been using turbo tax for years and have never had any issues. I have always trusted this site to file my taxes and have recommended turbo tax to several friends and family members. However, I will now take my business somewhere else from now on if I continue to pay these outrageous fees. I have never been charged almost $100 to prepare and file state and federal taxes. You can imagine my disappointment when the fee not only went up to $75 (which was the quote when I started my tax preparation) but when I finally did file, I was charged an extra $20 plus dollars. I hope you do not continue to take advantage or I will no longer use your product and will warn all those I highly recommended this site to in the future.

column1: Please lower your fees for those of us who are returning customers...we should be valued and not robbed. Charge far too much money this year for use

column2: slow tax the cd version doesn't autofill previous years cd version

column1: more complicated to understand had to pay more tax info and help were inadequate as a past user I found this year's version below par

column2: eh.... I have used TurboTax for the past five years or so. I even used the pay version last year, but there is no record of my return for 2013. So much for loyalty....... Pricey

it costs almost as much to use turbo tax as it would to pay a professional. was unable to file state before federal, so i had to wait on my state refund until after i paid my federal. overpriced, unable to file state before federal

I will have someone do my taxes next year. You charge too much now. I have been using TurboTax for years. Very disappointed with your costs. I feel like I am held hostage with your fees. cost of money

not so user-friendly this year I'm not sure if it's the new Home & Business version I had to buy this year, but I don't remember being this annoyed the past few years. To go in and add a single business expense, you have to navigate through 20 screens. Every. single. time. that my husband found a new receipt. The estimated taxes vs. modified W-4s was very confusing too--I had to reread this part 4 times. Also, there should be an autosave feature, at least in the more expensive versions. Windows decided to update itself with TurboTax open on my screen and I had to reconstruct a lot of work. So this year TurboTax made me buy a more expensive version, charged 25% more to efile my state return, and drove me insane with the navigation paths. cumbersome to navigate to parts you want to update

grammer and spelling errors I found the interview nerve racking. I tried to chat with an agent or talk buy never could. I realize it is the worst day of the worst season to contact you but you are also aware of the demand.

column1: I feel that is some areas my return may be audited because I am starting a business this year and the print out stated I end use of my business this year and there was no way to correct it.
The were more than an embarrassing amount of spelling and grammar errors on the interview. NOT what I would expect from a fortune 500 company.
I selected the small business return and was forced to go through the interview about farms.
Other than that I continue to use turbo tax or local help until a flat tax get passed in congress for everyone making less than $50,000.

Oh, your webmaster needs to freeze the text box, it just resized on me from a 2 x 4 to 1 by 6 inch. Should not be able to resize, only scroll up and down. the page state that I STOP using my car for business when it should have said started. Another, the word match was mask

column2: Longtime Filer feeling a bit abused Feel a bit dirty using TT again as I don't think they have the best interest of their customers in mind given the sneaky way they changed product/pricing this year price increase
not a happy filing 2014 I WAS EXTREMELY MAD FILING MY TAXES WITH TURBO TAX THIS YEAR ALWAYS BOUGHT DELUXE AND NEVER HAD TO PAY TO FILE MY CALIFORNIA RETURN BEING THAT WE ARE MILITARY.

column1: I WAS NOT HAPPY WITH TURBO TAX SOFTWARE 2014 I bought deluxe and had to pay extra to file CALIFORNIA RETURN

column2: Not as easy as the previous year  Cannot access previous years filings

ReallY???? $29 bucks for state with an $18 refund It's totally lame that you want to charge $30 to a young first time filer for a very small income on the state return . . . just shameful. Lame state return charge for young first time filers
I began 15 years ago with TurboTax boxed edition when i first bought my house; it seemed great, asked questions and had little videos with info to help.

column1: The on-line version every year has made the anger in me immediate and intense, as it does something wrong EVERY single year! Such as NOT asking ?s in order as you go thru the guided portion. I was finished with ALL entries and it showed that I OWED hundreds of dollars for federal! SOMEthing was wrong! I finally found the spot (not easy! feel very sorry for 1st time users!!) comparison to last year's whole list, and saw that the morggage taxes portion was blank!!! WHAT the WHAT?!! IT NEVER ASKED ME THAT!!!! I had to continuallllyyyyyyy go back to find bits and pieces that were MISSED by TurboTax!!!!! I had to MANUALLY find them and answer!! UGH!!!

Then, I was finished, but the 'check' found that I was missing medical expenses... I answered the ? that I didn't have any this year, because every year there has not been enough $$ spent to bother (even tho I did add it last year and prior). I could NOT get that worksheet off no matter how many times I tried, revisited, re-answered the medical ?s!!!! UGH!!! I finally just put in one answer (I also feared that if I put in ONE answer, it would then come back and ask twenty more, like it always does!!).

HOW MANY items were MISSED???! Several years ago it reduced my lowly return from over $900 to $600!! I couldn't figure out what happened!!! It's STUPID!!! EVERY year it does SOMEthingS wrong, forgets to ASK questions (in order or at all!), adds info where NONE was inputed!

column2: no live help, charity inputs are out of date with few options for items donated, didnt save all info from last year no live help, charity inputs are out of date with few options for items donated, didnt save all info from last year
????? someone else filed in march using our SS # - ? whether it was due to turbotax - saw others that it happened to - was on phone with irs for 3 hours. thanks turbotax our identity was taken
did not like this years version I have been using Turbotax for over a decade. This year was the first time I did not find the assistance needed.

column1: Did not get any assistance on how to interprete certain fields in state return. There was also a broken link to the sc state website for forms and publications.
Help online does not seem to cover state specifics.
I became disabled in 2014 and have SSDI and a LTD income ,
I would like these topics to be covered better in next years version, or at least be able to find assistance on specific fields.
It would be nice to see instructions from worksheets so you at least know what you are entering.

Example: Permanent Disability exception : you need to enter an amount, but I had no clue what amount I should be entering, The max of the distribution taken, sure its not medical expenses, as that is another exception. so not sure what needed to be entered here. If you were disabled for the entire year, does that mean you always enter your total distribution, to not have the 10% penalty ?

I also got some ammendments that IRS made, and I believe these amendments could have been easily caught in the Turbotax software. Now, I had to spend time to fix and communicate with IRS, even had to hire a Tax Lawyer, to know how to handle this, as it was clearly a glitch in the TURBOTAX software. no help on certain fields. would like to be able to get more help

column2: 2nd state fiasco Lost at least an hour on the phone and online trying just to buy your 2nd state return program, which you eventually promised would be mind for free because of all the trouble I went through.

column1: Never got it. Couldn't find out where to insert your 'unlock' numbers or where to find and download the program. 2nd state tax purchase never worked

column2: you owe me $179! made to use a plan and pay more than i needed
Definitely not happy with this version I've been a Turbo tax user for about 8 years and I've always enjoyed the self guides to hep me finished my taxes. Both W2 and 1099 work.

column1: This year I got the deluxe version as I thought it would be sufficient to submit a Schedule C but it required me to upgrade to the next version up. Fine, another $40, total cost for the software now $109. In the part where I got stopped and it required me to be upgrade to the next version, it has a statement that read, "You will continue exactly where you left off." That was not the case.
