I was entering my business expenses when it stopped me and after the upgrade, it took me to a whole new set of screens. Then it was prompting me for all sorts of different questions that made me feel like my taxes were going to have errors in it.

I decided to start over which I did not want but it is better than having the IRS knocking at your door. When I started over, I had expected to have the self guides walk me through my 1099, but instead I had to click on every single thing I wanted to work on. This really took me by surprised and it was extremely disappointing. All of sudden I have a less than deluxe version of what's supposed to be their Business class software.

Really upsetting and frustrating. Next year I'll be looking to move to another platform for my taxes. This is the first time Turbo tax has let me down in a big way. This version is so bad that I never want to buy Turbo tax again. Deluxe version didn't have enough info to complete my business

column2: Whatever i think i got charged doubled instead of just $29.99 like i thought hidden charges
Using Turbo Tax I feel the cost is a too high for the value of the product. Cost
Had to pay to upgrade to get Schedule D. :( An easy product to use. I just need to figure out how to get reimbursed the $30 i had to spend for an upgrade. Can't get a refund for the $30 upgrades

Review of 2014 Turbo Tax Premier All went well with the Federal portion, but the California download crashed, and all my work was gone! Happily, I was able to locate the file on iMac Backup, and was welcomed back to the final page of my Federal return. There were no further problems with the California download, but, for a while, my heart sank into my shoes. I did not see any real advantage to buying the extra download entitled Home and Business. The copy of California return crashed!
what a pile of st... i did turbo tax for like 8 years and i wasnt even allowed to import

column1: you guys suck and so help me god i will never ever ever do turbo tax again. keep your 60 bucks

column2: disappointed will probably not use this program again. in the past, the instructions were clear to understand and easy to make changes. not sure what happened this year! Very difficult to make changes. And when I left my name in the que for help, I was told I had a 90 minute wait. ..that was 2 days ago still waiting ....... not as clear to understand as the past versions!
State charge is a rip off It's easy to use, but it is expesnive. They charge $60 for federal and $40 for state. Seems excessive. price for what you get
I always thought that repeat customers should get some reward but instead I get price hikes each year I believe I will not be using this site in the years to follow no repeat customer appreciation

Fairly painless Turbo Tax can guide you through entering your data and it knows what to prompt you for. However, often times tax terms aren't really explained fully. Also, when I was prompted to enter the hour for e-filing, I had to guess that the Turbo Tax program meant the hour that is the best time for the IRS to contact us, as there was no explanation other than "form blah needs the hour". Great. But what I do like is their program that lets pros handle the situation when you get audited - and we usually get audited. It's nice to know that all I have to do is upload needed info to a secure server, and someone else is going to handle the IRS for me. People unfamiliar with tax terms may get confused, prompts incomplete

Never will use Turbo Tax again Not only do you now have to pay for state income tax returns if you want to use a credit card the fee is an outrageous high 2.49% of the amount of your payment. I understand that credit card companies charge a fee but that fee is now caped and all you are doing is using this as a huge income generating device. I will never use Turbo Tax again and I will tell everyone that I speak to not to use Turbo Tax as it is no longer a good business to deal with. Excessive fees

Expensive I have used Turbo Tax for several years now. I was disappointed that the cost went up mid tax season. Seems like they could have waited until between tax years. I really dislike that they charge extra to use your CC. Will likely look for alternatives for 2015 filing. Extra fees for using CC

prices are too high! I like the ease of electronic filing, but every year turbo tax is jacking up the price! I started my taxes but delayed in sending. When I returned to the site to submit my tax return the only option was to pay $55! I only owe $38 to uncle Sam. I am a disappointed customer. paid more for turbo tax than what I owed in taxes!

I owe I owe so off to find another job I purchase the simple 1040EZ/A software at the store for 20 dollars. It took 30 minutes to upload the software . Then I was charged 39 dollars to file with my state, but the charges don't stop there I was charged an additional 25 dollars to file electronically. Bye Bye Turbo Tax, next year I will be looking at another tax preparation services. done

Will never use service again I had to file a simple tax return: single, no kids, no house, no car, one job, one state of residency. I thought TurboTax would be the perfect option over accountants and service providers wanting to charge me $100 to do my taxes since I've done my taxes by hand before this.

column1: In the end, TurboTax swindled me the same and for inferior services. Basically, almost no tax return can be filed under their "free" version -- if you have to file a 1040, then you must use the "deluxe" version. However, this is only told after you have spent a few hours entering all your information and you are left with the decision of restarting from scratch or just paying the money.
My own fault for waiting until the last minute to do my taxes so props to TurboTax for seizing the opportunity and getting my $100 but it won't happen again. Deceptive pricing.

column2: absurd Upon logging in I found out to upload my last years taxes that I did on turbotax now costs an additional 30.00 dollars which I found out after I finalized everything and was about to EFile

column1: Using TurboTax costs $30.00 just to use and then at the end they add another $30 because I used my saved tax info from last year for my address and AIG ridiculous
I should have used the other site I know of that's only ten dollars
never again paying $60 just to use last years info

column2: Last year I received $1200 for my dependent children. This year I received $0.00. As it turned out I received a total of $16.00 return and paid $144.00 to Turbotax to get that information. No income (in fact -$1200). There was no way to review my dependent children. What happened to the promised free Turbotax. I have been happy until this year--I am going under financially and you have not helped me. Why were my children all of a sudden no help in getting a return? The are aged 16 and 8. ez

no support when i had a problem with billing when completed i paid the 31.00 on my credit card then it would not let me complete step 2 . then finding no support i continued and had them take it out of my refund. Then the rate change from 29.99 state federal free to i then had to pay 29.99 for each . Total spent was an error. However it had to be done today. 4/15/2015 Not satisfied with the charge for doing this felt like i was taken.
Turbo Tax Premier Have used product for years. Will not do so again. Too many problems repeatedly froze and would not correct or delete

New aggravations 1) I was told by the Intuit rep that it would run on my Mac OX 10.6.8, but when I purchased and downloaded it, and tried to install, the installer indicated I needed at least OS 10.7!

column1: 2) I had no changes in my situation from last year, where I used the "Deluxe" version. However, this year, TurboTax Deluxe "forced" me to upgrade first to "Premier" then to "Home & Business" versions based on my situation, even though I did not need added "advice", just what I had filed with TurboTax Deluxe for 2013! Aggravating!

3) During the final reviews, several errors had to be corrected, but the information provided by TurboTax was insufficient to guide me to what needed to be corrected, why there was an error at all, and what my options were to correct the error. I had to make several guesses at what to correct, try again, guess again, and try again, several times before sufficient corrections were made to allow me to finish my return and e-file. required me to upgrade my Mac OS; forced TurboTax upgrades on me; difficulty finding errors

column2: scammed with the turbo plus Filing was very quick and easy...however, I chose the turbo free edition and chose to insert all of my info on my own. When getting through to the end and selecting a payment method for my state taxes I chose to subtract from my federal.. Then while reading the sunrise bank agreement form saw where I was being charged the 29.99 for state taxes and the 29.99 for turbo plus---I am guessing this was decided when I chose to deduct from my federal. However I did not see a check yes for plus anywhere. So after realizing that I went back to select payment method and chose use my credit card. Well after putting in my credit card info and clicking submit it then shows I was STILL charged 59.98. This really frustrated me! I chose to put all of my info in because I did not mind doing it myself and I wanted to save the other 29.99. Not right at all! paid more money and still did the work

Sneaky fees The "free" online edition ended up costing me $60. The big problem is that I am not sure how it became $60. I agreed to pay $30 for efiling the state return but then somehow I got upgraded to Turbo Tax plus I think. If I was not doing this at the very last minute for my 80 year old mother-in-law I would have punted on this.

column1: I have been a loyal, paying Turbo tax customer for years. I am getting tired of the constant sneaky, ever increasing fees and all the sales pitches (especially in a product I have already paid for). I think I will try a different tax program next year. Sneaky fees.

column2: No Option to NOT file City Taxes 1. Bring back Turbo Tax Basic -- NOT COOL not offering it this

column1: year when in years past it was offered....AND it was FREE!
2. Don't jam your customers into using the deluxe version after they enter their HSA information. VERY NOT COOL.

3. Most importantly, FIX the software to allow users to opt out of filing city taxes!!!!!! This was the second year in a row where I had not choice in this matter. Instead, I had to enter fake data just to have the system accept and move past this "error" so that I could my state taxes Price and software forcing customers to use deluxe version after HSA information obtained

column2: Extra fees Turbo tax was great besides the hidden fee they snuck in at the end. It was 29.99 to e-file. Well they charged me an extra 29.99 for selecting turbo tax plus ( which I idnt do). Every time I tried to remove it, there would only be $$ signs and no amounts when I went through the list of charges. Not ok!!!! The extra $29.99 hidden fee that I tried to get rid of and couldnt.

Ok for Late Filing Turbo Taxes is extremely easy to navigate. But, as someone who works primarily on contracts (1099-MISC), I wasn't able to receive nearly as many write off's from TurboTax as I was when I worked with a CPA last year. It's possible that if I had purchased the home edition, for nearly twice the starting price, I would have found what I was looking for. But, I'm not sure. Didn't provide the deductions I received when I had a CPA prepare my taxes

This is a rip-off I thought that I was getting the free return and was giving my credit card to pay my amount due to the IRS and instead I was paying the $29..99 Turbo tax fee. This is a rip-off with no way to cancel the payment. Very unhappy and will not use turbo tax again ever. Wanted the free return
Complex Taxes are Beyond What Consumers Can Handle Several of the instructions seemed to assume prior knowledge of processes of which we knew nothing about.

column1: After following all of the instructions for each section as best we could, the software "found" 21 errors, many of which we could not fix without completely filling out whole sections again, but with different values which would have been inaccurate.
I will no longer use TurboTax. I will hire a professional form now on. I don't trust TurboTax any more. Following the straight forward instructions created errors.

column2: Have used for years now it's a "Bait and Switch" Not worth the cost when it keeps making you upgrade for each form extra. I will spend my money with a pro next time. the cost would have been close to the same.Last year TurboTax was getting bad now it is!!!!!! cost went up and up as i needed two extra forms.
I was in the 12th hour You say at the beginning it is free which it has been for me. Then you charge me $89.98. Pure rip off. Especially for someone who makes less than $20,000. The $89.98 Fee
Money, money, money  If I hadn't been late filing I never would have use it. Trapped into paying for audit I didn't want. No free return here
Same as usual, bu a heck lot more expensive like the software, but the increase in price is overwhelming. I'm almost to the point of going to another vendor and/or paper filing.

column1: little sad since i've used your software for a decade, but never got any reduction in price for being a loyal customer. more expensive than previous or competitors

column2: Expense was misleading. You took advantage of me. I owed no taxes. I have paid my dues for many years.

column1: I am on SS disability. My only income.
Was under the impression that I would be using the free version of TurboTax, but because I had one misc 1099 you charged me
Because I submitted 1 misc 1099. Ridiculous !!!
I live in my sons home and have been sick for a number of years.
Probably should not have filled. To expensive

column2: I have always loved Turbo Tax I have always loved using Turbo Tax in the past but since I purchased a Windows 8.2 PC, Turbo Tax has gone down hill in my eyes. Turbo Tax should have stated why their system does not work properly on Win8.2. They should have investigated and found what is needed by the user and state what needs to be downloaded to correct the problem that is happening to the Win8.2 community. Not to just say that the user needs to download all updates to their system. This shows that Turbo Tax does not value their customers like they used to. Probably the last time I will use Turbo Tax to prepare my taxes. TurboTax cannot be used with Windows 8.2 apparently.

Wasted hours of my personal time Twice I had to purchase Home and Business because of software glitches. Spent several hours on the phone with TurboTax Technical Support (which were wonderful) to get the state portion of my taxes to download correctly (one time it didn't and they had to issue me a free use of the online version, which for the same price as the CD is a one time use hence the purchase a second time only to experience the same problem. 10 hours of wasted nonproductive personal time because of software problems

Caught off guard - in a bad way... I re-entered all of my tax info from last year (free version). Then, towards the end it forced me to upgrade to deluxe ($55!) because I had a 1099-Misc form. I disclosed that I had this form at the beginning! Couldn't you have upgraded me then so I didn't have to re-enter everything?! The software waited until after I had committed a significant amount of time to tell me. Very disappointing and it ended up costing me half of my tax refund. Needless to say, I am very upset and will not likely be selecting turbo tax to file my return next year. I have heard good things about tax slayer though...

column1: Other than that, I think the Turbo Tax is great and this is like my 4th year using it in a row! - I just feel like I was mislead is all. Hidden Agenda

column2: sucked for efile when using credit card worst tax service when u have problems. I revived 2 phone calles after 2 hrs and both hung up after saying "just a min" Could not pay my efile state tax using my credit card. 2 days later still nothing so finally had to send the tax my mail. my state tax efile never went trough could not pay using credit card
Confusing Check-out - -Yeah, you got me. see cons above.

column1: you advertise discounts, but during checkout using online system, you charge $39 for state. this is rip off because I could down load the program and run locally, but this was not understood until very end. Extremely misleading. If I had another product, I would try their's before yours.
but every year the scam changes slightly, no discount for me ever. even though i go through vanguard. extremely difficult/impossible to get filing options and price I wanted/that was advertised

column2: Con Artists The number of times this software tries to con you into paying them substantial amounts of money for no reason is absurd. Bad ethics. Constantly tries to con you out of money
Good but Very Expensive 3 start rating due to it proving to be more and more expensive every year to use turbo tax software Getting very expensive including the state e-filing fee
Costs too much on turbo website. Cheaper from other retailers. Over-charged
fee are ungodly the 34.99 to take the charges from my return is a little much fees charged

Extra fees . I did not like the way turbo tax charges fees after they advertise free return., one instance is the audit defense fee and it is really burdensome to get it and other fees you' all come up with.
Lots of bugs. Support was good. Taxes mostly good. Bugs:

column1: * Wouldn't allow me to print or save. Eventually crashed. (Fortunately I found a recoverable temp file.) Turns out this was because I had an expired email associated with my Intuit account. (Impactful despite having bought an offline download copy.) Took an hour on the phone with support to resolve. Support was very helpful, professional, and friendly, but blocking me from saving was not an appropriate software response.

* Wouldn't give me the option to elect the Amazon bonus despite having purchased off TurboTax.com and meeting all the requirements. (Didn't reject me, just didn't offer it.) Lost opportunity cost of $460. Tried reinstalling per support pages. No luck.
Confusing K1:
* Spent nearly 4 hours trying to map the information on my K1s to the TurboTax questionnaire. Lots of software bugs. Entering a K1 was very confusing.

column2: A Few Good Glitches The product kept prompting for review of the 1098 but without a way to fix it. It was obviously a wellkknown problem indicated by the results when searching for the problem. 1. generate a fix and 2. do a better job of preventing the problem in the first place. 1098 Import Bug

Better than doing it by hand? Overall, it was a more pleasant experience than picking up the basic forms and filling them out by hand. The software asks a series of questions lifted directly from the tax forms that are given.

column1: I have three major complaints:

1. The software, during its "Final Steps" stage, asked me to find out how to "avoid insurance penalties in the future", despite the fact that I've been insured all year long (and my return reflected this). The redirect took me to what I sincerely HOPE is an internal site, that asked for some personal information and at the end told me there was nothing more to do. This is just plain bad practice.
2. There was a field that was missing from one of my W2 forms, and there was no description of said field provided when TurboTax demanded I provide the box.

3. Although we paid for a boxed version instead of using the free federal edition, we were still obligated to pay for our state tax return. We would not purchase in the future if we must buy the state taxes separately anyway. Although not strictly deceptive on their part, it is counter-intuitive and a more clear labelling pointing out that state is not included with the basic Home edition would help. Deceptive "Final Steps" portion, didn't label some of the fields

column2: 2014 Filing  confusing. I paid for Fed & state, but only wanted to file Fed. cannot delete state after payment.
No many choices I did Business and Home.

column1: Everything went ok until the "REVIEW" part.
This is when things got bad. The program will tells you that something is wrong, but it will not help you with the solution...
Ex:
What is MACRS, or ACRS? ?????
What is the Depreciation Type? ??.... how should I know, the program is supposed to help you decide what is the best choice.
It also ask me for the length of the depreciation.... ??? one more time, how should I know.
And the the top of the pie.......
FORM 2106 Adj Wks Line 51 Depreciation Percentage??
Really? are you asking me what is the Depreciation Percentage on something that I have no clue. That is the reason I bought this program on the first place.

Final Review needs to have a solution to the actual issue, maybe even take you to the actual part of the program where the issue is caused. The other 10%. The rest of the information, guessing for the best.

column2: Direct Deposit Fee I have been using turbo tax for several years now. I am disappointed at the fee amount for direct deposit. I fully understand the filing fees, but the direct deposit fee? For that reason alone, I will not likely use Turbo-Tax again, and perhaps will discourage anyone else from using it. the cost of having the refund direct deposited.
Good year for the DL Jones' Really struggled with K-1 stuff again this year. Wish the instructions matched the Turbo Tax questions better!! Need more work in the investment forms and guidelines.
so so  state should be free to e file all included!!!!!!!
Too may hidden charges Wish total would have been displayed so I knew total cost but things kept getting added on. Will not be using next year. too simple at times

Multiple add on costs They promote "Free tax filing" but to no surprise it ended up costing just under $90.00. I used turbo tax last year. To retrieve needed info from last years filing required paying their basic service. I have an HSA account through my employer. This one simple item that involves answering roughly 10 questions required I now pay for their deluxe service. Then when I am ready to send in the e-file, they tell you there is yet an additional second party bank fee which then brought the cost up to just under $90.00. If they were up front with these add on's I would be OK with it, but as it is I will go with some other service next year. Started as "FREE" but multiple add on cost
Over charged for services Over charged $39 even after I changed pay method. Over charged

Rediculously low refund I like that you have some of my info already in the system when I do my taxes. And it's easy to file. But so time consuming. Don't like that I had to pay 29.99 for filing my state with my federal and then you take it out of my federal refund! Doesn't make any sense. Would be nice if it didn't cost so much too. Having to pay 29.99 for state!
DISAPPOINTED AFTER MANY YEARS USING TURBO TAX THE PROGRAM ITSELF IS EXCELLENT. IT HAS THREE MAJOR FLAWS.

column1: 1. IT IS VERY FRUSTRATING TO SEE A BOX THAT SAYS "SORRY IT IS TAKING MORE THAN A MOMENT" WHEN IT IS TAKING MANY MINUTES TO ACTUALLY LOAD!

2. THERE ARE FLAWS IN THE SYSTEM IN THAT IT TOLD ME I COULD NOT FILE STATE TAX ELECTRONICALLY AND THEN ALMOST HAD ME PAYING $29.99 TO PAY A FEE TO FILE THE STATE TAX ELECTRONICALLY. THIS WAS VERY CONFUSING!

3. A CHARGE OF 2.4+% TO USE A CREDIT CARD IS HIGHWAY ROBBERY!!! IF THIS IS REALLY A CHARGE FROM YOUR CREDIT CARD PROVIDER YOU NEED TO FIND A NEW CREDIT CARD PROVIDER. I HAD TO USE IT THIS YEAR BECAUSE I WAS LATE FILING BUT IN THE FUTURE I WILL NEVER USE A CREDIT CARD AGAIN AND PAY THIS EXORBITANT FEE.

I HAVE USED TURBO TAX FOR MANY YEARS AND HAVE RECOMMENDED IT TO MANY PEOPLE BUT WHILE I WILL CONTINUE USING TURBO TAX MYSELF I CANNOT IN ALL FAIRNESS RECOMMEND IT ANY LONGER. TAKES WAY, WAY TOO LONG TO INITIALIZE TURBO TAX PROGRAM AND FOR THE FIRST TIME EVER CONFUSED HOW TO PAY

column2: not happy with a few things I was EXTREMELY frustrated to spend 2 hours totaling my medical expenses only to find they didn't matter when we took the standard deduction instead. The prompts/form should be more specific as to perhaps first inform what the standard deduction is so that people will be dissuaded from going through the work of totaling deductions if they already know they won't meet a certain amount.

column1: The second thing that I'm not happy about is that at the VERY end I was told I HAD to upgrade to complete the process. No specification as to WHY I needed to upgrade. After I agreed to upgrade, I was only asked one further question, and it was whether or not we had had health insurance all year. Since this is the LAW now, it seems that it should be part of the standard filing process. ALSO, we had already answered many questions about health insurance that should have already answered the last one. If it was required to upgrade for THAT question alone, was ANYONE able to file for free? I would have not been so frustrated had the reasons for my need to upgrade been laid out specifically. I have to assume there was some other reason, or you intentionally led people to believe they could file for free when they couldn't. In taking the standard deduction, and having fairly standard answers to the questions, I do'nt know why we needed to upgrade. You need to make that clearer in the process. For $60 I could have paid a real person to do my taxes and saved myself hours. Thanks, a lot of wasted time

column2: nickel and dime you to death Whatever you pay for the software isn't the final price.

Ridiculous... I just paid $136 to get my taxes finished. Seriously? This hurts the middle/lower class when you charge 54.99 for federal, and 39.99 for each state. This needs to be changed to a lower rate or next year and every other year I will go somewhere else no matter how easy to use, $136 is way too much. WAY too expensive!!!

Difficulty Increase Never , in the many years that I use this program this year has been the most challenging. Why am I being charged not only to file for state but if I sign of for Federal Free and have to pay 29.99, it says free for a reason, right? Cost, and hidden fees

You start out by selecting the free filing option and then the program prompts you to upgrade to make sure you can all of your deductions. It is not until the end when you are told there is a fee to charge you having the fees deducted from your account. Why do you have to pay a fee for getting other fees deducted. That takes away from any additional money the programs saves you, it all goes to fees. Fees

Not as helpful as they seem... Every year I've used TurboTax, they give this list of tax breaks I've apparently qualified for. Yet, every year, I wait for those numbers on the side to change. And guess what? They don't ! Tax breaks my balls. Every year I've used TurboTax I've owed more taxes than ever. I'm going back to JacksonHewitt next year. Everything else

couldn't get any help with a problem with line 16b stating that I had 2 home businesses when I don't ... Others had the same problem with no resolutions, I spent hours trying to fix it and still could e-filing my State forms ... It really sucked !!!

CHANGES TO TURBO TAX MADE IT HARDER TO USE IT DEFINITELY AVERAGE THIS YEAR. Cont_D DID NOT WORK TO OVERRIDE. HARDER TO GET BACK TO DETAILED EXPENSES ON SCHEDULE E. DID POOR JOB OF EXPLAINING CHANGES TO NC TAXES. HAD TO CALL STATE TO GET ANSWERS. THEY REPLIED MUCH QUICKER THAN TURBOTX DIFFICULT TO NAVIGATE, HARD TO FIX ERRORS WITHOUT LINK TO FORM
So sneaky more charges and upgrades on every page horrible. so sneaky. extra charges every page. it is almost impossible to file using their "free" service. ridiculous extra charges for everything

average turbo tax charged me more than double for the same service as my uncle and he got back thousands...i owed the state 1 dollar and you charged me 50 to file.only got 900 back from the federal and you charged 50 for that..please explain to me why so expensive for something that is done by a computer that does not breath ..that was a rip off and i prob. would never use your service again. what are you people thinking... was double the cost of a married couple....was no value
good but costs too much I think charging $54 for something you fill out yourself is pretty steep! cost way too much

Penny Pinching There should be no limit to how many forms I can file. Even if it's just the free version, but I understand that this website is run as a business. I should be able to run through a program (would love to file electronically through the IRS directly) and file my taxes inputing whatever forms I have, deductions, expenses, etc. Having to "upgrade (or fail to file properly)" is really nasty. For me it just kept stepping up the need for more "help" that did almost nothing for me at all.

column1: The biggest help was getting to talk with an actual tax professional for an hour. He was insightful, towards taxes not TurboTax's business decisions about upgrading users unnecessarily, and not at all rushed or curt. Wish I could remember his name. Bless that guy!!! Only reason my review gives 3 stars. Upgrading your software

column2: 0 Stars I paid for plus even though I didn't want it and wasn't given the option to review my order before my card was charged. Expensive

Idiot proof, but spendy I loved how easy this was, but it seems a little ridiculous to me that I was charged $30 on my $37 state return. I could see $10 to e-file both the federal AND the state, but $30 is a little steep to me. $30 to file my state return

Slow, sticky, hard to revise, EXPENSIVE I have used Turbo Tax for years and this year was the worst. I found it irritating, slow, hard to understand and expensive. Just to file a normal return with federal and state, and a TINY home business (which used to be covered by "Deluxe") was about $150. That's a lot of money. I could have gone to HR Block, and maybe I will next time. Some of the questions that came up during "review" were NEVER asked/covered during the input. Also, it's hard to access forms, and several times it told me I had errors but I couldn't access the forms to simply correct them. Way too expensive for what you get; Slow; Too much repetition

Was great until.. So It costs me 30 dollars to file my taxes, and another 30 for turbotax plus for direct deposit. Yet, I have a Chase Liquid account and cant make a direct deposit as I do not have checks, and currently(4/15/15 9:06pm) my bank is not open so I cannot call for a routing number. Their website is also down. Kind of conveinient for Intuit since I couldn't go back and redo the section that charged me more money. Thanks! Make thirty bucks per person that files, then sixty for the poor fools like me!! User Interface

Finicky I was filling out part of my return, and I noticed that the PLUS had popped up next the regular TurboTax name, and when I saw the bill, it charged me an extra 30 bucks. The only way for me to be able to downgrade would be to start from scratch and reenter all of my data. Now, I've already got a headache so I just paid the charge instead of redoing everything. Sneaky charges.
good for the self starter Generally really useful and easy to use. had issues entering 1099 info this year, had to do it several times
Average refund Average, step by step is convenient, questions not always answered If you have questions they are not always completely answered, if at all
After being a loyal customer for years this will be my last year to use turbo tax. Prices have become ridiculous and for doing all the work myself your pricing is UNJUSTIFIED.

Unrightfully Charged I was billed for premium service (39.99), which I did not use. IF you choose to "start from scratch" and provide all your information all over and not use the saved information from the previous tax year, users were supposed to bypass this free. Instead I wasted my time by 'starting from scratch' because I was STILL billed the 39.99. For some of you reading this review, you're probably thinking it's just "39.99", but for a college student receiving a $60 return and a $20 return makes a difference. That extra $40 could have been used for groceries or even utilities for my apartment. I am disappointed in TurboTax, last year it worked perfectly, and I was not tacked with extra fees. I even called the support number, but have no received a call back, but I am almost positive TurboTax will not refund my 39.99 back to my account. I will post an update, IF I am reimbursed 39.99 for the premium fee which I DID NOT utilize.

Confused in California California is not accepting e-filing this year apparently... Tried to charge me $24.99 and then rather than simply tell me the option is not available they tell me my credit card is no good...

column1: Not good... Wasted a lot of my time... Offering an e-file option in California

column2: Had to re-do my return on-line b/c I used up the five chances to e-file per my desktop. I had to pay an additional $120 to file and then e-file my return. The cost is excessive and after twelve (12) years of using Turbo Tax, I will make a switch next year.... Two THUMBS down...

confusing and dumbed down from prior years I can't believe how you tried to simplify things and ended up giving not enough info. The biggest issue I had was that you took the form box away so there was no way to see the actual form for a certain point of input. I have a masters in taxation and I was really disappointed with how the software worked this year. dumbed down software; have to get super complicated version to do simple things
Over Charged the Poor Folk  Price too high for federal & state taxes to pay to file!

e-file was terrible I have used TurboTax for 8 years to do my taxes and have enjoyed using it every year as it was very user friendly. This year everything went smooth and was working good until it needed to be submitted. It was not clear on what was needed for a PIN or AGI number. This needs to be easier or I will not use this product again in the future. the efile continued to fail and was not a simple solution to gte it worked out.
Changed Versions?? For the last 8 years we have used Turbo Tax Deluxe Version. I have a home-based sales business and Deluxe always covered what we needed.

column1: This year we bought Deluxe version and tried to enter tax info for home-based business and a screen popped up stating I need the Home & Business Addition. And that I can buy it now for only $40! I just paid $59.99 and now you want another $40 because you didn't let people know you changed the software. If I would have known this ahead of time, I could have purchased the Home & Business addition for the same price as the Deluxe at the store! Software Changes

column2: Im very dissatisfied that I chose the free edition and I was still charged 29.99 to file my federal and 29.99 to file my state, I agreed to teh state, I only got back 37 from state so you got all of that besides $6. I feel that if I choose no thanks I don't want to upgrade than don't upgrade it at th end and then when I try to go back through it won't let me change anything.
too many sales pitches wish there was another similar package; i'd switch in a minute too many sales pitches; difficult to change things from prior year

Obummer care tax I will not be using turbo tax again because of theObama care tax penalty. Turbo Tax did not read the part of the UNCONSTITUTIONAL LAW that the penalty is only collected through refunds!!!! I could not transmit my Federal return without paying the penalty or using a installment plan. The IRS can only collect the fine thru REFUNDS ONLY!!!!!! This is what happens when communist Democrats are in control.

Quick, but full of bugs TurboTax made filing my taxes quicker than it has been before. I did run into trouble on both my state and federal returns with going back and making changes to entries. Forms I no longer needed did not disappear completely, and there was no easy way to solve the problem. Too many bugs when making changes
horrible,I was in the middle of filing and my taxes owed jumped by 2000. the ira contributions fell from 11000 to 5500. program sucked
Painful process this year  Not being able to access last year's tax return because it was completed on iPad

Not as good as previous versions for knowledgable I preferred the old version, before it was streamlined. It let me get into the nitty gritty, which I liked. I always have to worry about my investments and now I have a house, too, and I wanted details, not to be babysat 100%. I'm sure there's a happy middle available, but they swung too far for me. OTOH, I do trust that they got my taxes right - I hope so! It made it hard to dive into specific tax form sections and get explanations of them

WTF It is kinda nice to have something like this. It is very confusing though. The ? buttons only add to the confusion. When I did the estimate it claimed I would get back $1300. When I did the actual tax forms I owed $150. I entered the same info that the estimate had me enter. Why was it $1400 less? Very confusing

Horrible Product- never using again Will never be using TurboTax again. The company handicapped the program and constantly wants you to upgrade it to get more features. Its nothing but a running sales pitch for a product that should give you everything you need to file a return without a constant barrage of different versions and upgrades.

column1: This is a prime example of how not to market a product and how not to retain your customers. Bye Intuit.... Too many upgrade gimmicks

column2: Good features, bait and switch I have used turbo tax to file for years. I selected the free option, as normal. Instead of the regular $50 processing fee, I was charged $104. Never told which product charged that high, never given an option to select a different product. Would have been fine paying if the pricing was upfront. Now I just feel duped. Thanks Bait and Switch Fees

DOB You tell me i have been rejected because my birthdate isn't correct. I was born on 10/16/1930 and that HAS NOT changed. I am now 84 years old. This is CORRECT and ALWAYS has been. I have filed my taxes for several years with Turbo Tax. Now, this year, the only way to get past information carried forward is to pay you for it. We have little to no income and for many years, since retirement, only gotten back $60 from the state of CA. So we did EZ, therefore not having to pay the $40+ dollars, and for some reason the DOB isn't correct. This is very frustrating and concerning for a man of my age. You tell me my birthdate isn't correct.

Sucked a** Screw this option, never filing with turbo tax again!! It's not free at all, it was $30, plus $30 for state, then at the very end there was an additional $40 upgrade I didn't request, and TurboTax wouldn't file my return without that upgrade/service fee. Complete waste of money! I'd rather sit down with a CPA to do my taxes... at least I know whatever he/she charges will be going back into my community and not to some internet company with hidden fees! pis*ed away $100

Lost my deductions Not only did I lose the list of deductions that I entered directly, but my 2013 file was also lost. All I had left was my pdf. All the data had to be entered all over again. No prior year history could be retrieved. I have used Turbo Tax for years and this is the first time my data was wiped from my laptop. I was on the phone for a while with a Turbo Tax expert and they could not find my data anywhere. This was the first time I entered data directly into It's Deductible without printing it out or writing it down, and this was the time my data was lost. I further discovered I was not the only one. No one else found their data either. Very disappointing, and leaves me trusting the program less. All the data I entered was lost before I actually filed
I pay extra for the state version and then there's a surprise e-filing charge at the very end - that's a horrible way to run a company. hidden fees
Upgrade process is a trap Horrible upsell to $80 product to file one security gain. horrible. Suckered me into think I could use free and then switched to add one stock sell

Overly complicated Very frustrating. This could have taken less than half of the time, if it weren't for all the attempted product sales, and having to constantly re-enter information that had already been taken care of -- sometimes on the page immediately previous. Very, very annoying, that.

column1: Filing fee was ridiculously high.
I did not appreciate - at all - being bombarded with "offers" to spend more money on tax products I neither needed nor wanted. Doesn't remember LOTS of info already covered

column2: costs too much It's a tax program, nothing special. The costs are too high especially for efiling states. The cost for the program should be less for those who have purchased in the past. costs for efiling states is too much

Hidden fees First, it was free. Then I had a 1099 and that required upgrading to deluxe= $55. Then I had to pay another $40 because I had moved to a different state the last two months of 2014. Fine. I'll pay that. So now at $99, I went to pay. It went from the screen saying I would be paying $99, to the screen where I entered in my credit card. Turns out there was another $40 fee that wasn't listed or mentioned. The price of using the site kept increasing.

Pop Up Fees I do not appreciate, nor do I know how to remove the fee that is charged at the final filing step. This is a fee that is not outlined or offered, it is falsely labeled as a "free" perk and then you are hit with a 39.99 fee. Pop Up Fees

Overview I had a hard time finding out my PIN from last year, so when I did, I got everything finalized and submitted it. I recieved an e-mail that it was rejected. So I went back in to re-submit it, and was rejected yet again. Tried a third time and recieved a text messgae on my cell that it was accepted. So now I go back on the site to see if I can submit my state taxes and it now says my federal was rejected yet again.Doubt if I use this site ever again YOU DON"T KNOW IF IT WAS TRANSMITTED

Another year, another return, another headache The main flaw with this program is the boneheaded exclusion of MacOSX 10.6 Snow Leopard compatibility. Just for yuks, I prepared my 2014 taxes with a competing product, and - after repartitioning & installing Mountain Lion - with TurboTax Premier 2014. Needless to say, creating a single-purpose partition with a different OS version than my daily production environment is a hassle.

column1: In some ways TTP2014 _is_ superior to the competitor. For example, the Easy Step Interview is significantly more-thorough.

But there is one flaw with TTP2014 that was maddening. After properly entering Form 1099-B short-term sales, which passed muster with the Federal Review, the same data was improperly transferred to the State Return Schedule D/E. I got several "Excess characters on line 7" errors that were INCREDIBLY difficult to correct. Maybe my state's return was wonky, maybe _all_ states are. Don't know. Boneheaded exclusion of MacOSX 10.6 Snow Leopard compatibility

column2: Glitches in eFile Tried to eFile several times over the span of two weeks. The program would not allow me to enter my payment information. The first two times I was not able to reach a Customer Service Representative. I was finally able to reach them using the call-back feature, which was not offered during the previous attempts. In addition, the program offered me a free upgrade to Home and Business, but again, it would not allow me to pay for it, or get it for free, even though offered. I've used TurboTax for several years and am very disappointed in this year's software. eFile didn't work

not going to use you anymore, tired of getting charged twice for the same thing, i bought premier with one state but get charged again at the end, been trying to log in to your site for two hours, going back to either tax act or h and r. might try tax slayer.

wound up in an endless loop Got all the way through and got an error message about my state return when I tried to file is electronically. I corrected the typo, but then wound up not being able to file my state return because my federal had already gone through. It's now 9 pm on April 15 and I can't file!
they said it was free, but they deducted money from my return for their services

takes forever to print was going through and notice the program did not ask about state refund, one good way to get audited. other issues are some times it takes longer to do a return if it is an easy return too many questions, The other is where is auto fill? type in zip and state and city auto fills in.

column1: Having a lot of trouble doing an amended return,,, HELP difficult to go back and correct an error you know you did

column2: Too much money  Fails to explain technical review questions

Cheated by the fees I thought i was getting a good deal but than they made me updgrade for 30.00 and another 24 to file state electronicly. I was not notified in advance that the state filing would be extra. I have useed other products in the past and found them just as easy to use. I was twice asked for fees

Not working! Frustrating to file a return when the system doesn't process correctly. I tried to pay the Intuit filing fees and it kept saying they couldn't validate my credit card. But when looking on my online banking app, it says that it processed a debit 4 times! Worst thing was that it would not let me get to the next step in the process. I finally had to call support and wait 45 min to get someone who gave me an access code to get through that screen and finish my efile. Now I have to wait and find out if they took my money from my bank account multiple times or did it correctly. Not a feel good feeling if there is no resolution to my bank debits. I feel like they have my money $144.98 x 4 = almost $600!!! Payment method did not work and charged my bank multiple times
Lastminutegirl  The cost of the state taxes and then you have to pay another 20 something to file them. That is quite the ripoff!

Triple dipping The service is what is to be expected: your taxes are filed and you pay a small fee, which I am more than ok with. It's not optimal but I'm obliged by the polish on the site. Now what I dislike is the double dipping they do with the 'audit protection' and the visa that charges a fee every time it's used and a fee every month- both of which it hides on a separate window. Now if everyone one in the US was smart enough to read said window it wouldn't be a problem, but seeing how it's the easiest repayment option people will almost definitely choose it. Using this 'computerized fine print' is, to me, borderline predatory. The money gouging and hiding of fees or pushing ridiculous tacked on services

"free" Its like a minefield. They prey on our lack of tax knowledge and rip money out of our wallet at every opportunity. Go to a professional. I will never use this program again, and will advise everyone I know far and wide to do the same. I guarantee the money they took from me will cost THEM far more as I tear their company apart to everyone at every POSSIBLE opportunity. Hidden fees everywhere

GREAT BUSINESS PLAN I should have filed a 1040-EZ and was duped into paying more by getting confused by the questions and didn't have anything needed.... But hats off to you INTUIT that is an amazing business plan! Overchargd, Confused in to paying more for stuff i don'r need.

Very Disappointed I have utilized Turbo Tax Deluxe for many years and have been extremely pleased with the ease of the program, but this year was a mess. This years offerings were very fractured and confusing and I had no idea if I should continue to use Turbo Tax but I have had success every year so I gave it a try.

column1: What a mistake!
How sad that something so productive and helpful has become a questionable product.
Next year I will be using a local tax preparer instead of Turbo Tax. cost unclear until completed and unexpected amount, missing forms

column2: deluxe was not deluxe cost me more to buy premier what intuit did with deluxe this year was shameful. I am not sure how it was ethical. Bottom-line I had to pay more for no more and it was not clearly highlighted (i.e., Bold statement on front cover of product) bait and switch product from previous year- must read fine print
Refund Turbo Tax is easy to use and like that I can get questions answered while working on worksheet.

column1: Still do not understand why offer free Fed and then make you pay $54.99 after you complete work. Feel like bait and switch. change of price at completion of worksheets

column2: Too Expensive as the Years Go By The software was easy to use and speed has gotten better over the years. The price is increasing too much to the point we are considering going back to using government forms to file. We also were not fond of the additional finance charges and price of this year's software. Getting too pricey and don't appreciate the finance charge and add-on fees.

Extra Fee for paying with Fedral Refund I don't appreciate you hiding the additional charge for paying with my federal refund and not telling me I would save by paying with my debit card. Everything else is easy to follow. This part was confusing, took additional time and overall shady... Confusing
2014 product was flawed terrible that you knew prod was faulty but left it on the market. i trusted because used it for years. last time using needed updates but errro 42016 would not allow

Sneaky Hidden Fees Due to these hidden fees, I will not be filing with Turbo Tax next year. The program works well, but cost nearly as much as my return was to file! I had spent two hours and gotten all the way through my taxes before I found out I had to pay to file. This was very fr
How did I get charged for TurboTaxPlus? I said no thank you and was charged anyway. Now i have to call up and get this taken care of - and will see how you handle that.

column1: Whether I would consider using this again will depend on how you handle this.
The product was easy enough but none to happy about the extra charge.

column2: GOT MY REFUND I LIKE TURBOTAX; HOWEVER, I STILL HAD TO GO TO THE IRS PUBLICATIONS TO GET A BETTER UNDERSTANDING COULD PROVIDE MORE DETAILS FOR RENTAL PROPERTY

Forced to go Premium Turbotax will force me to upgrade to Premium when the Delux version has worked fine and my Tax situation hasn't changed. I'll be removing my automatic annual subscription and looking at competing products for 2015. Expensive
Ripoff Turbo Tax charged me $40 some dollars for the premium program and didn't use it. My information was suitable for basic return but Turbo Tax didn't refund me the unnecessarily paid money.

column1: Next time I will use another tax preparation method. ripoff

column2: Deluxe version is a ripoff It's like a recent insurance commercial - "Are you paying for this (a lot) when you only need this (a little)?" As I started to pay, I realized I didn't need or want TurboTax Deluxe, which was the default version they started me on. I had an EZ form, so I instead wanted to use the more cost-efficient standard TurboTax. But since I couldn't easily get out of the payment loop, I wound up paying $100 I probably didn't need to.

column1: I won't deny that I should have been paying closer attention, but I think a more reputable business would have included at least one prompt (especially with TT's "chatty" prompts) to say, "Hey, your return looks pretty simple. Maybe you don't need to use this Deluxe version."
I've used TT for the past 4 or 5 years. Because of this, however, I will not be using TurboTax ever again. Once I had paid, they wouldn't let me change to more cost-efficient version.

column2: Costly Spent over $90 for usually cost me $55. I will find another way next year. cost to much for the service

$$$$ Turbo Tax Purchase price is just the start I purchased the Deluxe tax program for $48 thru Amazon and found I had to upgrade to Premier, I was charged an additional $30 for the upgrade. Had I purchased Premier first it would have only been $54 not $78. I read somewhere an upgrade to premier was free due to changes. Hmmmm I think not. Then when it came time to file my state taxes I am charged another $25 for filing. I thought it was included in my purchase price. I think I will check out other tax programs next year. Intuit is just not making me happy. Turbo tax requires additional money that is not mentioned in the product review.

Like it less and less every year Over the years turbotax has become less user friendly, much more difficult to go through, much too expense, ridculously so in fact. It truly sucks now when, previously, it was easier to navigate, cheaper to use and clearer in every way. I actually hate how it is now and will no longer use it. many

This year's Turbo Tax had some inaccuracies and did not allow changes I needed to make . I will probably use another tax program next year. The program did not allow me to change items so I had to re-do an entire return.

Whoa! Lots of changes this year.... Retired with income from wages, stocks and retirement accounts - love the interview and loading of forms from brokerages. Tax piece was as easy as I've come to expect from TTax.

column1: This year the process for planning estimate payment for this year felt different and frankly, poor. I could go into specifics and change it to get it right, but got done without an interview process on what's going to be different next year. Big space for improvement.... Planning felt less intuitive

column2: Efficient, but not satisfied with import of data I purchased TurboTax (for the 3rd year) for the year-over-year consistency with the user interface. This year - for whatever reason - I had to type in my W2 and inputs from my investment accounts despite having imported the same information from my 2013 return. In addition, there was an "upgrade" required to deal with basic investment income from the "Deductions & Homeowner" edition. For TurboTax - let's be realistic about the product segmentation - find me a homeowner without basic HSA and investment income. Did not import W2 correctly

Good Luck with the Special Pricing Like ease of turbotax, but wasted a lot of time trying to get the reduced pricing offered by my bank that would have saved me nearly 20%. Payment page leads you to believe that the price shown may not be the price you'll pay. Click the payment button and surprise, you've paid the full price. Impossible to get reduced filing cost

Gouging us with stupid fees Where do you get off charging me so much for deducting from my refund? I understand the fees for helping me do my taxes, but a charge for ALLOWING you to be paid from my refund? What are you--carrying my money on your back and it's so heavy, you need to charge me labor? No, you're gouging me with exorbitant prices at the end of my process because you know I'm exhausted from answering all the Q' s and scrounging around to find the papers that provide the data. Next year, I'm paying by credit card. You are smiling road robbers. #Refund my fee & I'll stop bad-mouthing you to others.# you don't deserve to charge me for deducting from my refund

too expensive and hidden charges SUCK The search feature should be improved to better locate an item already entered. The $35 to take fees out of my refund is OUTRAGEOUS and just trashy. Classless. I expect that type of lowballing backstabbing from discount tax prep software, but since I'm going to get that poor service from TT, I might as well use discount software next year for MUCH lower rates. TT Was not exceptionally easy to use or provided such extraordinary directions that I feel I should stick with this site. I have used H&R in the bast and they are cheaper, but I plan to go discount next year (TaxACT or similar) trying to find info within an area such as credits, business expenses, etc.
efficient but expensive to use Cost me almost $150 to use turbotax and i had to do it myself expensive could have hired someone

It sucks The price increase is completely self-serving. And now at the deadline to file, the program produces run script errors and will not accept payment for state filing. This prevents the federal form from being filed as well. Guess I will meet many of your customers in prison. Increasede price and give script run errors when trying to pay

WTF After telling me my credit card is no good, I called your number which said your office was closed... Went to my bank today to check on my card. It is perfectly fine... Now I call you again and you put me on hold alternately with a flawed voice recognition AI. When it finally was going to let me talk to someone, you said you would 'call me back'... 'ONCE'... If I miss your call, I'm to call back?!?

column1: WTF? $123.99? For not being able to file?
They call and the call is dropped... Starting over... After three hours you want to bill me another $24.99 to e-file in California and then tell me my credit card is no good

column2: Meh Rejected my credit card and multiple other people I know. They put holds on your account each time you try, so be aware of this before you click it multiple times like I did. It says they can't verify, but yet have no problem holding the funds in your account. Payment

Screwed us over - do not use EVER We only needed to file 1040EZ but it upgraded us without our approval and would not even let us cancel it. I've used TurboTax for years and have never had a problem before but I will NEVER use them again! Screwed us over with fees didn't want or need
After forcing me to buy the most expensive package you added insult to injury by charging me twice.

Super Easy So I loved how easy the app is to use. Only part I didn't like was that I was shown that I would only have to pay $29.99 for federal and state tax. They ended up charging me $59.99 and added on the plus version. I didn't know how to change that and I also waited until the last minute to file my taxes so I just paid it. I will probably not use turbo tax next year because of it. over charged me
